Project_Title: High-Pressure Facility for Biomass Conversion, Hydrothermal Chemistry and Corrosion Research under Hydrogen and/or in Super-Critical Water.
Project_Description: The requested High-Pressure Facility will allow the research team to study the behaviour of aqueous reaction mixtures under extreme reaction conditions. This will enable new approaches to the conversion of non-food biomass to fuel, and contribute to the development of the next generation of CANDU nuclear power plants.

Project_Title: Computational infrastructure for three-dimensional simulations of environmental and geophysical fluid dynamics
Project_Description: This project will expand computer facilities used for computer model development and applied research on the dynamics of fluids in natural bodies of water such as Ontarioâ€™s thousands of lakes. It will enable us to strengthen our research groupâ€™s strong international stature and help attract top tal

Project_Title: Laboratory for neuroscience and musical rhythm investigation
Project_Description: The proposal creates a world-class facility to explore connections between music and movement in brain and behaviour. The infrastructure will enable examination of how music affects non-musical capacities, the neural basis of rhythm, and how music can be therapeutically applied to gait disorders.

Project_Title: Bioorganic Laboratory
Project_Description: The equipment will outfit a bioorganic laboratory for the proper handling, storage, purification, and measurement of biological samples including cells, lipids, proteins, DNA/RNA, and will aid in the organic synthesis of novel biomolecules and potential pharmaceuticals.

Project_Title: Integrative Cell Mechanics Studies Using Liquid Cell Atomic Force Microscopy
Project_Description: The proposed infrastructure and related research will enable systematic development of new, more accurate diagnostic methodologies for the critical early detection of diseases with clear links to cellular abnormalities, such as cancer, cardiovascular disease, and arthritis.

Project_Title: Comparative genetics of innate disease resistance in domestic animals
Project_Description: The proposed infrastructure will support a research program studying the genetic regulation of innate resistance to infectious diseases. The basic aim is to understand how the innate immune response is regulated at the genetic level with a long term goal of identifying selection markers for increased disease resistance in production animals.

Project_Title: High-capacity Dynamic Testing System for Energy Pipelines
Project_Description: The objective of the proposed project is to carry out state-of-the-art experimental investigations on the fracture toughness of pipeline steels and apply the test results in the development of the strain-based design and assessment methodologies for energy pipelines.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: High-energy X-ray micro-computed tomography scanning system for Earth material research
Project_Description: Funding is requested for the acquisition of a high-energy X-ray micro-computed tomography scanner to enable novel research on the atomic-scale processes that govern the formation of rocks, with fundamental applications for the exploration and protection of Ontarioâ€™s natural resource
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Hybrid biomedical optical platform for improved detection and management of brain injury
Project_Description: The objective is to combine optical hardware for near infrared spectroscopy, diffuse correlation spectroscopy, and photoacoustic imaging to enable research into a method that is capable of early detection of brain injury in babies born prematurely.

Project_Title: Understanding pathogenesis of and immune responses to HIV and tuberculosis co-infection
Project_Description: This experienced team of investigators will launch an innovative research programme that will focus on understanding mucosal immuno-pathogenesis and vaccine development for HIV-Tuberculosis co-infection to improve clinical management of these global epidemics.

Project_Title: Driver-Truck-Road Interaction Simulator
Project_Description: A Truck-Driver-Road Interaction Simulator will be purchased to support research in vehicle dynamics, particularly in the area of human factor studies and highway safety.  This research will be of great benefit to Transport Canada and improve highway and driver safety.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots
Lead_Research_Institution: University of Ontario Institute of Technology

Project_Title: Innovative Nutritional and Activity-based Interventions to Improve, Maintain, or Regenerate Skeletal Muscle Health
Project_Description: The research will aim to identify activity- and nutrition-based interventions to increase the mass of skeletal muscle, particularly in aging. This is because skeletal muscle is a key tissue in the development of chronic disease, which currently represents almost 80% of healthcare spending.

Project_Title: Pediatric Pain, Health, and Communication Laboratory
Project_Description: Pain in children is common and unmanaged pain has significant short and long-term consequences. This proposal will enable the development of a leading-edge research facility investigating the complex interplay of factors that impact childrenâ€™s pain and identifying â€˜best practicesâ€™ for interve

Project_Title: Facility for Applications of Advanced Nanomaterials in Energy Storage for Electric Vehicles
Project_Description: The proposed infrastructure will create the first laboratory at Western equipped to work on nanomaterials for energy storage - and in particular for Lithium ion batteries and Lithium-Air batteries which are used in electric vehicles (EV) and plug-in hybrid electric vehicles (PHEV).

Project_Title: Muscle and adipose stem cell analysis
Project_Description: Dr. Anthony ScimÃ¨ conducts state of the art research on adult (i) fat and (ii) muscle stem cells. His research will help unlock answers to questions regarding the emerging field of stem cell commitment to specific muscle and fat tissue subtypes. This has ramifications for contributing innovative and vital data on the Metabolic Syndrome and its primary cause, obesity, which represent a significant Ontario health care problem

Project_Title: Laser Induced Incandescence Instrument for Characterizing the Size and Concentration of Aerosolized Nanoparticles
Project_Description: Engineered nanoparticles are important to materials science, but their functionality depends strongly on their size. This research will transform laser induced incandescence, a combustion diagnostic used to measure soot, into a tool for characterizing aerosolized metal and metal oxide nanoparticles

Project_Title: Global Employment Standards Database (GESD)
Project_Description: Funds are requested for essential infrastructure and the acquisition of small and large-scale survey data from four jurisdictions (Canada, United Kingdom, United States and Australia) to support the development of a Global Employment Standards Database.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Laboratory for the Study of Biomolecular Interations through Micropatterning and High Resolution Fluorescence Microscopy
Project_Description: This research will develop novel methods to engineer artificial environments that mimic the complexity found in nature. Combined with high resolution microscopy, this research will yield a glimpse into how cells recognize, interact with, and respond to biomaterials at the micro and nano-scale.

Project_Title: Studying the Relationship between Social Interaction and Mathematics Learning: The Learning Interaction Lab (LILa)
Project_Description: This project will develop sophisticated, multi-camera video data collection and analysis methods and technology, to address how social interaction and diverse contexts, within and outside classrooms, support success in mathematics learning in Ontario, Canada and internationally.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Bridging the Gap Between Childhood Health and Mental Health
Project_Description: One of the primary aims of this infrastructure project aims to expand the scope of an existing cohort (The OUCH Cohort) of over 700 Ontario children followed over the first 18 months during immunization (now one of the largest in the world).  This cohort aims to better understand and help prevent the significant challenge of not being able to recover from distress properly by examining how caregivers soothe their infants in a routine distressing context. The infrastructure we are proposing enables us to assess these same children in the immunization clinic, school setting and laboratory setting.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for the establishment of the laboratory for the Thermographic Investigation of Sexual Health (TISH)
Project_Description: This proposal is to build a cutting edge research facility for the thermographic study of sexual health that will add to our understanding of: 1) sexual functioning across the lifespan; 2) the interaction between chronic health conditions and sexual functioning; and 3) diagnosis and treatment of sexual dysfunction.

Project_Title: Laboratory for multiphase flow and mass transfer in porous media
Project_Description: The proposed research will use detailed laboratory experiments to better understand the flow of multiple fluids and the mass transfer between those fluids in the subsurface.  Insights will be applied to the cleanup of contaminated soil and groundwater and the geological storage of carbon dioxide.

Project_Title: In Vivo Imaging of Cardiovascular Function
Project_Description: The objective of the proposal is to investigate the underlying molecular and cellular changes associated with heart disease.  The requested infrastructure will be used to examine the function and structure of healthy and diseased mouse hearts.  With the infrastructure, it will allow the applicant to conduct non-invasive longitudinal analysis of heart size and contractile activity in order to examine the development and progression of heart disease.

Project_Title: Acquisition of a Time-Resolved Stereoscopic Particle Image Velocimetry System for Fluid-Structure Interaction Investigations
Project_Description: Coupled interactions between flowing fluids and deformable structures form a rich field of practical engineering problems. The proposed infrastructure will enable a nascent research problem examining the critical issues of speech disorders, flow around implanted stents, and small-scale energy harvesting.

Project_Title: Solid-State Bioreactor and Environmental Biocatalysis Facility
Project_Description: The proposed laboratory facility will enable multiscale studies of biocatalytic processes in soils and other solid-state systems such as municipal, agricultural, or forestry wastes. The research program supported will develop environmental processes for bioremediation, waste treatment, and biofuels production.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for the Study of Host-Pathogen Interactions
Project_Description: This award enables Dr. Brumell to advance his research elucidating the underlying mechanisms of host-pathogen interactions to inform development of novel treatments for bacterial infections and many other common diseases.

Project_Title: Centre for Embryonic Health & Viability (CEHV)
Project_Description: The objective of the present proposal is to develop markers of embryo health and viability. The proposal integrates single embryo culture, biopsied single blastomeric gene expression profiling and mitochondrial function assessment to delineate the molecular and cellular pathways of embryo health.

Project_Title: Nipissing University Organic and Medicinal Chemistry Research Laboratory
Project_Description: Leading-edge research is being conducted which will help target osteoporosis and breast and prostate cancers. Simultaneously, the laboratory is also committed to developing novel efficient green synthetic methodologies to access new and diverse forms of biologically and medicinally relevant organic materials

Project_Title: Simulation and Imaging Laboratory for the Study of Ischemia Reperfusion Injury and Inflammation in Transplantation
Project_Description: Ischemia reperfusion injury (IRI) is a major cause of kidney failure and is a limitation to kidney transplantation. This proposal, submitted by two emerging clinician scientists, will use advanced technologies to study the key elements of IRI, including inflammation, to improve patient outcomes.

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Support Integrated Cardio-Respiratory Research
Project_Description: Dr. Simpson's research focuses on understanding cardiac endocrine biology in relation to cardio-respiratory function in health and disease states (e.g., heart failure).

Project_Title: Research Laboratory for Integrated High-Speed Broadband Wireless Communication Systems
Project_Description: The proposed infrastructure aims at building integrated multigigabits broadband wireless networking system that is of high-performance and high-efficiency. Its supported research programs focus on multi-antenna cooperative communication techniques and micro/millimetre-wave RF front-end circuit design.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies
Lead_Research_Institution: University of Ontario Institute of Technology

Project_Title: Imaging for Management of Cardiovascular Diseases
Project_Description: ORF funding will support upgrades and modifications to the MRI suite within the Imaging Research Centre for Cardiovascular Intervention at Sunnybrook Research Institute, to facilitate innovative research into image-guided therapies for cardiovascular disease.

Project_Title: Pre-clinical development of cardiovascular stem cells for diagnosis and treatment
Project_Description: The infrastructure will establish a state-of-the-art cardiac stem cell culturing facility which will focus on modifying a patientâ€™s own stem cells to repair damaged hearts and to better understand individual disease as well as evaluate and implement novel cell-based therapeutics for patients with heart failure and disorders of cardiac rhyth

Project_Title: Utilizing New Media to Mobilize Knowledge on Race
Project_Description: This research program will examine the uses of new technology and digital media to mobilize humanities and social sciences research on issues central to Canadian public life. Relying primarily on films and interactive websites, the project will focus on transferring knowledge about race in Canada.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Spinal Muscular Atrophy â€“ Pathogenesis and Novel Therapeuti
Project_Description: Spinal Muscular Atrophy is the most common genetic cause of infant death.  Led by two senior scientists at the Ottawa Hospital Research Institute, this project endeavours to further understanding of the pathogenesis of the disease and develop novel therapeutics for this currently incurable disease.

Project_Title: Systems-based approach for optimizing field crop production using novel technologies
Project_Description: The strength of Ontario agriculture will depend on scientific breakthroughs that increase production efficiencies.  The proposed infrastructure of a combine harvester is THE tool for measuring crop responses to novel systems that will increase competitiveness of the industry in constantly changing global markets.

Project_Title: Assessment of pulmonary artery calcification and vascular hemodynamic parameters in horses.
Project_Description: The requested infrastructure will support a research program that investigates the effects of pulmonary artery calcification on the pulmonary vascular physiology and potential repercussion on health and performance in racehorses.

Project_Title: Novel Ultrasound Instrumentation for Therapy and Imaging
Project_Description: This project will use new ultrasound equipment to develop personalized medicine through new cancer response imaging methods and the development of novel ultrasound-based cancer therapies.

Project_Title: Wireless acoustic location system, focal recording, and playback technology for studying avian communication networks and night migration in Northern Ontario
Project_Description: This request for $26,460.00 in bioacoustics infrastructure will increase understanding of communication networks, singing and migration behaviour of Northern Ontario avian communities. The research will generate important environmental risk assessment tools to inform green energy development in Ontario.

Project_Title: Bioorganic Chemistry Laboratory
Project_Description: The proposed research focuses on studying the detailed mechanisms by which enzymes function, synthesizing and testing inhibitors with therapeutic potential and engineering enzymes. It also involves the study of structure, localization and trafficking of the related enzymes.

Project_Title: Parallel sequencing facility for environmental, ecological and evolutionary research
Project_Description: The requested NextGen sequencer will build upon the existing infrastructure at U Windsorâ€™s Environmental Genomics Facility, thereby enhancing our internationally-recognized aquatic environmental research capacity. Specific applications will include; aquatic species invasion monitoring, aquatic food web characterization, species at risk genetic profiling and gene expression of stress in aquatic ecosystem

Project_Title: Specialized Physiological Laboratory for Testing of Therapies for Neuromuscular Disorders
Project_Description: This proposal requests infrastructure to support the study of muscle functional recovery following cell, gene and/or pharmaceutical-based treatment strategies for a variety of neuromuscular diseases. Knowledge gained from this project will lead to development of novel therapeutic treatment options.

Project_Title: Neural correlates of attention, response suppression, and multisensory processing
Project_Description: We are interested in understanding how attention directs or suppresses our actions to external or peripersonal space.  To this end, we use cutting edge research tools and techniques to begin to examine brain-behaviour relationships involving frontal cortex central executive mechanisms.

Project_Title: Precise measurements of the proton charge radius and of the fine-structure constant
Project_Description: The requested infrastructure (an atomic beam system, a microwave system and a laser system) will be used to measure the radius of the proton and to measure the fine-structure constant (the fundamental constant of nature that determines the strength of all electric and magnetic interactions).
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Informing Music Performance by Exploring the Production and Perception of Music for Percussion
Project_Description: This proposal will establish Ontarioâ€™s first music cognition lab with a percussion focus, using recordings of expert percussionists to explore how physical gestures shape the way audiences â€œhearâ€ music. This will also assist those suffering from deficits in audio-visual integration, such as children with a
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Personalized Metabolomics for Assessment of Nutrition and Exercise Intervention in Human Health
Project_Description: The economic burden of chronic diseases in Ontario is unsustainable without practical measures for prevention. The infrastructure will enable the translation of evidence-based nutritional and exercise interventions that improve human health while alleviating risk factors to prevent chronic disease.

Project_Title: Laboratory for Human-Centered Computer Science Research
Project_Description: This Laboratoryâ€™s objective is to enable empirical observation of how real users interact with information technology in desktop, mobile, and touch display environments.  A key element of this laboratory is a mobile eye-tracker, which will reveal what parts of user interfaces are successful at drawing attentio
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies
Lead_Research_Institution: University of Ontario Institute of Technology

Project_Title: Integrated Research Platform for Pattern Recognition of Machining Errors
Project_Description: The objectives of this project are to better understand the behaviour of non-systematic machining error, modeling relationships between these errors and actual machining forces, and employing the developed knowledge to control and compensate these errors during machining to reduce manufacturing waste.
Lead_Research_Institution: University of Ontario Institute of Technology

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Population-Based Infectious Diseases Research
Project_Description: The objective of the research is to define the immunologic and genetic predictors of severity in influenza and dengue.  The research will also examine underlying genetic, epigenetic, and immunologic determinants of influenza vaccine response.

Project_Title: Behavioral Research Laboratory for the Study Of Consumer Behavior, Consumer Welfare and Well-Being
Project_Description: Problems related to consumption are wide-spread and profound, ranging from problematic over-consumption to stress resulting from too much choice. Consumers, as well as government and other groups, are in need of recommendations aimed at helping consumers cope with a consumer society.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: User interface feedforward and feedback supporting and enabling ubiquitous computing
Project_Description: The study and design of user interfaces supporting multi-device computing. Dr. Wigdor will develop user interface tools and other necessary technologies for the construction of decentralized computing experiencesi.e. spread across car, mobile phone, tablets, television, office computer, laptop, etc.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Veterinary Regenerative Medicine Laboratory
Project_Description:
This proposal is aimed at identifying the mechanisms that control the biology of domestic animal stem
cells and establishing stem cell lines and tissue-engineering methods for developing transplantationbased
therapies in domestic animals and in particular dogs and horses with orthopedic problems.

Project_Title: A high-performance computing system for the simulation of multi-scale systems
Project_Description: Developing next-generation technology requires design methods that capture nanoscale features and mechanisms. This research aims to accomplish these goals through development of innovative multiscale modelling design techniques that capture both device-scale and nanoscale functionality.

Project_Title: Laboratory for Atmospheric Remote Sounding Technology
Project_Description: The funding from this proposal will equip a new laboratory at York University for the development and application of instrumentation for the remote sounding of atmospheric composition. The goal of this research program is to make high-quality, space-based atmospheric measurements that will improve our understanding of air quality issues and climate change.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: X-Ray Diffractometer for Materials Characterization
Project_Description: This proposal is to purchase a X-ray Diffractometer, with a high temperature stage, to assist in materials characterization research being conducted at UOIT. This is a fundamental piece of equipment and will be used in support of research in energy systems, biomaterials, and corrosion.
Lead_Research_Institution: University of Ontario Institute of Technology

Project_Title: High Pressure Pump and Imaging Equipment for Gas Hydrate Experimentation
Project_Description:
Ontario has the potential for non-conventional energy resources in the form of natural gas hydrates. The high pressure infrastructure requested here will support fundamental studies in gas hydrates. This type of research is important for
economical and responsible exploitation of the hydrate resource as well as to develop novel CO2 sequestration technologies.

Project_Title: Establishing a laboratory to study the influence of parent-child feeding interactions on children's dietary intake and weight outcomes
Project_Description:
The objective of this proposal is to develop a laboratory that will focus on understanding parent-child
feeding interactions. The results of this research will inform public health and clinic-based obesity
prevention interventions in Ontario.

Project_Title: Evaluation of Physical Activity, Cognitive Function, and Brain Correlates
Project_Description: To acquire infrastructure to assess cognitive, physical, and neurophysiological function to identify strategies to prevent dementia, with focus on physical activity. This research will produce social and economic benefits to Ontario families and the province and backs Ontarioâ€™s Aging at Home strateg

Project_Title: Infrastructure to identify drugs that modulate trinucleotide repeat expansions to treatneuromuscular diseases
Project_Description: Over 40 neuromuscular/-degenerative diseases are caused by expansion of repetitive DNA sequences like CAG/CTG (trinucleotide repeats), including myotonic dystrophy type 1. This disease impacts ~ 7000 Canadians and is the most common, impairing muscular, nervous, respiratory,cardiovascular, and reproductive systems.

Project_Title: Advanced Simulation of Critical Structures under Extreme Loading
Project_Description: The objective of the proposal is to develop the Structural Dynamics and Advanced Simulation Laboratory. The laboratory will be equipped with seismic simulators, a ten-element hybrid simulator, dynamic actuators, controllers, and a reconfigurable reaction systems.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for studying amphibian pathogens, genomics, and diversity.
Project_Description: The proposed research will explore amphibian genomics, epidemiology, and biodiversity. Results will assist in the management of an emerging amphibian pathogen, increase understanding of economically important species with duplicated genomes, and assist in the discovery and description of new species.

Project_Title: From Cognitive Neuroscience to Clinical Practice
Project_Description: Detecting and measuring residual brain function in behaviourally non-responsive patients with severe brain injuries, establishing research into the cognitive deficits that characterize neurodegenerative diseases, and continuing to deliver research into memory, attention and other â€˜higherâ€™ functions of the human br

Project_Title: Discovery of new genes in brain lipid metabolism for health and disease
Project_Description: The objective of this proposal is to establish infrastructure for a world-class program on discovery of new genes in brain metabolism. The equipment will support biomedical research leading to advances in understanding, preventing, and treating neurological disease and promoting brain health with aging.

Project_Title: Industrial Bioproducts Laboratory (IBL)
Project_Description: The infrastructure requested in this proposal is for a new Industrial Bioproducts Laboratory (IBL) at Western, to support research and technology development on production of industrial bioproducts (green fuels, biochemicals and bio-based materials) from non-food renewable resources.

Project_Title: Role of Bacterial Toxins in Infectious Diseases: MolecularMechanisms and TherapeuticOpportunities
Project_Description: This award will enable Dr. Melnyk, a repatriate, to establish an innovative laboratory to uncover the molecular mechanisms underlying bacterial pathogenesis. Knowledge gained will inform development of novel therapeutics to address hospital-acquired infectious diseases such as those caused by pathogenic strains of C. difficile, thereby resulting in improved healthcare and decreased healthcare costs in Ontario.

Project_Title: Platform for the study of bioactive compounds in health and environmental sciences
Project_Description: The proposal requests funding for infrastructure for studies on the mode of action of novel bioactives in health and environmental sciences. Results from the research will provide innovative developments toward use of bioactives as alternatives to synthetic pesticides and as novel nutraceutical compounds.

Project_Title: Analysis of developmental cell fate and function through application of advanced flow cytometry and microscopy
Project_Description: The project provides for a high throughput, 5 laser multi-parameter cytometric cell analysis capabilities for understanding mechanisms of stem cell development for regenerative medicine. Requested equipment will also enable live deep tissue imaging of protein complexes in the brain.

Project_Title: Advanced pharmaceutical therapies: Developing mechanism-based bioactive molecules through an integrated approach
Project_Description: Design and development of novel therapeutics such as small molecules, peptide and proteins to treat chronic  disorders and their delivery using gemini surfactants as nanoparticle based macromolecular drug delivery systems

Project_Title: Quantitative Morphogenesis and Wound Repair Laboratory
Project_Description: Deficient healing of skin wounds in diabetics often leads to limb amputation. In embryos, the skin heals rapidly and with no scars. We use advanced microscopy and computational analysis to investigate wound healing in transparent fruit fly embryos and develop strategies that accelerate wound closure in humans.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for a cutting-edge integrative physiology laboratory for examining the effects of environmental stress on animals
Project_Description: The research will determine the physiological basis for how climate change and other forms of environmental stress are impacting fish and wildlife in Ontario. It will use innovative and integrative methods to explain the variation in how animals respond to low oxygen stress, in the lab and in the field.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Digital Tools for Music Education
Project_Description: iSCORE, a web-based tool that helps students learn music, contains structures to support self-regulated learning and to deepen communication amongst students, teachers, and peers. We hypothesize that iSCORE will enhance intellectual and social engagement, thereby resulting in better learning.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Direct and indirect regulation of NMDA receptors by 5-HT7 receptor signaling
Project_Description: The objective of the research outlined in this proposal is to elucidate signal transduction pathways in nerve cells that alter brain function. We will examine how serotonin receptors modulate the activity of glutamate receptors at synapses both directly and via signaling to growth factor receptors.

Project_Title: Placental Pathophysiology Research Laboratory
Project_Description: The key research objectives of the current proposal are to: a) determine how placental dysfunction is established, b) design effective screening tools to identify women at risk early in pregnancy, and c) identify therapeutic targets which can be modulated to improve fetal and maternal health outcomes.

Project_Title: Creative Practices Centre / Centre de Pratiques CrÃ©ative
Project_Description: The CPC will be a bilingual research hub for interdisciplinary health research, addressing topics related to the social and rehabilitation sciences. The main focus of this research is on chronic illnesses, such as cancer, and interventions related to improving quality of life for those experiencing illness and disability.

Project_Title: Broadband Seismograph Network for Passive Seismic Imaging of Earth Structures
Project_Description: The objective of the project is to improve characterization of subsurface Earth structures and tectonic activity in the northern Canadian Cordillera by temporarily deploying an array of 10 state-of -the-art broadband seismograph stations in the Yukon and Northwest Territories.

Project_Title: High-repetition-rate laser diagnostic facilities for studies of flow and combustion dynamics
Project_Description: This proposal is for a high-repetition-rate laser diagnostics facility with which to measure the harmful flow and combustion dynamics occurring in advanced engines. The knowledge and technology generated will lead to transportation and power generation systems with reduced environmental impact.

Project_Title: Evolutionary Consequences of Losing Recombination and Segregation in Plants: Infrastructure for Interdisciplinary Research
Project_Description: This proposal seeks funding for infrastructure for Dr. Marc Johnsonâ€™s interdisciplinary research on the evolutionary consequences of sexual reproduction in plants and plant-insect interactions. This research addresses some of the most fundamental problems facing todayâ€™s basic and applied biologi
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Analysis of Signaling Networks Evolution, Function and Their Role in Disease
Project_Description: Every living cell senses and responds to external signals, through the action of complex protein networks. Malfunction of these networks can lead to severe diseases, such as cancer. The proposed research will investigate how protein networks evolve and how their malfunction leads to disease.

Project_Title: DLL4-Notch as a novel strategy to improve tumor radiation response
Project_Description: Dr. Liuâ€™s research aims to improve the effectiveness of radiation treatment for cancer by investigating novel targeted drugs. His research will investigate how Notch inhibitors effectively delay tumor growth following radiation treatment, so that it can be translated to improve outcomes for cancer patient

Project_Title: Multidisciplinary Laboratory for Development of Next Generation MRI Contrast Agents for Biomedical Imaging
Project_Description: The proposed research aims to develop next generation MRI contrast agents with high sensitivity, minimum toxicity, and molecular specificity for 1) noninvasively detecting diseases at an early stage, and 2) real-time imaging of specific physiological or pathological processes at the molecular level in vivo.

Project_Title: Food, Health and Aging for reduced health care costs
Project_Description: Many health-related syndromes of modern civilization can be traced back to poor eating habits. In this work we seek to use food structuring as a means of improving the health characteristics of manufactured food products, thus mitigating the ever increasing costs of health care.

Project_Title: Dissection of Legionella pneumophila virulence factors through the integration of experimental adaptation and high-throughput genomics.

Project_Title: Examining protein: protein interactions in cellular membranes relevant to the treatment of human diseases
Project_Description:
Dr. Andrews has worked to understand an unusual class of membrane-binding proteins, the Bcl-2 family, that were shown to cause cancer, not by causing cellular growth, but by preventing programmed cellular death. This discovery caused a paradigm shift in cancer biology and interest in regulated apoptosis exploded. It is now apparent that the Bcl-2 protein family regulates the response of tumour cells to chemotherapy by altering their own binding interactions. 

The Bcl-2-mediated interactions depend on where the proteins interact in part because the structural changes resulting from membrane insertion lead to dramatic changes in interacting partners. Thus it is challenging to extrapolate measurements of binding interactions conventionally made in vitro using truncated proteins to what happens in live cells. Furthermore, there are few approaches that can be used to study protein:protein interactions in membranes in vitro and even less for studies in live cells.  Dr. Andrews has developed fluorescence spectroscopy and fluorescence imaging spectroscopy methods to examine them, respectively. These new techniques are now being used by pharmaceutical companies to make new anti-cancer drugs to improve chemotherapy. The infrastructure requested includes core and ancillary equipment required to perform these techniques at an internationally competitive level. Because regulation of apoptosis is thematic to several human diseases including stroke, autoimmune and degenerative diseases, the scope of this work will be broadened by general knowledge of protein:protein interactions, putting Ontario at the forefront of innovation science and providing excellence in improving methodologies to treat human disease on a number of fronts.
