Project_Description: The proposed infrastructure will be used to conduct rapid experimental evaluation and validation of newly developed reliable coordination and control algorithms for multiple autonomous vehicle and/or robot networks performing collaborative tasks(surveillance, driving, rescue, manufacturing, etc.).

Project_Title: Next-Generation Structural Systems for Seismic Protection of Infrastructure
Project_Description: The Simulator for Innovative Next-Generation Structural Systems will enable research on advanced structural technologies that not only protect people inside buildings during earthquakes, but also minimize post-earthquake recovery costs by avoiding structural and non-structural damage.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Micro-Scale Separations and Analysis Suite (MSAS) for Bio-Processing and Environmental Applications
Project_Description: The requested Micro-scale Separations and Analysis Suite (MSAS) will develop novel separation processes for applications related to wastewater purification and the production of bio-therapeutics. The research will benefit the Clean Technology and Life Sciences sectors of the Ontario economy.

Project_Title: Improved Neuroendocrine Tumor Management Through RNA-Based Diagnostics
Project_Description: My objective is to transform molecular diagnostics for cancer management. Starting with neuroendocrine tumors, my plan is to identify and visualize informative biomarkers in pathology specimens using a powerful molecular diagnostics platform that I co-developed for improved clinical decision-making.

Project_Title: Laboratory Facility for the In Situ Characterization of Metal-Bacteria Interactions
Project_Description: We will develop a laboratory facility for the in situ analysis of metal bacteria interactions that will be used to assess the role played by biogenic minerals (i.e., minerals formed in the presence of bacteria) in metal sequestration in environments impacted by new and existing mines.

Project_Title: Sustainable Chemical Synthesis In Batch and Flow
Project_Description: Chemistry is everywhere in our lives, from the fuels in our car to the screens in our phones. Our research program seeks to reduce the environmental impact that the chemical industry has by developing new, waste-free reactions and processes that utilize renewable feedstocks.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Developing a Supercritical Fluid Extraction Process for Rare Earth Materials
Project_Description: The goal of the proposed research is to develop a novel, efficient, and environmentally friendly extraction process, using supercritical fluids, to separate individual rare earth elements after the initial hydrometallurgical leaching step.

Project_Title: Structure and Dynamics of GPCR Membrane Proteins
Project_Description: The proposed research will enhance our understanding of the inner working of cell surface receptors and ion channels in health and disease. The requested equipment will enable new insights into the large class of membrane proteins and contribute to understanding the molecular architecture of life.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for an Integrative Genomics and Phenomics Lab to Identify Mechanisms Generating Phenotypic Variation
Project_Description: The proposed activities will provide a platform for development and discovery in integrative genetics research. The research integrates genomic, developmental, morphological and behavioural approaches in genetic analysis, and thereby reveals how mutations with subtle effects influence organism function.

Project_Title: Center for Cardiovascular Assessment
Project_Description: A state-of-the-art Centre for Cardiovascular Assessment is proposed. This will be a major component of the Muscle Health Initiative at York University. Our focus is understanding, treating, and preventing cardiovascular disease and the associated arrhythmias, which remains the number one killer in Canada.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Deciphering Molecular Events Leading to Bacterial Pathogens Sensing and Adaptation to their Environment
Project_Description: The aim of this proposal is to identify the mechanisms that contribute to bacteria sensing and adaptation to their environment, using Shigella flexneri as a model and cutting-edge microscope imaging approaches. Potential applications stemming from this work include identification of novel antibiotics.

Project_Title: Lanthanide-based Nanophosphors for Bioimaging and Energy Conversion Applications
Project_Description: This research project seeks the development of novel lanthanide-based nanophosphors with controlled surface chemistry as multifunctional carriers. The goal is to provide novel near-infrared and opto-magnetic hybrid biomarkers as well as new phosphors for solar-driven energy-conversion technologies.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: High resolution mass spectrometry for metabolic profiling to discover enzymes and observe cell growth regulation
Project_Description: This work will form a complete map of cellular metabolism, and discover how metabolism is regulated during cell division. High resolution liquid chromatography mass spectrometry equipment will be used to measure the metabolism of cells engineered to knockout specific enzymes.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Advanced Biomolecular Materials Laboratory at York University
Project_Description: Interfacing man-made materials with human cells is critical for understanding fundamental cell behaviour and for developing new health-based biotechnologies.  The Advanced Biomolecular Materials Laboratory at York University will generate new surface chemistry knowledge and capabilities that will significantly progress human health diagnostics and therapeutic treatments.

Project_Title:
Large-scale Experimental and Computational Infrastructure for Assessing Wind Effects on
the Built Environment
Project_Description: The main objective is to assess effects of extreme wind, wind-driven-rain and -snow on the built environment using a combination of large scale experiments and computer simulations to enhance the safety of the public and maintain the resiliency of Ontarioâ€™s built environment against natural hazard

Project_Title: Processing and Development of Next-Generation Natural Biotherapeutics
Project_Description: This research program will use cutting edge strategies to engage in microbial natural product mining to identify novel bioactive compounds that have enormous potential to become the next wave of therapeutic drugs to combat infectious diseases and to treat diseases such as cancer.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Infrastructure for the combined optical coherence tomography (OCT) and optical topographic imaging (OTI) for laser cutting surgery
Project_Description: The infrastructure in this proposal enhances existing Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) instrumentation for applications in surgical navigation and precision surgery. Dr. Yang will utilize his expertise in OCT to develop optical topographic imaging (OTI) technology and implement the knowledge of OCT and OTI for laser ablation in surgery.

Project_Title: Biomedical Signal Analysis Research Laboratory
Project_Description: The objective of the proposal is to develop advanced biomedical signal analysis algorithms for non-invasive diagnosis, monitoring and understanding of complex cardiovascular dynamics, human gait and neuromuscular disorders. The tools will help the development of better information technologies for health care applications.

Project_Title: Digital Media Centre for the Global Study of Social Movements
Project_Description: The project provides a digital means to create, analyze, store and exchange data on contemporary social movements. The centre will facilitate advanced technological communications equipment for collaboration with practitioners and researchers worldwide and will train junior researchers.

Project_Title: Integrated Environmental Physiology Tools for Transpecies and Field Research
Project_Description: This proposal will enable an integrated environmental physiology research team at Brock University. This will be done by providing advanced tools for studying the effects of extreme heat and cold, along with low oxygen, on both animal and human responses. The proposal will also provide portable equipment that can maximize field research and industrial collaborations.

Project_Title: Interdisciplinary Research Laboratory in Statistical Methodology and Applications
Project_Description: The objective of the proposed research program is to develop cutting-edge statistical methodologies to estimate complex dynamical models from massive data. One major goal is to identify genes that control dynamic systems such as the infection dynamics of HIV virus and the dynamic system of the absorption and distribution of an administered drug in the human body.

Project_Title: Sequence analysis of development and disease
Project_Description: The focus of this project is on placental dysfunction that affects foetal and maternal health. The aim is to identify changes in the expression of genes that relate to the clinical outcome of human pregnancies, with the goal of developing diagnostic, prognostic tools as well as innovative therapeutic approaches.

Project_Title: Crystallization and Imaging Facility
Project_Description: Understanding biological processes requires knowledge of the structure and function of each component of the system. X-ray crystallography is the most powerful method to determine the structure of a protein. This project provides infrastructure for automated protein crystallization; the first essential step in this process.

Project_Title: Mobile Computer-Assisted Survey Research Laboratory for HIV Vaccine Implementation Science
Project_Description: The proposed research is at the cutting edge of innovation in addressing the social and behavioral challenges of HIV vaccines; ensuring ethical conduct of clinical trials and fully informed consent; and laying the groundwork for acceptability and access to future vaccines among most-at-risk populations.

Project_Title: Canada Research Chair in Organizational Behaviour: Organizational Behaviour Research Laboratory
Project_Description: This program of research examines the experiences and effective management of contingent workers, how employees interpret and respond to the emotional content of electronic communication, the reasons why employees hide knowledge from their coworkers, and the workplace stress of leaders.

Project_Title: Biogeochemistry and microbial ecology research facility for studies of environmental change in Canadian forests and wetlands.
Project_Description: The infrastructure will enable timely research on poorly understood soil microbial feedbacks to environmental disturbances (forestry, including biomass/bioenergy harvests, climate change, invasive species, and mining-related pollution) in Ontarioâ€™s northern forests and wetland

Project_Title: Testbed for Cyber-Physical Urban Logistics System
Project_Description: The proposed infrastructure is a first-of-its-kind testbed with the capacity to evaluate transport system designs with embedded computer decision-making. The infrastructure includes a centralized facility with six workstations, a video wall, and 30 tablets to equip on a fleet of vehicles.

Project_Title: Earthquake Simulation Facility with Network Interface Capabilities for Collaborative Earthquake and Vibration Research
Project_Description: The proposed earthquake simulator facilitates earthquake research by creating a device that can reproduce the earthquake ground-shaking loading in order to perform seismic testing of large size soil-structure models, such as high-rise buildings, bridges and other critical infrastructure.

Project_Title: Development of a Comparative Hemostasis Laboratory at the Ontario Veterinary College Health Sciences Centre, University of Guelph
Project_Description: The Comparative Hemostasis Laboratory aims to investigate disorders related to hemostasis in multiple species.   Research goals include investigating the effects of drugs & disease on the hemostatic system in veterinary species, and to extend the information gathered to human medicine where applicable.

Project_Title: Universal testing facility for advanced characterization of automotive materials
Project_Description: This research infrastructure will enable the applicants to carry out advanced characterization of automotive materials. The experimental data will be used to develop and validate predictive numerical models that will accelerate the implementation of lightweight and crash-resistant structures into vehicles.

Project_Title: Attention laboratory for high-temporal resolution behavioural, eye movement, and electrophysiological recording.
Project_Description: An Attention Lab will be constructed to: 1) uncover the neural mechanisms that allow our finite brains to make sense of the overwhelming visual world we live in; 2) translate these discoveries to applied domains by improving driving safety and eliminating age related declines in vision; and 3) develop cutting-edge neuroimaging tools to assess the health of brain function.

Project_Title: Laboratory for the Study of the Psychophysiological Effects of Stress on Physical Health
Project_Description: The purpose of this laboratory is to study the impact of severe stress on physical health and designing psychological interventions to ameliorate elevated chronic disease risk following traumatic events. Dr. Andersen combines psychophysiological, behavioural, and experience-sampling methods to examine disease risk associated with trauma exposure and psychological treatments that promote mental and physical health thriving during and following severe stress.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Musculoskeletal spinal disorders laboratory
Project_Description: The funding requested will be used to purchase equipment for Dr Gregoryâ€™s musculoskeletal spinal disorders laboratory at Wilfrid Laurier University.  Dr Gregoryâ€™s research laboratory focuses on identifying and reducing  potential risks of low back pain that exist in occupational and daily living ta
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Computing Infrastructure for Control of Complex Physical Systems
Project_Description: The requested high-performance shared memory computer will provide the means to develop models and control strategies for complex systems such as smart materials and intracellular networks. This will lead to breakthroughs in the manipulation and control of these systems.

Project_Title: Investigating Microbial Biosynthetic Capacity
Project_Description: The vast reservoir of unexplored microbial metabolic diversity in Canada undoubtedly possesses novel molecules with potential benefits to health, agriculture and the environment. Infrastructure is requested to discover and characterize these molecules and the mechanisms of their biological synthesis.

Project_Title: Creation of the Diabetes Discovery Core to facilitate innovative new directions in understanding diabetes pathophysiology and in developing new clinical modalities to manage the disease.
Project_Description: Diabetes is a growing epidemic that contributes to the death of thousands of Ontarians each year. The proposed research will explore new directions in diabetes research using state-ofâ€“the-art equipment to examine conditions such as inflammation, cell stress and beta cell dysfunction that drive this diseas

Project_Title: Intestinal mucosal immunity and host-pathogen interactions during mycobacterial infection in cattle
Project_Description: This research proposal seeks to understand fundamental mechanisms of host resistance to Johneâ€™s disease, which is a chronic and universally fatal bacterial infection affecting the gastrointestinal tract of cattle resulting in an estimated economic loss of $90M per year for the Canadian cattle industr

Project_Title: Carleton's Human Oriented Research in Usable Security (CHORUS) Lab
Project_Description: The CHORUS lab is a centre for multi-disciplinary research on improving computer security and privacy for end-users and for experts. This applied research integrates human-computer interaction (HCI) and computer security disciplines.

Project_Title: Movement for Performance Biomechanics and Ergonomics Laboratory
Project_Description: This proposal is aimed at enhancing the health and occupational performance of the Canadian workforce. This goal will be achieved by innovating holistic strategies and tools that can be applied to reduce physical demands in the workplace, and to enhance the functional capacity of the workforce.

Project_Title: Research Infrastructure for Computational Analytics on Big Data in the Cloud
Project_Description: Business decisions and scientific discovery are increasingly reliant on complex analysis of Big Data from multiple sources. This project will provide essential infrastructure for research that will enable innovative and novel types of Big Data analytics leading to advances in business, science, and public policy.

Project_Title: Tracking Nanoparticles with Whole-Animal Imaging and Hyperspectral Microscopy: A Novel Strategy for Identifying Biomarkers and Treating Diabetes
Project_Description: Diabetic patients develop multi-organ complications. The advanced imaging equipment requested will allow us to study for the first time, diabetic models in vivo, from the macroscopic to cellular level. These studies will move findings quickly from the laboratory to patient care, to prevent diabetes complications.

Project_Title:
A Laboratory of Clinical Exercise Physiology
in Chronic Cardiopulmonary Diseases (LACEP)
Project_Description: This proposed research aims to generate breakthroughs in our understanding of the causes and treatment of disability in chronic heart failure and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, two leading diseases affecting the health-related quality of life of Ontarians.

Project_Title: Understanding the role of block copolymers in metal coordination polymerization for Prussian blue nanoparticle design
Project_Description: The project intends to understand metal coordination supramolecular chemistry in the presence of block copolymers using electron microscope (EM) as a major analytic tool, which will lead to functional materials useful for clean technologies, pharmaceutical research, andinformation technologies,etc.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for the characterization and analyses of sedimentary processes
Project_Description: This research program investigates the impact of climate and environmental changes on sedimentary processes.  Changes to these processes impact water quality, infrastructure and landuse management practices.  Through field and laboratory studies this research will help inform better policy decisions.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Data Analytics and Computational Biostatistics
Project_Description: The server, computer workstations and videoconferencing equipment will enable two research objectives. First, the development of new and innovative statistical and computational methodologies. Second, the application of these methodologies to medical, environmental and industrial research.

Project_Title: Evaluating the anti-cancer treatment applications of nutraceuticals
Project_Description: Using tissue culture equipment and a flow cytometer, my research will provide scientific validity for the use of nutraceuticals by cancer patients through the systematic evaluationof their anti-cancer treatment propertiesand their pharmacological and anti-tumor assessment in animal models.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Challenging Depression in Canadian Youth: Building Mobile, Online, and Interactive Assessment and Intervention Tools
Project_Description: By developing and rigorously investigating mobile/online innovative approaches for mental health assessment and intervention, the applicant aims to improve youth access to empirically supported strategies for challenging depression and promoting positive functioning.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Bionanotechnology Laboratory
Project_Description: Developing sensing tools, and imaging techniques using bionanotechnology for the biological, food and agricultural systems. Generation of new concepts, innovative, novel, high-value products in sectors such as healthcare, bioenergy, bioremediation, agricultural, environmental and food quality monitoring.

Project_Title: Muscle Stem Cell Bioengineering Laboratory
Project_Description: Skeletal muscle is critical to our day to day movement and loss of muscle mass and/or function due to genetic disorders, aging, cancer or physical inactivity impairs quality of life and increases the risk of mobility related accidents. Adult skeletal muscle contains stem cells that are responsible for the daily repair of skeletal muscle injury.  The research in this proposal uses an interdisciplinary approach and is focused on identifying the mechanisms regulating muscle stem cells in the tissue and aims to harness this knowledge to develop novel strategies that promote skeletal muscle repair for Ontario patients.

Project_Title: Water and Ice Research Laboratory (WIRL)
Project_Description: The Water and Ice Research Laboratory is a new facility at Carleton University that examines the impacts of climate change and other environmental issues on aquatic and cryospheric systems. Our research makes use of innovative field approaches, laboratory equipment and geospatial computing.

Project_Title: Research and Development for Optical Identification of Single Barium Ions
Project_Description: Optical detection of single barium ions. Novel technique to eliminate background contributions in large-scale xenon detectors enhancing their sensitivity for measuring the absolute scale of the neutrino mass via the observation of the neutrinoless double-beta decay.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Support an Integrative Cardiovascular Circadian Research Laboratory
Project_Description: Dr. Martino is investigating the link between circadian physiology and the pathogenesis of heart disease and heart failure. The infrastructure requested is essential to an innovative research program designed to lead to new approaches to understand, prevent, and treat cardiovascular disease.

Project_Title: Cryo-Prep and Transfer System and Accessories for Atomic-Scale Characterization of Nuclear Materials
Project_Description: The Cryo-Prep and Transfer system with accessories will be used to investigate the microstructural evolution by Atom Probe Tomography at the nanoscale of structural and cladding materials used in current or future CANDU reactors to open pathways for designing better performing materials.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Biochemical and Molecular Infrastructure to Unlock the Secrets of Plant Extracellular Lipids: Manipulating Pathways to Create Novel Bioproducts for Agriculture, Forestry and the Biofuels Industry
Project_Description: Algoma U. is establishing a new biochemistry/molecular laboratory for our newest Research Chair, Dr. Isabel Molina. She will investigate novel fatty acids and lipid-based compounds from higher plants and microalgae that show potential to yield new bio-products for industry, medicine, forestry and agriculture.

Project_Title: Electrical Neuromodulation of Spinal and Supraspinal Reflexes for Treatment of Lower Urinary Tract Dysfunction
Project_Description: Chronic overactive bladder (OAB) symptoms negatively affect the quality of life of millions of Canadian adults. The proposed infrastructure will help develop technology that will mitigate the socioeconomic burden of chronic OAB, while also contributing to the commercial development of new therapies.

Project_Title: A Translational Pipeline for Personalized Diagnostics in Myelodysplastic Syndromes
Project_Description: The objective of this proposal is to innovatively transform and personalize the practice of pathology.  Starting with a common and burdensome blood cancer, we will validate next-generation genomic technologies alongside traditional pathology, to detect cancer earlier and better inform treatment.

Project_Title: Research on portable multidimensional micro-nano biological sensing devices
Project_Description: The proposed research will develop a platform for prototyping enhanced Point-of-Care devices integrating two complementary detection principles on a single microfluidic chip. Dual detection will permit analysis of both acoustic and electric impedances that will improve their diagnosticreliability.

Project_Title: Refill Friction Stir Welding of Lightweight Materials
Project_Description: The proposed equipment will facilitate research in advanced joining technologies for the transportation industries. This research will help overcome barriers to implementation of lightweight materials, thereby decreasing fuel consumption and greenhouse gas emissions.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for developing new imaging technologies to enhance the sensitivity of Positron Emission Tomography (PET) for molecular imaging
Project_Description: This proposal is dedicated to developing novel imaging technologies to enhance the molecular sensitivity of Positron Emission Tomography (PET). The research tasks include developing novel photodetector technology and PET systems, using a fully-digital high speed Data Acquisition System (DAQ).

Project_Title: Developing broad antiviral strategies to protect the health of Canadians and their environment
Project_Description: Dr. DeWitte-Orr studies how animals defend themselves from virus infections using their innate immune responses. The requested infrastructure will allow Dr. DeWitte-Orrâ€™s lab to further understand these antiviral mechanisms at the cellular level, with the future goal of developing novel antiviral therapie

Project_Title: Cellular and Molecular Sensing Laboratory
Project_Description: The research focuses on developing a new class of handheld molecular diagnostic platforms for biological cell processing and analysis. Electrical chips featuring highly optimized nanomaterials with exceptional sensitivity, precision, integration, and speed form the innovative foundation of this system.

Project_Title: Development of innovative methods for wastewater treatment using bioelectrochemical systems for biosolids minimization and effective removal of nutrients and heavy metals
Project_Description: This research seeks to eliminate or mitigate major challenges in wastewater treatment using bioelectrochemical systems. Bioelectrochemical systems will be examined for their capacity to minimize biosolids generation, maximize wastewater treatability, and separate nutrient compounds and heavy metals from wastewater.

Project_Title: Organic Photovoltaics Laboratory
Project_Description: The Organic Photovoltaic Laboratory (OPL), sits at the interface between fundamental research and device production, by using an integrated glovebox incorporating both vacuum evaporation and solution deposition methods to create low cost, organic photovoltaic devices (OPVs) as needed for sustainable energy economy.

Project_Title: Arts Integrated Research Lab
Project_Description: The Arts Integrated Research Lab will support the development of Arts Integrated Studies across disciplines and programs in Canada. Arts integrated studies use the arts such as film, fiction, plays, or paintings as generative mechanisms in the research process to discern relational connections, represent data, and disseminate research.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Biodiversity â€“  Ecosystem Function Laborato
Project_Description: Dr. Lindoâ€™s research focuses on the relationship between biodiversity and ecosystem function in Canadian forest ecosystems. Analytical tools in the laboratory and the field measure soil biodiversity, and carbon and nitrogen flux, to develop strategies for the enhancement of forest carbon sequestratio
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Technology for exploring cellular mechanisms underlying cognitive function in health and disease
Project_Description: The objective of this proposal is to acquire cutting edge technologies needed for the assessment of cognitive function in different rat animal models for neurodegenerative diseases, in order to enable the  testing of drugs and manipulations that reverse cognitive deficits and halt neurodegeneration.

Project_Title: Hardware-in-the-Loop Simulation Platform for Intelligent Hybrid Cars
Project_Description: We will establish an innovative test platform at uWaterloo to support the development of new intelligent controllers for hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs), plug-in hybrids (PHEVs) and electric vehicles (EVs) that will improve their performance characteristics and, consequently, their market share.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for molecular to whole-animal analysis of inflammation, infection and immune function.
Project_Description: The infrastructure will enable the study of pathological processes driving atherosclerosis, multiple sclerosis and human immunodeficiency virus, and the impacts of new treatments, at the molecular level through to the pathology of whole tissues within animal models.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Gene-Environment Interplay Research Laboratory
Project_Description: The project is for renovation and equipment for a Gene-Environment Interplay laboratory. The research performed in this laboratory will be to investigate the mechanisms (epigenetic and gene-environment interactions) whereby our early experience is embedded in our biology. Specifically, the Drosophila foraging gene model with its many genetic, molecular and behavioural technologies will be used to investigate how early nutritional and social adversity affect food-related behaviours, metabolism  social cognition.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Personalizing Drug Therapy to Increase Safety and Efficacy of Medications
Project_Description: The objective of this project is to improve the safety and efficacy of commonly used medications by personalizing drug therapy. The proposal seeks support for the purchase of an Ultra High Performance Liquid Chromatography system equipped with a state-of-the-art quan/qual mass spectrometer.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: A Testbed for Empirical Cloud Computing Research
Project_Description: Our objective is to improve the performance, manageability, and reliability of cloud applications in domains such as e-commerce and entertainment.  We propose to do this by enhancing the data management and delivery infrastructure on which these applications depend.

Project_Title:
Sorption Phenomena of Actinides in Brine/Solid Interface 
- Development of Sorption Model and Evaluation of Sorption Data -
Project_Description: Speciation and sorption of actinides in brine - a typical property of Ontarioâ€™s groundwater - is a very important factor in assessing the long term radiotoxicity and safety of radioactive waste disposal. A model will be developed to evaluate these processes and the sorption thermodynamic data of actinide
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: University of Windsor Occupational Biomechanics Research Facility
Project_Description: Computer-aided ergonomics is important in manufacturing and the drive to improve its accuracy and validity is necessary. This work will improve upon or develop predictive whole-body posturing, body-size scaling, physical fatigue as well as, determine joint strengths of various populations and physical states.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for a Bioelectronic Systems Laboratory
Project_Description: New semiconductor devices developed in the proposed Bioelectronic Systems Laboratory will vastly enhance drug-screening technologies, which will allow new pharmaceuticals to be brought to market more rapidly and at a lower cost, leading to significant health benefits for Ontarians.

Project_Title: Reverse-Engineering Platform for Human Visuo-Motor System
Project_Description: The goal of this project is to develop a model of the human brain as it controls a complex manual task. The infrastructure will consist of a robot that interacts with a software model of dozens of brain regions. This work will improve our understanding of brain function, and lead to advanced robot control systems.

Project_Title: Integrated Million Death Study (MDS) e-Platform
Project_Description: The Million Death Study (MDS)-e Platform enables rapid collection of health data worldwide. It has 3 components: (1) multi-user, remote capture laptops; (2) software for innovative data capture, geospatial linkage, and computer-assisted physician coding; and (3) secure data storage to enable multiple users to analyze the data.

Project_Title: Neuropsychiatry Imaging Lab (NeuroPIL) hybrid PET/MRI infrastructure
Project_Description: Establish the NeuroPsychiatry Imaging Lab (NeuroPIL) and leading edge simultaneous positron emission tomography (PET) and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) infrastructure to examine the function and chemistry of brain networks involved in schizophrenia, depression and bipolar disorder.

Project_Title: Nanomechanics and Nanotribology Platform for Characterizing Energy Efficient Materials
Project_Description: The goal of the project is to utilize the proposed infrastructure as a platform for conducting Nanomechanics and Nanotribology characterization of nanostructures in the NanoMechanics and Materials research laboratory in order to guide the design of advanced energy-efficient materials based on nanostructures.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Cluster Computing Infrastructure for Big Data Management and Analysis
Project_Description: The massive amounts of data that are being generated today in every economic and social activity have given rise to the Big Data problem. This research project focuses on foundational issues in Big Data management and analysis using a state-of-the-art cluster infrastructure.

Project_Title: Migration, Gender, and International Development Research Laboratory
Project_Description: The Migration, Gender, and International Development Research Laboratory will enable Victoria Esses, Bipasha Baruah, and their research teams to conduct multi-year projects on the settlement and integration of immigrants in Canada, and on gender and international development.

Project_Title: Quantitative data collection for model-based biotechnology
Project_Description: This project aims to increase biomanufacturing production efficiency by applying computational modelling to bioprocess production of therapeutics, biofuels, and other high-values molecules. The requested imaging flow cytometer will directly support the commercialization of this novel approach.

Project_Title: Design Environment for Creating Physical Interactive Technology
Project_Description: This project will develop new interactive technologies using a rapid, iterative prototyping methodology. These novel technologies will include flexible multi-touch displays, next generation video game controllers, and large digital surfaces that allow non-experts to create complex physical artifacts.

Project_Title: Research Infrastructure for Continuous Stream Analytics in the Cloud
Project_Description: This proposal requests funding for a cluster of 28 computing servers.  The cluster will be used as an experimental cloud computing environment for research in big-data analytics.  The goal of the proposed research is to develop software tools for analyzing high volumes of continuously-generated data.

Project_Title: Functional significance of binocular vision
Project_Description: The goal of Dr. Niechwiej-Szwedoâ€™s research is to investigate the role of binocular vision in the development of eye movements, eye-hand coordination, and reaching and grasping movements. This research will also examine how these processes are disrupted by visual and oculomotor impairment

Project_Title: Structural and Systems Pharmacology Laboratory for Drug Discovery
Project_Description: The Structural and Systems Pharmacology Laboratory for Drug Discovery at the University of Toronto uses theory and experiment to make discoveries that help us understand drugs: how they work and how to find new ones. It develops software tools and databases which are used worldwide for drug discovery.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Astronomical Instrumentation Development for Large Optical and Future Giant Segmented Telescopes
Project_Description: Coupling advanced instrumentation to large and future giant optical and near-infrared telescopes will revolutionize astronomical discoveries. The Dunlap Institute at University of Toronto will develop the infrastructure to be leaders in advancing innovative astronomical instruments in the 21st century.

Project_Title: The relevance of DNA methylation processes in serotonin genes for the diagnosis and treatment of mental illness
Project_Description: Low levels of the brain chemical serotonin combined with early life stressors can increase the risk for depression and chronic aggression. Recent findings by Dr. Booij suggest it may be possible to use DNA methylation as a non-invasive biomarker for low serotonin in the human brain, prompting further exploration for its use in determining associated risk of (recurrence in) mental illness in which serotonin plays a major role. Dr. Booijâ€™s studies at Queenâ€™s University will investigate DNA methylation as a measure for diagnostic and treatment outcome in individuals diagnosed with Major Depression and in individuals with chronic aggression probl

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Digital Rhetorics Laboratory
Project_Description: The requested lab infrastructure will provide multitouch computing surfaces and interactive devices to support research into innovative forms of communication, relationality, and ethical subjectivityâ€”forms that will be more commensurate with the ways in which we interact through increasing digitizatio

Project_Title: Infrastructure for the biomechanical analysis of high flexion activities of daily living
Project_Description: The requested infrastructure will be used for dynamic measurement of joint motion, muscle activation, and lower limb interactions between segments. These capabilities will enable the study of knee joint mechanics with the objective of preventing joint injury and disease initiation and progression.

Project_Title: A laboratory for freshwater chemistry and northern permafrost change
Project_Description: Permafrost is degrading throughout the Canadian Arctic and Ontarioâ€™s north. This facility will focus on understanding the effects of changing permafrost on water quality and the broader carbon cycle. This work will enable significant skills development for numerous Ontarians, and have direct implications for northern infrastructure and the well-being of northern resident

Project_Title: Microstructured Surfaces and Adaptive Materials Engineering
Project_Description: Problems of microbial contamination continue to affect our healthcare environments and society; patient health, resources, and severe financial costs. This project aims to develop antimicrobial materials having microstructured surfaces to control and prevent bacterial attachment, contamination and transfer.

Project_Title: Monkey models of movement disorders: Electrophysiology and neuromodulation therapies
Project_Description: Dr. Levy aims to study Parkinsonâ€™s disease and dystonia and their treatment with neurosurgery. He will develop animal models of these illnesses to describe the long-term changes in abnormal brain electrical activity and the therapeutic effects of novel brain modulation technique

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Microbial Evolutionary Genomics
Project_Description: Dr. Wong studies the evolution of genomes, with a particular interest in the evolution of antibiotic resistance in disease-causing bacteria. Genome sequencing of bacterial populations will be used to clarify the principles by which antibiotic resistance evolves, and to devise novel treatment strategies.

Project_Title: Neuromuscular recovery after stroke: assessment and intervention
Project_Description: The goal of this research is to reverse the negative impact of stroke on the ability to control movement. The specific objectives are to characterize changes in brain and muscle properties that occur after stroke and to utilize this knowledge to develop new combinations of neurotherapies to enhance motor recovery.

Project_Title: Printed Flexible Electronics: Transformational Technology for Electronics Manufacturing
Project_Description: This research program will explore the use of printed flexible electronics to foster disruptive manufacturing technologies. The novel technologies will enable new global leadership and commercial opportunities in large-area electronics for the Province of Ontario.

Project_Title: Advanced Development & Test Facility for Heavy- Duty Electrified Transportation Systems and Components
Project_Description: The requested infrastructure will support the development of a test facility for heavy-duty electrified transportation systems and components. Hybrid, plug-in hybrid and full electric vehicle components such as electric motor, power converters, control algorithm and battery simulator will be developed and tested with the proposed equipment.

Project_Title: Innovations In Automobile Design For An Aging Population
Project_Description: This research addresses problems experienced by seniors when using their automobile by improving vehicle design. It will link evidence gathered through ergonomic analysis with advanced prototyping techniques to develop designs that consider the needs of older users.

Project_Title: Imaging infrastructure for engineering materials and biological tissues characterization
Project_Description: The proposed research will address the need for efficient and innovative materials for use in structural repair and renewal applications, in addition to accurate and realistic characterization of biological tissues for effective medical interventions, including radiotherapy, surgery and brachytherapy.

Project_Title: Electrical Synapses: From genes to function using transgenic zebrafish
Project_Description: This proposal seeks infrastructure to enable biomedical research that will address a fundamental process of neuronal communication with the power to catalyze translational research assisting in the treatment and prevention of mental health and neurological disorders.

Project_Title: Infrastructure to study brain development disorders using neural cellular models
Project_Description: This research program will investigate the genetic risk factors that cause brain development disorders such as autism and schizophrenia. The program will use innovative technology to study how the genetic risk factors impair brain cell function, and perform novel drug testing to correct identified deficiencies.

Project_Title: Inert atmosphere glovebox for the synthesis of arsenic compounds and the live-harvesting of environmental samples
Project_Description: An inert atmosphere glovebox will enable the safe and efficient synthesis of arsenic compounds believed to be intermediates in the biogeochemical cycling of arsenic. The toxicity, reactivity and ability of the compounds to be transformed by microorganisms to non-toxic arsenic will be investigated.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Centre for Indigenous Knowledge and Education
Project_Description: The Centre for Indigenous Knowledge and Education will be established, supported by multi-media, collaborative suites and a unique database to foster links between academic and community-based groups to significantly impact issues in Aboriginal Education, psychology, and mental health.

Project_Title: Interconnects Characterization Facility
Project_Description: Interconnect design is a crucial yet complex phase of the development of a modern electronic system. The proposed interconnects characterization facility will be used to test new interconnect structures and develop novel methods for their design, supporting microelectronics innovation in Ontario.

Project_Title: High Resolution Imaging of Cell Matrix Signaling: Investigation of Mechanisms by Which Chemical and Mechanical Signals are Transduced Through Cell Adhesions
Project_Description: The generation of signals that control cell activity is dependent on the formation of specialized types of cell adhesions. The objectives of this proposal are to identify how signals are transmitted through cell adhesions using state-of-the-art microscopy methods and to apply this information to drug discovery.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Early Innovative Rehabilitation Interventions for Critically Ill Patients in the Intensive Care Unit
Project_Description: Dr. Khoâ€™s research focuses on effective and creative methods of physiotherapy to help Intensive Care Unit (ICU) patients stay as strong as possible. Project_Description: Infrastructure is requested to expand and enhance Professor Dutcherâ€™s range of capabilities in scanning probe microscopy (SPM) imaging and mechanical property measurements of biomolecules and bacterial cells at surface

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Analysis of Changes in the Hydrology at the Arctic Treeline
Project_Description: Surface water, a key part of the Canadian landscape, is facing serious threats due to both climate change and resource development. This program will consider the effects of changes on streamflow and lake levels and develop predictive tools.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Characterizing Iron Carbon Associations in Soils
Project_Description: The global carbon balance & sustainable food production depend on the management of soil carbon, which is governed by interaction with soil minerals. The infrastructure will support comprehensive assessments of carbon-mineral interactions in soils to mitigate climate change and improve agricultural sustainability.

Project_Title: Novel Molecular Imaging Platform to Elucidate the Role of Membrane Lipids in Neurodegeneration
Project_Description: The infrastructure requested in this proposal will lead to an innovative molecular imaging research facility that will enable the PI and collaborators to identify the role that membrane lipids play in conferring vulnerability to cell death of brain cells.

Project_Description: I am requesting funding for a state-of-the-art microwave test system for my new lab at the Institute for Quantum Computing at UWaterloo. Project_Description: The research program will focus on refining nutrient management practices within agricultural systems to improve environmental sustainability, as well as protecting the quality of soil and water.

Project_Description: Cancer is the primary cause of death in Ontario and conventional treatments are costly. Project_Description: The aim is to improve groundwater monitoring methods and data collection capabilities to address resource sustainability. Project_Title: Drinking Water Treatment Laboratory and Tools
Project_Description: This proposal is for funding to expand laboratory space and acquire tools to support a research program that is exploring novel methods to treat drinking water. The research will help to support Ontarioâ€™s initiative to become a world leader in water-related technologie

Project_Description: In this program, novel processes for extracting lignocelluloses from wasted spent liquor of pulping processes and for converting the extracted lignocelluloses to value-added chemicals and biofuel will be developed.

Project_Description: The acquisition of a mechanical platform for an integrated computational materials engineering lab at University of Toronto will support the development of new technology for lightweight materials. Project_Description: This project will bridge the gap between animal cognition and evolutionary ecology by examining the adaptive value of learning and memory in wild bird populations, using a modern aviary complex, cognitive devices, and population monitoring equipment.

Project_Description: This grant is for a driving simulator and motion-capture system for a multidisciplinary team to study ways to reduce collision risk and to help a new generation of product designers develop in-vehicle devices with the needs of older drivers in mind, making driving safer, more comfortable, and more convenient.

Project_Title: Sensory Ethnography Research Laboratory
Project_Description: A Sensory Ethnography Research Laboratory will be established to examine the dynamics of community change related to issues of art and gentrification in southern Ontario and produce innovative public policies using sensory means of knowledge transfer.

Project_Title: The Innovation, Design, and Consumption Laboratory
Project_Description: The project will enhance our understanding of how consumers respond to innovation, and how marketers can better communicate innovative goods and services to facilitate adoption, and ultimately enhance the future economic sustainability of Canada.

Project_Description: The goal of the project is to establish an innovative centre of drug design and discovery for multiple neurodegenerative disorders including protein misfolding disorders, stroke, retinopathy and epilepsy. This centre will act as a drug design pipeline for innovative therapies.

Project_Description: Chronic and acute lung diseases are hard to detect prior to reaching advanced and incurable stages and have very poor available treatments. Project_Description: The purpose of this grant is to fund a pilot scale water Flow Loop System in which different water and wastewater treatment technologies can be tested and models validated. Project_Description: This project aims to acquire necessary equipment to build a softwareâ€“defined, radio-enabled testbed for devising, implementing, and validating innovative solutions to wireless surveillance and security. Project_Description: Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) can monitor soil quality, crop production and resilience. Contrasted with ground based methods, UAVs are rapid, non-invasive, non-destructive and apply to large scales.

Project_Description: The ultimate goal of the proposed research is to elucidate novel mechanisms causing heart failure, as this information will hopefully provide insight into the development of lifestyle interventions (nutrition and exercise) that are successful in preventing and/or recovering heart function in the failing heart.

Project_Description: The objective of the research is to develop comprehensive bone fracture limits and identify appropriate surrogates (test devices and numerical models) to predict injury.  These studies will reduce the incidence of fractures through enhanced safety, and improve surgical treatment of these injuries.

Project_Description: Dr. Dabdoubâ€™s research will lead to the development of new fundamental knowledge and improve therapies for deafness. Project_Title: Infrastructure for Modeling Human Adipose Tissue Development in the Context of Metabolic Disorders
Project_Description: Canada is in the midst of an obesity epidemic, thus the main goal of the proposed research is to bridge human stem cell and fat development in the context of metabolic diseases, such as obesity and type II diabetes, to identify innovative and novel therapeutic approaches that reduce disease burden.

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Establish an Exercise Physiology Laboratory and to Study and Mathematically Model the Entrainment of the Heart, Lungs, and Locomotor Muscles in Humans Exposed to Environmental Stress
Project_Description: A state-of-the-art Exercise Physiology Laboratory at Nipissing University will support Dr. Raymerâ€™s interdisciplinary study and mathematical modeling of the entrainment of the heart, lungs, and locomotor muscles in humans exposed to environmental stres

Project_Description: We will be using recent advances in our understanding of the properties of light to develop the technology of tomorrow. Project_Description: Using advanced computing and genomic methodologies, this project will develop biological databases and computer tools for effective identification of genetic variants based on genome sequencing. These genetic variants contribute to biological diversity and are linked to genetic diseases in humans.

Project_Description: With the control of single photons, scientists could build sensors with dramatically higher sensitivity, computers than can solve intractable problems, and the first provably secure communication systems. This project will develop techniques to produce and manipulate individual photons on optical microchips.

Project_Description: This research will shed light on biophysical interactions in agricultural ecosystems. We will integrate advanced techniques in ecophysiology and biogeochemistry to develop innovative and resilient agriculture production systems, and establish predictive measures for agroecosystem management.

Project_Title: Child and Family Mobile and Fixed Observation Laboratories and Caring Dadâ€™s Databa
Project_Description: This project will build world-class mobile and fixed labs, and a unique, comprehensive database, to support research to better understand and treat high-risk, violent, abusive and neglectful men and fathers and to continue to reduce violence against women and children in families in Ontario.

Project_Title: Development of Innovative Monitoring Tools to Capture the Early Warning Signs of Future Landslide Instability
Project_Description: The proposed research aims to produce the knowledge, highly qualified graduates, and practical tools to better understand and manage the risk posed by climate change on the soil slopes of Ontarioâ€™s natural and built environmen

Project_Title: Methods and Tools for Developing and Operating Ultra-Large-Scale (ULS) Software Services
Project_Description: Ultra-large-scale (ULS) services (like BlackBerry, Gmail and Facebook) have increasingly become an essential part of our lives. Ensuring their reliability is an important and challenging task given the scale of such services and the impact of their downtime. The requested infrastructure permits the creation of techniques and tools to support the cost-effective development and operation of high-quality ULS services through the use of Software Intelligence techniques that mine the rich, yet-rarely-explored repositories associated with these services.

Project_Title: High-Frequency Trading in Global Financial Markets
Project_Description: The proposed program will study recent proliferation of algorithmic and high-frequency trading on quality, stability, and efficiency of financial markets in Ontario and around the globe.

Project_Description: Dr. Archer and his colleagues discovered that inhibiting mitochondrial division increases cell death, and slows cell proliferation, a characteristic in pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH) and non small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). Project_Description: Multidrug resistant bacteria continue to be a health care burden in both hospital and community settings. Project_Title: Infrastructure to Support Canada Research Chair in Integrative Wildlife Conservation
Project_Description: This research and infrastructure is important to enable the establishment of an Integrative Wildlife Conservation research program that will provide improved understanding of factors affecting the distribution and abundance of animal populations and the structure and function of their ecosystems. Project_Title: University of Guelph, Comparative Obesity Research Program, Infrastructure Development
Project_Description: The Comparative Obesity Research Program aims to advance knowledge of the molecular basis of obesity in multiple species. Research goals are to study the impact of macronutrients and nutraceuticals on body composition and energy metabolism and their use for weight loss and prevention of weight gain.

Project_Description: With the equipment acquired, a newly formed isotope geochemistry facility will analyse tree rings and other organic materials in order to understand past climate and ecosystem function, as well as use stable isotopes to answer environmental, geological, and biological questions.

Project_Description: The goal of this research is to advance minimally invasive diagnostic imaging and therapeutic monitoring in surgical procedures. Project_Title: Real-Time Digital Simulation of Renewable Powered Distribution Systems with Energy Storage
Project_Description: Renewable energy sources add to power system variability. Project_Description: Ontario wildlife species are one of our provinces greatest resources. Project_Description: How do our brains integrate patterns of information over time? This occurs, for example, when each word in a sentence is understood in the context of words that came before. Project_Title: A Long-Wavelength Instrumentation Laboratory
Project_Description: This proposal seeks funding for the infrastructure required for development of next-generation long wavelength instrumentation technologies. Project_Description: The Geospatial Mobility Lab is a first-of-its kind testbed that will be used to support research developing location-based mobile device applications. Project_Title: The Sustainability Challenge for Global Food Security Governance
Project_Description: This project will undertake research that improves understandings of the complex linkages between environmental sustainability and global food security policy and governance outcomes. It further aims to contribute to policy recommendations to improve both food security and sustainability goals.

Project_Description: By utilizing a Q-Exactive Mass Spectrometer, Dr. Moranâ€™s proposal aims to show that tumors originating from different cancer patients have distinctive proteomic profiles (i.e. proteomic â€œsignaturesâ€), which can be used for effective tumor classification and to personalize cancer ther

Project_Description: The infrastructure requested will be used to develop the Mobile Urban Water Processes Laboratory (MUWP Lab) and used to evaluate the performance of Low Impact Development (i.e. next-generation stormwater technologies) at the catchment or neighbourhood-level and assess the implications to receiving water systems.

Project_Description: The research will determine the synergies between physical activity and proper nutrition for the optimal development of musculoskeletal health and performance across the lifespan.

Project_Description: Effects land management decisions and subsequent agricultural production, farm livelihoods, and ecosystem function are investigated using unmanned aerial vehicle infrastructure, socio-ecological field equipment, and new agent-based simulation models.

Project_Description: Our proposal aims to bring super-resolution microscopy and light-sheet fluorescence microscopy to researchers in Ontario. Project_Description: Organic light emitting diodes (OLEDs) offer energy savings in indoor lighting. Project_Title: Mobile Mapping and Manipulation
Project_Description: The objective of the proposed research is to develop autonomous mapping and dexterous manipulation capabilities for mobile robots to facilitate planetary exploration. Project_Title: Exploring the Secret Life of Indoor Particles
Project_Description: The proposed infrastructure is essential to develop and apply innovative methods to study indoor particles and dusts. Project_Description: The proposed research will develop novel computational paradigms to design complex engineering systems. Project_Title: Infrastructure for Advanced Business Analytics: Creating and Analysing Big Data for Canadian Distribution Channels
Project_Description: A framework for using pan-supply chain big data analyses will be created to reduce distribution channel conflict among small and medium enterprises, thereby enhancing competitiveness through innovation in marketing and operations processes.

Project_Title: Regulation of Spinal Cord Excitability in Acute and Chronic Pain States
Project_Description: Better pain treatments require a molecular identification of what goes wrong in chronic pain.  Through neuronal recordings, we will study how changes in the activity and regulation of electrical proteins called ion channels generates dysfunctional spinal cord pain signalling and pain hypersensitivity.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Centre for Workersâ€™ Health and Well-bei
Project_Description: This multi-method and innovative infrastructure will enable research to improve worker health and well-being by: 1) examining the dynamic and causal processes among work demands, resources and their distribution; 2) designing specific, practical and evidence-based interventions.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Advancing Novel Small Molecule Strategies Towards Translational Medicine
Project_Description: Dr. Kotraâ€™s unique research program links basic research with advanced drug discovery infrastructure and industry partners to develop therapeutics for a wide variety of diseases, including infectious diseases (malaria, viral infections) and neurological diseases (multiple sclerosis, diabetic neuropathy
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: A Combined Microanalytical-Experimental Laboratory for Improved Understanding of Ore-Forming Processes
Project_Description: High-temperature geofluids transfer and precipitate economically important elements and generate most of our mineral resources. The proposed research investigates this process by combining high pressure-temperature experimental work with state of the art microanalytical investigation of geologic samples.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: A Tellurium Upgrade for the SNO+ Neutrinoless Double Beta Decay Search
Project_Description: We seek to determine whether or not neutrinos are their own antiparticles by carrying out one of the worldâ€™s most sensitive searches for neutrinoless double beta decay. To do this, we will dissolve tellurium metal into the 760 tonnes of ultrapure liquid scintillator in the SNO+ experiment at SNOLA
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Advancing Mobility Rehabilitation Treatments and Technologies
Project_Description: The goal of this proposal is to develop ways to enable us to study how mobility assistive devices work in real world environments, where they would typically be used. The new information will make it possible to develop more effective devices and provide better treatments for individuals with mobility problems.

Project_Title: Spinal Cord Injury Clinical Research Unit: Optimizing the Translation of Basic Discoveries
Project_Description: Spinal cord injury is a debilitating injury that results in physical impairment and an increased burden of care. The Spinal Cord Injury Clinical Research Unit is a dedicated research space that will evaluate new treatments for the recovery of patients with spinal cord injury.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for the Culture of Complex, Human-Associated, Microbial Communities
Project_Description: This proposal seeks to build on a previous, highly successful CFI/MRI award that created the â€œRobogutâ€ model of the gut microbiota. Infrastructure is requested to update and expand existing equipment to improve capacity and enhance the translational potential of gut ecosystem modeling to he

Project_Title: Epigenetic Regulation in Cancer Development and Progression
Project_Description: This innovative research program will elucidate the functional role of epigenetic regulation in cancer development and progression and will yield key mechanistic understanding that will lead to the identification of new and better diagnostic/prognostic markers for more effective anticancer therapies.

Project_Title: Biocontainment Facility Enhancement
Project_Description: This is a request for infrastructure support to obtain biocontainment isolators for research on infectious diseases and development of vaccines against poultry pathogens. The program is focused on mechanisms of immunity to viruses and developing the next generation of prophylactic means against these viruses.

Project_Title: Discovery of Oncogenic Mechanisms Through Hospital-Based Molecular Profiling
Project_Description: Using state-of-the-art genomics and bioinformatics technologies, Dr. Pughâ€™s innovative program will realize the molecular classification of tumours and link specific genome alterations to cancer phenotypes and treatment outcomes through analysis of clinical case

Project_Title: Science Operating Room Extension (ScORE)
Project_Description: This project will build on significant prior investments to develop the capability for the high-precision testing and evaluation of new imaging agents. These agents will be used to guide cancer therapy through advanced imaging. The validation experiments will also advance our understanding of cancer.

Project_Title: Centre for Arrhythmia Research in Toronto (CART)
Project_Description: To help establish a Centre for Arrhythmia Research in Toronto (CART) with expertise in basic and clinical electrophysiology focused on increasing our understanding of arrhythmias and advancing development of new therapies to treat them.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: The Translational Stroke Research Program
Project_Description: Stroke is a leading cause of death and disability. The conventional model of translating promising stroke therapies from rodent experiments to human clinical trials has failed to provide new efficacious treatments. This project aims to utilize stroke models in higher-order animal species to bridge this gap.

Project_Title: Respiratory Infection Secure Containment (RISC) Facility
Project_Description: The Respiratory Infection Secure Containment (RISC) Facility will provide a biosafe and biosecure laboratory environment in which infectious disease-focused researchers can safely develop new vaccines and antimicrobial therapies to combat deadly bacterial and viral pathogens that spread through the air to infect humans.

Project_Title: Prevention and Personalized Treatment in Hereditary Cancer
Project_Description: Our research program aims to decrease both direct and indirect costs of cancer in Canada by reducing the number of new cases and cancer-related deaths. This goal will be accomplished through our individual- and population-based work to identify individuals at-risk of developing hereditary cancers and treat patients using a personalized approach with targeted therapies.

Project_Title: A Facility for Multi-stressor Biology on Aquatic Organisms
Project_Description: The requested infrastructure will support research to investigate the effects of multiple environmental and pollution-based stressors, such as temperature, salinity, pH, and chemical contaminants, upon aquatic animal development, behaviour and physiology.

Project_Title: Multi-Axis Dynamic Simulator for Testing Operational and Functional Components and Advanced Seismic Isolation Devices
Project_Description: This research program will generate critically needed knowledge on the earthquake behaviour of nonstructural components. This knowledge will facilitate the development of innovative technologies to protect nonstructural components from earthquake damage.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Support Algorithm Development, Verification, and Proof of Principle for Wireless and Computing Systems
Project_Description: Establish a research infrastructure that supports innovation in digital communications and computing spanning theory, algorithms, and hardware.  Develop proof-of-principle implementations for next-generation digital communication systems and methods for power-efficient computation in data centers.

Project_Title: Integrative Mitochondrial Bioenergetic Facility for the Study of Muscle Wasting Diseases
Project_Description: The aim of this proposal is to identify novel cellular pathways responsible for causing muscle wasting in muscular dystrophies and aging in many Ontario citizens.  Once these mechanistic links are identified, numerous drugs known to affect these pathways will be tested for their ability to prevent muscle wasting in these diseases.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Airborne Electromagnetic Sea Ice Thickness Sensor
Project_Description: The proposal aims to obtain the key data for better understanding and predicting sea ice conditions in the Arctic, and for preparing for increased Arctic resource exploration and shipping. Data will be obtained by airborne and satellite surveys, particularly with the requested novel ice thickness sensor
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Toronto Western Investigational New Drug Design & Discovery (WIN-D3) Lab
Project_Description: The goal of the project is to establish an innovative centre of drug design and discovery for multiple neurodegenerative disorders including protein misfolding disorders, stroke, retinopathy and epilepsy. This centre will act as a drug design pipeline for innovative therapies.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Support Obesity and Metabolism Research
Project_Description: The project will test the effects of exercise, nutrition and genetics on adiposity in mice.   It will also investigate the mechanisms mediating these effects by examining modifications that occur on proteins.

Project_Title: High Content Analysis Nanoscope to Study Neurodegeneration and Discover New Compounds for Neurodegenerative Disease
Project_Description: Our goal is to discover new chemical family leads as potential new therapies for Huntington's disease, from working at the single cell level, at nanometer resolution focusing efforts on the molecular trigger of this devastating disease.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: New Tools for Automated and Non-invasive Animal Welfare Assessment
Project_Description: This research will refine measures for assessing laying hen welfare, find causes and solutions for health and behaviour problems in alternative housing and optimize the design of new hen housing systems in order to maintain the sustainable delivery of safe, high quality and affordable eggs to consumers by Ontario egg producers.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Advancing Paediatric Surgical Techniques and Childhood Nutrition Research by Utilizing Isotope-Ratio Mass Spectrometry
Project_Description: Utilization of a state-of-the-art Isotope Ratio Mass Spectrometer will leverage existing expertise at SickKids to further ground-breaking research into two very important areas of paediatric research: (1) Novel paediatric surgical techniques, and (2) Childhood nutrition.

Project_Title: Cannabinoid Drug Discovery
Project_Description: The objective of this proposal is to discover and develop novel small molecules that target the endocannabinoid system and related novel orphan receptor targets that are important in human disease. This research is also directed towards understanding the pharmacology underlying both the detrimental consequence of recreational cannabis smoking and the potential for cannabis used as a medicine.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for the Analysis of Global Change Impacts on Tree and Forest Function
Project_Description: This proposal seeks infrastructure to determine how boreal tree species growth, survival and physiology respond to climate change stress, including rising temperatures, CO2 and drought. This understanding is critical for maintaining forest productivity for sustainable economic development in Ontario.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Multisensory Laboratory
Project_Description: The proposed research will analyze the way our brain integrates multisensory information. Sensory cues can conflict with technology, ageing, injury and disease. The applicant will build the WaTerloo Immersive Multisensory Environment (WaTIME) system to assess and resolve sensory conflict that occurs during self-motion.

Project_Title:
Establishing a Knowledge Translation Centre for Identifying Inhibitors of
Protein-Protein Interactions
Project_Description: Our goal is to establish a facility that can rapidly design, synthesize and identify preclinical candidate, hit-to-lead molecules targeting STAT3 and STAT5 for in vivo analysis in relevant human cancer models.

Project_Title: Deconstructing Biases in the Fossil Record of Exceptional Preservation: Experimental and Geochemical Studies in Soft-Tissue Preservation
Project_Description: The Advanced Taphonomy Laboratory (ATL) will aid in elucidating the pathways responsible for exceptional fossilization by identifying physical, chemical, and biological controls biasing the fossil record. The ATL is unique to Canada, focusing on modeling fossilization through real-life experiments.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Towards an integrated picture of sensory learning in neural circuits
Project_Description: This research seeks an integrated picture of how the brain learns from sensory experience. Dr. Richards' laboratory will use a combination of electrophysiology, computer models, and behavioural experiments to understand how billions of tiny changes to the connections in the brain produce new skills.

Project_Title:
Computational Approaches to Causal and Social Learning in
Children and Animals
Project_Description: From learning to flip a light switch to using a remote control, children must uncover the worldâ€™s causal structure, including the causes and consequences of other peopleâ€™s actions. At the University of Toronto, Dr. Buchsbaum will use experimental and computational techniques to understand childrenâ€™s causal and social reasoning abil

Project_Title: Equipment for Studies of Hybrid Quantum Systems of Spins and Superconductors
Project_Description: This project is to install novel infrastructure that enables the development of a first generation of hybrid quantum processors including ones that combine spins and superconductors as quantum bits. Such processors are an essential step towards larger, general-purpose quantum computers.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Combining Brain Imaging and Genetics for Treatment Innovation in Mental Illness
Project_Description: This proposal aims to develop infrastructure and resources to support two complementary thematic objectives: 1) to use a combination of brain imaging and genetics to understand the effects of mental illness risk genes on the structure and function of the brain; 2) to use advanced neuroimaging approaches in clinical trials to better understand the effects of existing and novel treatments for mental illness on brain structure and function.
Lead_Research_Institution: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health

Project_Title: PEDAL 2.0: Secure Data Linking to Quantify Impacts of Social Intervention
Project_Description: Researchers will develop methods to collect, transform, and link sensitive, proprietary administrative data from sources including school boards and charities in order to quantify the impacts of social policies and programs on individuals and communities.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Linking Current and Future Environment, Physiology, Behaviour, and Life History in Birds
Project_Description: The objective of this project is to investigate how environmental challenges influence animals. We will address this goal through experimental manipulations of the environment and hormones in black-capped chickadees, and measurement of effects on resource investment and population dynamics.

Project_Title: Causes of Inadequate Reading Comprehension in Young Adults
Project_Description: The research goal is to identify common causes of the failure to develop adequate reading comprehension in young Ontarians, a social condition that affects over 40% of 16-25 year olds in the province. The findings will inform reading remediation programs in schools and adult literacy centres.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Engineering a Smart Microgrid Test Platform
Project_Description:
As Ontario continues to close down coal-fired generating plants, our existing power grid must become â€˜smarterâ€™ to accommodate wind, solar and other renewable energy sources more reliably.

A microgrid is an autonomous generating unit operated in isolation locally, or networked to provide energy to Ontarioâ€™s power grid. A smart grid test platform consisting of four microgrid test platforms will provide a comprehensive experimental setup to enable increased renewable energy use in a more efficient and reliable m

Project_Title: Immune Cell Contributions to Endometrial Health and Disease
Project_Description: Infertility and cardiovascular health impairment in mothers and offspring who experience pregnancy complications are significant health issues in Ontario. Our objective is to develop new, clinically important knowledge that will enhance the quality of pregnancy and reduce infertility from endometriosis.

Project_Title: Monitoring Cancer Therapy Using Magnetic Resonance Imaging
Project_Description: Dr. Staniszâ€™s research will lead to the development of new fundamental knowledge and improve non-invasive monitoring of therapies for cancer treatment. His research will cultivate new imaging techniques that will allow a detailed characterization of the complex tumour environmen

Project_Title: Biophysics and Evolulionary Dynamics Laboratory
Project_Description: Sidhartha Goyal's lab will study rapid evolution in the context of (A) mitochondrial genome maintenance, and (B) role of adaptive evolution through CRISPRs in bacteria-phage competition, which will provide insight into age-associated diseases and the role of gut micro biorne in human health and disease.

Project_Title: Mechanisms of Anesthesia and Sleep
Project_Description: Our goal is to understand the molecular mechanisms underlying general anesthesia and sleep, and use this knowledge to develop new treatments for common anesthesia- and sleep-related disorders. The requested infrastructure will allow us to create new animal and human tissue models, which will be used to identify novel drug targets.
