OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Comparative Molecular Physiology Imaging Infrastructure (CoMPII)
Project_Description: The CoMPII project will establish a core biological imagine suite that will be used to address some basic biological questions about how fish and other aquatic animals manage to balance their internal salt, water and pH levels under changing environmental conditions.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Infrastructure for an Immunometabolism Laboratory
Project_Description: This research addresses the obesity epidemic by investigating the underlying bacterial and immune causes of diabetes during obesity. The aim is to discover new diagnostics and therapeutics by understanding how the bacteria that live in our gut cause inflammation and disease during obesity.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Characterization of the Alternative Oxidase of Pathogenic Protists and Treatment of Human Disease
Project_Description: The objective of this proposal is to develop detection methods and treatment options for human diseases caused by parasitic protists. The goal is to ensure the safety of freshwater and the food supply in Ontario. The research impacts the aging population and immuno-compromised or -suppressed individuals.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Functional Genomics
Project_Description: Dr McKay studies the role of post-transcriptional regulation of gene expression in DNA damage responses including the p53 tumour suppressor pathway.  RNA-sequencing, microarrays and flow cytometric analysis of fluorescent reporter genes will be used for analysis of these post-transcriptional processes.

Project_Title: Optimizing Use of Human Milk for Preterm Infants
Project_Description: This grant will enable the purchase of specialized equipment to perform direct nutrient analysis of human milk, known for its nutrient variability. This capacity will improve the rigor of the evaluation and translation into practice of promising nutritional strategies to improve the health of very preterm infants.

Project_Title: Enhanced Characterization Infrastructure for Canada Research Chair in Polymer Nanomaterials
Project_Description: This proposal is to acquire enhanced characterization infrastructure for supporting Dr. Zhibin Yeâ€™s Canada Research Chair (CRC) research program in polymer nanomaterials. The goal of the research is to produce value-added multifunctional polymer nanomaterials for use in various industrie
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: From Fracture to Fluids to Combustion: Infrastructure to understand the implications of hydraulic fracturing
Project_Description: Hydraulic fracturing (â€œfrackingâ€) is a rapidly emergy technology for natural gas production, but many fundamental aspects remain poorly understood, with significant implications for all forms of power generation in Ontario. This work will answer key questions regarding fluid transport, rock fracture and ultimate greenhouse gas emissi

Project_Title: Infrastructure for a Nanomaterials Laboratory
Project_Description: Functional materials are important for technology development. The proposed research will investigate innovative ways of assembling and organizing nanostructures with other materials (including biomolecules and polymers) for advancing biodiagnostic tools and clean energy technologies.

Project_Title: Structure and Function of Carbohydrate-Active Enzymes
Project_Description: Beyond their key role as nutrients, carbohydrates are also important cellular communication molecules. Using a dual approach of structural and functional characterization we will investigate how this important class of bioactive molecules are synthesized and degraded in health and disease associated settings.

Project_Title: Brain Health in Aging: Preventing Dementia Through Exercise and Developing Biomarkers for Early Detection
Project_Description: The proposed research will help Ontario reduce the burden of Alzheimerâ€™s disease on Ontario families and the economy by improving screening protocols for early disease detection and developing exercise interventions to reduce memory loss in senior

Project_Title: High-performance Polymer Materials for Printed Electronics
Project_Description: This proposed research will address the key challenges associated with printed electronics by developing novel electronic polymer materials, which will be enabled by the requested infrastructure for the materials evaluation.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: McMaster Decision Science Laboratory
Project_Description: Using experimental economic methods we will investigate health system outcomes under alternate systems of health care finance and elicit Canadiansâ€™ views on the allocation of health care resources, aiding the development of an efficient, equitable health care syste
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Removal of Micro-Particles in Steel Processing
Project_Description: The objective of this project is to develop and implement a high temperature microscopy technique in order to gain a fundamental understanding of the interaction between micro-particles and liquid oxide systems. This technique will be used to improve micro-particle removal during liquid steel refining.

Project_Title: Preparation of Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM) Foils from Ion Irradiated Samples
Project_Description: A key step in understanding the effects of irradiation on materials is the preparation of foils for study in the electron microscope.  High precision sample preparation is required, with physical cutting followed by ion milling to prepare a sample with better than 0.1mm precision for subsequent viewing.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: The Role of Astroglial Cells in Psychiatric Illness and Its Treatment
Project_Description: This proposal includes two major aims that will elucidate molecular underpinnings of mental illnesses, particularly disorders associated with prematurity (aim 1) and anxiety disorders (aim 2).
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Hardwiring Protein Modifications As Probes of Signalling, Epigenetic, & Redox Networks
Project_Description: The proposed research will establish systems that synthesize proteins with multiple non-canonical amino acids to investigate the role of protein modifications in cellular signalling pathways and cancer mechanisms and to create proteins with novel properties.

Project_Title: Parallel Computer for the Development of New Algorithms in Quantum Mechanics
Project_Description: I shall develop and apply new theoretical/computational methods for studying the motion of molecules.  An important goal is to develop methods that will permit us to study larger molecules.  Understanding the motion of molecules enables scientists to identify and study molecules in the atmosphere and in combustion processes.  Our work will provide information necessary for understanding how molecules in the atmosphere absorb and emit radiation which is important for modelling global warming

Project_Title: A Natural Behaviour Laboratory for the Investigation of Embodied and Embedded Cognition
Project_Description: The requested funds will be used to set up a natural behaviour laboratory for the investigation of embodied and embedded cognition. This equipment will enable basic research investigating how we use our body and physical environment to help us think and how this coupling ultimately shapes our thinking.

Project_Title: NMR Enhancement at Moderate Magnetic Fields
Project_Description: The objective of this grant is to secure funding for the renewal of the Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Center at the University of Toronto by purchasing state of the art moderate field spectrometers. These will be used for obtaining three-dimensional images of proteins that are implicated in a variety of diseases, leading to an understanding of molecular function and the design of new therapeutics.

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Support Canada Research Chair in Evidence-Based Orthopaedic Surgery
Project_Description: Trauma is the fourth leading cause of death in the first four decades of life worldwide and many experience temporary and permanent disability as a result (ACSCT 2003, CIHI 2013). The research program will identify and disseminate novel therapies to improve the lives of persons with musculoskeletal trauma.

Project_Title: Tools for Synthesis and Characterization of Inorganic Materials
Project_Description: Dr. Stephan's research program targets new compounds, materials and catalyst technologies for chemical transformations in a program of synthetic inorganic/organometallic chemistry involving air- and moisture-sensitive materials and the subsequent characterization of the resulting products.

Project_Title: Laboratory for the Investigation of Neuromuscular Plasticity in Health and Disease
Project_Description: This research will use innovative strategies to investigate whether physical activity and drug interventions can result in beneficial neuromuscular remodeling to slow, reverse or prevent the progress of neuromuscular disorders.

Project_Title: Genomics and Transcriptomics Laboratory for Model and Non-Model Species (GenTranLab)
Project_Description: The objective of this proposal is to create a facility to explore the connection between genetic complexity and biological diversity. The key elements of this facility are instrumentation for genome sequencing, quantification of gene expression, and culturing of microbial strains and communities.

Project_Title: Centre for Comparative and Evolutionary Biomechanics
Project_Description: The Centre for Comparative and Evolutionary Biomechanics (CCEB) will address evolutionary, ecological, and engineering questions, to foster the designing of new biomimetic materials and robots through the study of aquatic animals such as the armoured fish Polypterus senegalus.

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Support Cancer Risk Assessment Research
Project_Description: This epidemiologic study investigates whether alterations of micro Ribonucleic Acids (miRNAs), a class of molecules that controls many genes and proteins often related to cancer, are associated with the development of cancer many years later in a large cohort of women.

Project_Title: Integrated Quantum Photonics for Secure Communications
Project_Description: As computers become more powerful, traditional methods for encrypting data can be more easily compromised. Quantum key distribution (QKD) offers unparalleled security for data communication. The research will contribute to the development and cost reduction of QKD devices and systems.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Research Platform for Development of Devices and Assays for Drug Discovery
Project_Description: This project will develop innovative new tools and methods that will extract medicinally important bioactive and concentrated forms of compounds and mixtures from natural products and test them on animal models in a comprehensive manner thereby accelerating the process of drug discovery for treatment of neurological diseases such as Parkinsonâ€™

Project_Title: Merging Mathematical Cognition and Instructional Intervention
Project_Description: The Mathematical Cognition and Instruction Lab (MCIL) will improve our understanding of the mental processes that underlay childrenâ€™s mathematical thinking. Advanced technologies will illustrate both proficiency and learning disabilities in math, and lead to interventions that alleviate difficulties in learnin
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Neurochemical Basis of Behaviour
Project_Description: Dr. Parker, a world leader in the neurobiology of nausea, will study the neuroanatomical and neurochemical basis of the sensation of nausea, as well as the therapeutic efficacy of manipulations of the endocannabinoid system to reduce nausea, a sensation which is highly resistant to available treatments

Project_Title: Laboratory for Cell-based Regenerative Strategies with Adipose-derived Stem Cells
Project_Description: This research is focused on soft tissue engineering using adult stem cells isolated from fat and naturally-derived biomaterial scaffolds for the development of new cell-based therapies for applications in soft tissue reconstruction, wound healing, the treatment of cardiovascular disease, and joint regeneration.

Project_Title: Bidirectional Cyclic Simple Shear Testing of Soils
Project_Description: During earthquakes, storms or hurricanes cyclic shear loads are actually applied in more than one horizontal direction to the ground. A bidirectional cyclic simple shear testing apparatus, which applies monotonic and cyclic stresses, is requested in this proposal to study these complex loading patterns.

Project_Title: Neural Mechanisms of Natural Scene Perception
Project_Description: How do we see the world around us? Using brain recordings of people viewing images of natural scenes and measurements of eye movements, Dr. Bernhardt-Walther will decipher the codes and algorithms used by the brain to interpret our visual environment.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Laboratory for the Study of Hypoxic Protein Synthesis in Human Cancer Cells
Project_Description: Dr. Uniackeâ€™s research program is focused on how the protein synthesis machinery in humans changes in response to oxygen deprivation (hypoxia) and how cancer cells exploit this to adapt to the hypoxic cores of tumors. This will benefit future initiatives in the pharmaceutical industries targeted at drug design in cancer therap

Project_Title: Experimental Facility for Smart Infrastructure Research
Project_Description: The equipment being requested will enable the applicant to undertake cutting-edge research on monitoring and predicting catastrophic failures of civil infrastructure through the use of control and measurement hardware and statistical signal processing algorithms.

Project_Title: Laboratory for Fundamental and Applied Ecology
Project_Description: Creating a more sustainable world is a provincial, national and international priority. This project will advance the scientific understanding of the ecological basis of sustainability by examining biodiversity conservation, disease transmission, aquaculture production, and fisheries collapse.

Project_Title: Diagnostic and Biomechanical Surrogate Development for Head Injury Reduction using High-speed X-ray Fluoroscopy
Project_Description: The prevalence of concussion among athletes suggests a need to reassess acceleration-based helmet performance criteria. A diagnostic that can instrument a tissue-simulating headform will be developed to provide this alternate performance metric, a measure of impact-induced brain deformation.

Project_Title: The Plant Metabolic Biochemistry Laboratory
Project_Description: Plants make a splendid array of compounds that impact our everyday lives, however we still know very little about how plants actually make them. The focus of this proposal is to create a world class plant metabolic biochemistry laboratory with the ultimate goal of discovering these processes.

Project_Title:
The Nature of Neotyphodium-PoÃ¶ideae Symbioses: 
Biology, Agronomy, Ecological Invasions, and Climate Chang
Project_Description: Commonly used pasture and turfgrasses are introduced to Canada from Europe. They are often found in association with fungus that grows inside the plant and brings many benefits to its host. Unfortunately these same beneficial traits also make these plants problematic when they escape cultivation.

Project_Title: The Neurodevelopment and Degeneration Laboratory (NDL)
Project_Description: The Neurodevelopment and Degeneration Laboratory (NDL) will strive to answer fundamental questions in neuroscience, develop new tools for collaborative investigation into the mechanisms underlying neurological disorders and train scientists in the areas of molecular neuroscience and stem cell biology.

Project_Title: Laboratory for Micro-Robotics Research
Project_Description: The proposed infrastructure supports research in the design and control of groups of micro-scale robots for biotechnology, micro-manufacturing and medical applications. Controlled by magnetic fields, these sub-millimeter robots provide unprecedented access to small confined spaces in a non-invasive manner.

Project_Title: Hearing Technology Research Laboratory
Project_Description: The proposed Hearing Technology Research Laboratory will allow the research team to develop 1) better methodologies and tools for assessing hearing disorders, 2) improved computational models of hearing loss and tinnitus, and 3) improved biomedical devices for treating hearing disorders and tinnitus.

Project_Title: Laboratory for Prototyping Energy and Water Systems
Project_Description: The goal of this research program is to develop innovative and cost-effective energy and water system solutions for both remote locations and larger communities. This work will develop innovative system prototypes and formulate computational methods to aid in system design.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for a Translational Oncology Research Laboratory
Project_Description: Effective clinical application of new cancer drug discoveries has been historically challenging. This proposal aims to improve cancer drug development by incorporating the study of naturally occurring cancers in pet dogs that accurately reflect the biology of human cancer, to the benefit of both species.

Project_Title: Indoor/Outdoor Testbed for Aerial and Ground Multi-Robot Research
Project_Description: The goal of the proposed research is to develop learning and adaptation capabilities for mobile robots to facilitate reliable, long-term service applications. These will be validated on a state-of-the-art, multi-robot testbed. The work will strengthen Ontarioâ€™s reputation for excellence in space and aerial robotic
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Search for GeV Dark Matter
Project_Description: For many years researchers have sought the elusive Dark Matter of our universe. The proposed research project will increase the sensitivity and widen the search window for dark matter particles with an innovative spherical gaseous detector at Ontarioâ€™s premier astroparticle physics lab, SNOLA

Project_Title: Super Resolution Optical Imaging of Mitochondrial Dynamics in Human Diseases
Project_Description: Rapid cell proliferation and apoptosis resistance are hallmarks of pulmonary hypertension and cancer. Disordered mitochondrial dynamics contribute to these abnormalities. Dr. Archer proposing using a new super-resolution microscope to image mitochondrial structure and develop mitochondrial-targeted therapies.

Project_Title: Laboratory for Information Visualization
Project_Description: n order to create new ways to gain useful insight from large volumes of language data, new ways of seeing the data are needed.  The requested infrastructure will provide computing capacity for language analysis and new interactive technologies to support engaging exploration of data.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies
Lead_Research_Institution: University of Ontario Institute of Technology

Project_Title: Magnetic Control of Microstructure Morphology: Means for Control of Material Properties in Nanocomposites
Project_Description: 3D printing is the future of manufacturing. However, current technology can only print objects with homogeneous material properties. This limits its applicability as complex objects comprise multiple parts having different properties. The research will enable printers that control material properties on demand.

Project_Title: An Expanded Integrated Cancer Research Biomatrix
Project_Description: The expanded cancer research Biomatrix is a data warehouse which will contain clinical information collected from patients in our cancer programs.  Scientists will use this data to develop new cancer treatments, design better methods for detecting cancer earlier and to find ways of preventing cancer

Project_Title: High Voltage Energy Conversion Laboratory
Project_Description: The research will demonstrate the feasibility of a new electric generator technology that can operate at very high DC voltage. The new generator concept has a power density 10 times higher that of current state-of-the-art generators, while being more energy efficient.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Genetic and Molecular Epidemiology
Project_Description: Heart disease and cerebrovascular disease are the second and third leading causes of death in Canada, respectively.  The proposed research aims to reduce the burden of cardiovascular diseases in Ontario by discovering their genetic causes and creating novel preventive strategies.

Project_Title: The EvoHealth Physiology Laboratory: Testing the evolved function of depression
Project_Description: Depressive cognition is resistant to distraction, and there is debate as to whether this is an adaptive or maladaptive feature. This proposal seeks equipment to resolve this debate by examining how 3 systems involved in distraction-resistance (brain, visual, cardiovascular) are regulated by depressive symptoms.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Establishing a Facility for Cognitive Neuroscience in Acquired Brain Injury
Project_Description: This research will examine some of the most important aspects of our lives, namely our ability to communicate and remember information about our pasts, our thoughts, and our emotions, and to inform diagnostic and treatment development for a range of conditions in which these processes are disrupted.

Project_Title: Quantitative Methods and Infrastructure for Rapid, Evidence-Based Decision-Support in Public Health
Project_Description: The principal objective of this proposal is to develop decision-support tools, using computational infrastructure to assess the risk of impending events, provide population health indicators based on the latest available data and information, and identify optimal management strategies for informing health policies and effective responses.

Project_Title: Experimental Techniques to Determine the Rheological Properties of Polymeric Liquids
Project_Description: I propose to create a world-class laboratory at Queenâ€™s University for research on the flow properties of polymeric liquids, and specifically, for measuring the elasticity of these liquids. The Ontario plastics industry, and its continued growth, will revolve around how well we can understand elastic liquid
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Advanced Materials Research Consortium
Project_Description: The Advanced Materials Research Consortium aims at developing new, competitive, and sustainable technologies for resource recovery and processing, waste abatement and treatment to improve sustainability of industrial activities and to train a highly skilled and educated workforce for the Ontario mining and manufacturing sectors.

Project_Title: Investigating Cognition in Parkinson's Disease: Identifying Clinical and Cognitive Features That Predict Functional Impairment
Project_Description: Using tests of cognition, modern neuroimaging, driving simulation, and virtual reality technology, the aim is to clarify cognitive deficits in Parkinsonâ€™s disease (PD) and to understand how they affect real-world functions (e.g., driving).  The overarching aim is to identify patients at risk and to improve managemen

Project_Title: Biodiversity and Conservation of Freshwater Fishes Laboratory
Project_Description: A Biodiversity and Conservation of Freshwater Fishes Laboratory will be developed using the requested infrastructure of fish and water quality sampling equipment. The lab will be used to identify the threats to fish biodiversity in Ontario in order to inform conservation efforts to protect this biodiversity.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Advanced Live-cell Microscopy to Study Membrane Dynamics, Identity and Function
Project_Description: We aim to understand the molecular signals and processes that dynamically control the properties and functions of membrane organelles.  Organelle dysfunction underpins disease development like cancer and infection.  To do this, we require advanced imaging instruments to directly observe cell behaviour.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Continuous, Privacy Preserving, Data Cleaning at the McMaster Data Science Lab
Project_Description: The proposed computing infrastructure will be used to develop and test automated data cleaning tools that will enable users and organizations to reap value from their data faster.  These tools will enable fast cleaning of dynamic data, while ensuring the non-disclosure of sensitive information.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Equipment For Organic Materials Synthesis, Purification and Characterization
Project_Description: This infrastructure investment will enable the development of novel synthetic methods that allow efficient access to important conjugated materials. Ultimately, these materials will be sought in applications such as organic photovoltaics, light emitting diodes and field-effect transistors.

Project_Title: CRC Tier II in Ecotoxicogenomics and Endocrine Disruption
Project_Description: The CRC tier II in Ecotoxicogenomics and Endocrine Disruption will study how hormone-mimicking chemicals that are present in the environment operate and interact with the physiological functions of animals and will develop new diagnostic tools to measure these environmental health stressors.

Project_Title: Advanced Chemical Vapour Deposition System for Nanostructured Clean Energy Materials Development
Project_Description: An advanced chemical vapour deposition system with x-ray diffraction will be used to develop novel nanostructured materials for clean energy technologies. Results will lead to material breakthroughs in fuel cells and metal-air batteries that will be of significance to the Ontario fuel cells and battery industry.

Project_Title: Ultrafast Electron Sources for Atomically-Resolved Dynamics and High-Resolution Imaging
Project_Description: A state-of-the-art ultrafast electron diffraction setup will be developed to allow the investigation of molecular structure and photoinduced dynamical processes with atomic spatial resolution. It will bring new vistas in the characterization of novel materials and the determination of protein structures.

Project_Title: Gas Chromatograph and Ultraportable Sensor for Determination of Peatland Greenhouse Gas Exchange
Project_Description: A gas chromatograph and ultraportable greenhouse gas (GHG) sensor will be used to measure peatland GHG flux under various land uses. Results will improve understanding of the interaction between peatlands and climate. Restoration practices to minimize peatland GHG emission will be identified.

Project_Title: Isotopic and Geochemical Investigations of Planetary Materials
Project_Description: The aim of this application is to establish state of the art infrastructure dedicated to the geochemical study of planetary materials in Ontario. This infrastructure will be used for the development of innovative methods for the analysis of geological and extra-terrestrial materials to constrain their formation history.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: A State-of-the-Art Optical Towing Tank for the 21st Century
Project_Description: The new optical towing-tank facility, along with state-of-the-art imaging techniques, will allow for complete characterization of unsteady aerodynamic and hydrodynamic problems ranging from small flying sensors and underwater vehicles up to large-scale wind and water turbines.

Project_Title: Creation of a Laboratory to Study Signal Transduction and Gene Regulation in Cancer
Project_Description: Dr. Salmenaâ€™s research proposal aims to build a laboratory dedicated to the investigation of disrupted phosphoinositide signal transduction and microRNA-mediated gene regulation in acute myeloid leukemia (AML).  These efforts will help clinicians to choose more effective strategies and therapies to improve the outcome of patients with AM

Project_Title: Human Origins Laboratory at Lakehead University
Project_Description: Dr. Tocheri's research program aims to increase understanding of human groups and societies through time. He will create a specialized, state-of-the-art laboratory at Lakehead University dedicated to the study of human origins, and will provide Canadian students with specialized research training and skills.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Facility for Research on Structural Behaviour of Wrinkled Energy Pipelines
Project_Description: Buried oil and gas pipelines develop various defects and one such defects is wrinkle. This research will investigate the structural behaviour and failure mode for pipelines with small wrinkle defect subject to cyclic deformations resulting from pressure fluctuations of fluid and seasonal temperature variations.

Project_Title: Establishment of the Nipissing University Youth Development Through Sport and Physical Activity Laboratory
Project_Description: The CFI infrastructure will lead to the development of a Youth Development through Sport and Physical Activity Laboratory, provide critical support for Dr. Brunerâ€™s Canada Research Chair research program, and will enable capacity for inquiry that is unique within Ontario and Canad
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Freshwater Ecology and Fisheries
Project_Description: This project will demonstrate how environmental changes (e.g. climate change, pollution, species invasion) alter fish behaviour, and how behavioural change can affect populations, ecosystems and capture rates. The goal of this research is to improve fisheries management strategies in Canada.

Project_Title: Mechanisms and Features of Social Networks in Drosophila
Project_Description: This research will identify behavioural and cellular mechanisms of social behaviour. Using Drosophila as a model system we will characterize genes underlying social network interactions, the evolution of sociality, and the use of artificial intelligence to define features of sociality.

Project_Title: Green Chemicals and Processes
Project_Description: In this program, novel processes for extracting lignocelluloses from wasted spent liquors of pulping processes and for converting the extracted lignocelluloses to flocculants, dispersants, depressants and collectors, which have an extensive application in the mining and oil industries, will be developed.

Project_Title: Equipment for Electrophysiological Recording and Functional Imaging of Brain Plasticity
Project_Description: The objective of the proposal is to expand our work in hearing restoration into studies of functional brain imaging and into non-human primates.  This work will examine how the brain of hearing subjects processes sound and how the brain processes sound in deaf subjects following hearing restoration.

Project_Title: Long-term Environmental Change Facility
Project_Description: Long-term environmental trends in aquatic ecosystems will be studied using information preserved in lake sediments, and used to assess the impacts of various multiple stressors associated with industrial activities, land-use development and climate change.

Project_Title: Toronto Social Psychophysiology Lab: Multi-method Observation of Dyads and Groups
Project_Description: The proposed research examines the physiological underpinnings of successful social interactions in multicultural societies like Canada. The research infrastructure will be the first of its kind in Canada to simultaneously collect subjective, behavioural, and physiological data in small groups.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Studying Self-Propagating Protein Aggregates
Project_Description: Self-propagating protein aggregates play a key role in the pathogenesis of Alzheimerâ€™s and Parkinsonâ€™s disease. We intend to identify and characterize self-propagating protein aggregates using cell and animal models of neurodegenerative diseases. This research may lead to new therapeutic targ

Project_Title: A Portable Eye Tracking-EEG System
Project_Description: The purchase of a portable eye tracker-EEG system will allow conducting world-class investigations in the neural bases of face perception and social cognition directly in schools and community settings to test clinical populations and will also enable the study of live dyadic social interactions at the brain level.

Project_Title: Nonlinear Integrated Optical Devices Based on III-V Semiconductors for Quantum and Classical Communications
Project_Description: The goal is to develop integrated photonic circuits for optical communication networks. Such circuits will implement all-optical signal processing that will overcome fundamental limitations of electronics. Another goal is to produce on-chip sources for quantum communications that enable secure information transfer.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: CRC Tier II in Self-Assembly and Nanomaterials
Project_Description: The research proposal is aimed at the characterization of confined environment for the development of tailored nanoreactors. The dispersed and active catalytic center is photosensitive, it possesses a very high surface area and will be provide optimal light absorption capability for photosynthesis and fuel cell applications.

Project_Title: Extraction, Processing, and Recycling of Strategic Materials
Project_Description: The goal of our research is to address the sustainability challenges and criticality concerns associated with increasingly important strategic materials (primarily rare-earth elements), through developing advanced electrochemical and hydrometallurgical processes for their extraction and recycling.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Stable Isotope Facility for Improved Understanding of the Fate and Removal of Emerging Contaminants in Water
Project_Description: This research will use Compound Specific Isotope Analysis (CSIA) to advance the understanding of the transformation, transfer, and removal of emerging contaminants from surface water. Cost-effective water treatment solutions will be evaluated using CSIA to protect human and ecosystem health.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Enhancement of Low Background Counting and Assay Technologies at LU for SNO+
Project_Description: SNO+ will study neutrinos from the sun at low energies, and by adding Tellurium it is also possible to look for a very rare decay. This project proposes to enhance the technologies and processing to ensure low backgrounds and improve the sensitivity of measuring these very small numbers and training HQPâ€™

Project_Title: Connecting Genes to Molecules in Marine Proteobacteria to Discover New Compounds and Biosynthetic Pathways
Project_Description: We aim to discover therapeutically useful molecules and their biosynthetic pathways in marine bacteria. Transformation-Associated Recombination is a ground breaking new technique that will be used to capture and study the genes responsible for producing these important natural product molecules.

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Support Human Colon Function Assessment
Project_Description: The objective is to provide better diagnosis and evaluation of treatment options for chronic constipation. An innovative 84-sensor acquisition and analysis system is requested that will allow unprecedented analysis of colonic motility patterns and research into the causes of chronic constipation.

Project_Title: Nextgen Sequencing Laboratory for Methods Development and Deciphering Genomic and Epigenetic Causes of Complex Disease
Project_Description: Taking advantage of high-throughput sequencing, we will establish improved approaches for interrogating biological information contained in DNA and RNA. In conjunction with established expression genetics methodologies, these methods will yield new insights into heritable causes of complex human diseases.

Project_Title: Development of Environmentally Responsible Hydrometallurgical Processes
Project_Description: The goals of the proposed research projects are: (1) to develop effective processes for copper and gold extraction, and (2) to lower the negative impact of metal extraction processes on the environment. The results of the proposed research will advance our understanding of hydrometallurgical metal extraction processes.

Project_Title: Neurocognitive Aging: Bridging the Gap Between Neuroscience and Neurointervention
Project_Description: The overarching goal of this proposal is to enhance the cognitive health of older Ontarians. A combination of state-of-the-art brain imaging and brain-stimulation techniques will be used to identify age-related brain changes and guide therapies to slow the trajectory of age-related cognitive decline.

Project_Title: Exploration of a Rectifying Antenna Solar Cell Technology
Project_Description: The objective of the proposed research is to study optical rectification plasmonic antenna technology to overcome the theoretical 32% efficiency limit of single junction solar cells. State of the art instrumentation will permit us to investigate the individual steps of the process towards the goal of developing an innovative Ontario-owned photovoltaic solar cell technology.

Project_Title: The Role of Emotions and Heuristics on Individual Behavior and Strategic Interactions
Project_Description: Researchers will use simple computerized games to evaluate the influence of emotions and suboptimal problem solving on decision-making. Research conducted in this laboratory will impact economic modelling, as well have implications for education, health, and regulatory policy.

Project_Title: Advanced Human Computer Interaction Laboratory
Project_Description: Supported by the proposed advanced Human Computer Interaction Lab, this research seeks to improve online experiences for older adults, as well as identify ways to keep the Millennial generation engaged and motivated during learning and work processes.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: The Songbird Project: An Integrative Examination of Social Behaviour
Project_Description: The project develops a new preparation for studying social environmentsâ€™ effects on individualsâ€™ health, reproduction, neurobiology, and even evolution. New automated monitoring and recording technologies will be implemented to experiment on groups, providing a profoundly new window into social

Project_Title: Virtual Electric and Hybrid Electric Vehicle Power Integration Lab (HEPIL)
Project_Description: This project will include a globally unique axle-mounted all-wheel drive chassis dynamometer system with vehicle-to-grid capabilities for advanced research on the next generation of vehicles with electrified powertrains. It will position Ontario as an international leader in electrified vehicle research and testing.

Project_Title: Canadian Additive Manufacturing Network (Can-AMN)
Project_Description: The Canadian Additive Manufacturing Network (Can-AMN) will foster transformative research on additive manufacturing with broad impact on critical issues related to Ontarioâ€™s aging population and manufacturing sectors. It will promote collaborative multidisciplinary research on system integration, processes and material

Project_Title: Evaluating Soil Health and Soil Ecosystem Services for Improved Performance of Agroecosystems Under Climate Change
Project_Description: Using 18 fully instrumented soil mesocosms, unique to North America, we will investigate soil health and its role in agricultural productivity and ecosystem services, including carbon sequestration and improved water quality, as affected by climate change.  Management practices that improve soil ecosystem services will be developed.

Project_Title: Dynamic Complexes and Large-Scale Assemblies in Neurobiology and Disease
Project_Description: To therapeutically target neurological disease, we will characterize novel dynamic complexes and large-scale assemblies of intrinsically disordered proteins that control neuronal function. Equipment that enables detailed structural and dynamic information on these states, distinct from standard tools for static systems, is required.

Project_Title: Facility for Fully Interactive Physio-Digital Spaces
Project_Description: We propose a facility to invent Fully Interactive Physio-digital Spaces (FIPS) where every physical thing can display digital information and sense interaction. Our research will shape the next paradigm of digital media by developing FIPS toolkits and infrastructure, interaction vocabularies, applications, and new media artworks.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Research Facility for Integrated Building Energy Harvesting Systems
Project_Description: REFIBES, a one-of-a-kind research facility, will integrate the latest and most exciting energy technologies in a way that will address the worldâ€™s sustainable energy challenge by integrating electricity, thermal, transportation and fuel systems into smart community energy node

Project_Title: The Robohub: A Robotic Test Facility for Multi-Robot Teams
Project_Description: The Robohub will create a dynamic centre for multi-disciplinary research into robotic solutions for hazardous environment operation, assistance for the elderly and disabled, human-machine interaction, and clean manufacturing. It will develop and deploy aerial, humanoid and magnetic levitation vehicles, as well as heterogeneous robot teams.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Biomaterials Nanoscale Imaging and Characterization (BIONIC)
Project_Description: BIONIC will establish a facility enabling biomaterials and their interactions with cells to be studied in 3-D through an integrated combination of nanofabrication, electron and optical microscopies, and in situ characterization techniques. This will advance transformative materials-based strategies for studying, preventing, and treating disease.

Project_Title: Enhancing the Resilience and Sustainability of Critical Geotechnical Infrastructure
Project_Description: This proposal will create a unique laboratory drum centrifuge facility for conducting scaled physical modeling of geotechnical problems of great significance to Ontario, involving the resilience and sustainability of critical societal infrastructure for the built environment, energy resources and natural hazard mitigation.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Advanced Disaster, Emergency, Rapid Response Simulation (ADERSIM) Program
Project_Description: The ADERSIM research infrastructure and program team expertise will develop state-of-the-art modelling and simulation technology to evaluate and enhance disaster and emergency planning and rapid emergency response strategies by governmental, non-governmental, private and public sector companies and businesses in Ontario.

Project_Title: Responsive Ecologies Lab -  RE/Lab
Project_Description: The Responsive Ecologies Lab investigates how technologies can improve our quality of life, social communication, wellbeing, and learning and creativity. By developing novel tools and multisensory interfaces, we will provide solutions to environmental, health, and social challenges while creating innovative economic opportunities.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Organ Repair Laboratory
Project_Description: The Organ Repair Laboratory (ORL) will provide new ways to assess and repair donor lungs and livers before transplantation. This will help to address the shortage of donor organs in Ontario and provide a higher patient quality of life. The ORL will provide a foundation to expand repair innovations to other transplantable organs in the future.

Project_Title: ARIEL-II: Driving Scientific Discovery and Health Science with TRIUMFâ€™s Advanced Rare Isotope Laborato
Project_Description: ARIEL-II will dramatically expand Canadaâ€™s novel isotope production capabilities for discovery and health science and will generate societal and economic benefits by advancing medical imaging and targeted tumour therapy, attracting world-class talent to Ontario, expanding commercialization of accelerator technologies, and creating high-paying job
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: A Molecular Approach to Surface Functionalization: From Automotive to Biomedical Applications
Project_Description: Innovative coatings that repel water- and oil-borne contaminants, and protect metals from acid, heat, and oxidation will be developed. Significant automotive applications include high-tech lubricants and corrosion-preventing coatings.  Coatings for metal nanoparticles will provide high efficiency solar cells, and low-toxicity chemotherapy.

Project_Title: Engineered Biologics - Targeted Diagnostics and Therapy
Project_Description: TRAC and CPO have established a program to develop synthetic antibody (Ab)-based diagnostics and therapeutics for cancer. The requested infrastructure will increase output allowing for generation of Abs against diverse antigens, rapid translation into therapeutic or diagnostic agents and increased collaborations.

Project_Title: The Centre of Immune Profiling â€“ A Next-Generation Paradigm for Understanding and Treating Immune Disea
Project_Description: The Centre for Immune Profiling will provide a state-of-the-art technology platform for comprehensively characterizing the immunologic pathways underpinning autoimmune disease and translating this knowledge into more effective treatments and biomarkers enabling prevention of disease and/or its progression so as to transform health outcomes.

Project_Title: Integrated Systems-Level Imaging (ISLI)
Project_Description: To continue to expand our world leading and highly translational imaging research program we require new development laboratories, prototyping equipment and computing resources. With these facilities we will advance image guidance and  radiomics technologies to direct interventions and personalize medicine.

Project_Title: Canadian Planetary Simulator (CAPS)
Project_Description: The project will enable innovative research on planetary surface environments- including extreme terrestrial environments. The inclusion of state-of-the-arts instruments will enable mult-disciplinary investigations, new instrumentation, new instrumentation techniques and the training of HQP in the analytical sciences.

Project_Title: CRESS - Suborbital Payload Research Center (SPaRC)
Project_Description: Intended to centralize Canadaâ€™s atmospheric and Earth-surface research programs, the proposed state-of-the-art research facility will rely on the demonstrated capability of the science and engineering team to design, build, characterize and operate instruments and payloads for sub-orbital missions for environmental monitorin

Project_Title: Food Security in a Changing World: Centre for Plant-Microbe Chemical Genomics
Project_Description: Our goal is to provide farmers with novel, environmentally benign alternatives to agrochemicals to control pathogens of both field and greenhouse crops, and thereby ensure the continued production of crops of high quality and value in the face of intensified environmental challenges.

Project_Title: The Stem Cell Epigenetics and Therapeutics
Project_Description: This proposal requests critical infrastructure for OHRI's Sprott Centre for Stem Cell Research, which will augment and accelerate our research pipeline for cellular and molecular analyses, epigenetic and genomic analyses, preclinical development, and clinical translation of novel regenerative medicine therapeutics.

Project_Title: Canada's Genomics Enterprise (CGEn): A National Genomic Tools Network for Transforming Life Science Research
Project_Description: This project will create a pan-Canadian infrastructure for production-scale, whole-genome sequencing, with transformational impact on biomedical and other life science research. The Ontario node will be implemented at The Centre for Applied Genomics at The Hospital for Sick Children in Toronto.

Project_Title: Smart Grid: Cyber-Physical Operation, Security and Quantum Technology
Project_Description: Our goal is to make our critical infrastructure, namely, power distribution systems, smart andsecure in the Internet Age. We will perform a large-scale co-simulation and study the cyberphysicaloperation and security of a large-scale Smart Grid. We will exploit quantumcommunication to achieve low latency and high security.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Interventional Device Development and Testing Platform
Project_Description: Building on the Centre for Research in Image-Guided Therapeutics, SRI is extending its capabilities in thedevelopment and testing of new medical technologies with the addition of a fully equipped catheterizationlab for preclinical studies, and new micro-machining capabilities in its Device Development Lab.

Project_Title: High-Resolution Discovery Tools to Enable Personalized Cancer Medicine
Project_Description: This initiative will establish state-of-the-art proteomics, structural biology and optical micro-imaging capabilities for multi-dimensional tumour phenotype analysis to enable an innovative research program that will realize personalized cancer medicine.

Project_Title: Toward Cutting Edge Science: Establishing Advanced Micro-beam Capability for Macromolecular Crystallography at the CLS
Project_Description: The study of challenging research objects, e.g. membrane proteins and protein:protein complexes, require the use of ever smaller crystals for diffraction analysis. This requires upgrades (source, optics, alignment, detector) to Canadaâ€™s only insertion station, beamline 08ID-1 at the CL

Project_Title: Centre for Original Medical Target Evaluation and Translation - Accelerating a First In Human Innovation Strategy (COMET-Alpha)
Project_Description: Building on previous investments from CFI, ORF and CIHR, our COMET-alpha team is assembling a world class centre in fast tracking the translation of genomic and proteomic targets into patients, through diagnostic biomarker development, and novel light or radioactive labelling to track movements in patients using PET-MR.

Project_Title: Advanced Aging ResearCH (ARCH) to Transform Health and Well-Being of Older Adults
Project_Description: The ARCH centre at Waterloo comprises comprehensive health sensors, wireless and assessment equipment supporting a distinct health/engineering sciences research hub. Research will drive early detection of chronic conditions and individualized treatment/prevention, leading to advanced technology development for healthy aging.

Project_Title: Multi-Hazard Test Facility for Built Infrastructure Protection and Resilience
Project_Description: The aim of the proposed unique world-class facility is to enhance the resilience of Canada's built infrastructure against the multi-hazard effects of earthquake, fire, cold region, climate change, blast, wind, and their combinations and reduce their cost by exploiting new breakthrough technologies in networked hybrid laboratory testing.

Project_Title: Coherent X-Ray Photonics: A Technology Unifying Materials, Imaging and Ultrafast Science
Project_Description: We will construct a laser source of coherent soft X-rays, enabling X-ray probing of materials with unrivaled time resolution and very high spatial resolution. This high power laser system, unique in the world, will bring advanced laser processing and characterization modalities, required for next generation materials, to the Manufacturing sector.

Project_Title: Deciphering Brain Network Disruptions in Neurological Disorders: A Pivotal Step in Therapeutic Intervention
Project_Description: The proposed project is to undertake cutting-edge neural network dynamics research on stroke, Parkinsonâ€™s disease, and depression, and create a competitive environment that will rival the most advanced international efforts, and will ultimately elucidate how/which therapies may have the best (or least) chances of success in the clinical settin

Project_Title: Probing Cellular Networks by Next-Generation Proteomics and Single-Cellgenomics
Project_Description: This proposal aims to establish a continuum of platforms that will enable us to carry out quantitative and analytical proteomics, cell biology and genomics of single cells. The overarching objective of this infrastructure request is to advance the understanding and treatment of human disease.

Project_Title: CERES: CEntre for Reconfigurable Electromagnetic Surfaces
Project_Description: The proposed laboratory facilities will be used for the research and development of novel types of thin and lightweight electromagnetic surfaces ranging from radio frequencies to optical frequencies.  They will serve applications in communications, sensors and security, and medical imaging and diagnostics.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Rapid Prototyping of Patient Specific Models, Dexterous Tools and Implants
Project_Description: This infrastructure project will create a unique hub of imaging and prototyping expertise spanning across southern Ontario with facilities to perform medical imaging processing and segmentation, realistic patient specific models and 3D printing technology for medical device and implants.

Project_Title: Centre for Developmental Brain Plasticity & Repair (CDBPR)
Project_Description: We will undertake ground-breaking research into developmental neuroplasticity using a range of advanced neuroimaging approaches that span from individual neuronal synapses to the entire brain.  These diverse approaches will lead to the discovery of new therapies for disorders such as autism, brain injury and cognitive dysfunction.

Project_Title: GRIFFIN Compton and Background Suppression Shields
Project_Description: The GRIFFIN Compton and Background Suppression Shields will establish a facility for decay spectroscopy research with rare isotope beams that will be unrivalled worldwide and will have a transformative impact on our understanding of the fundamental properties of atomic nuclei and the astrophysical origins of the heavy chemical elements.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Platform for Advanced Design Leading to Manufacturing in Micro-Nano Technologies
Project_Description: ADEPT provides Ontario researchers and their industrial partners with access to $20M in advanced design tools, enabling collaborative research and engineering in micro-nano technologies linked to manufacturing.  Benefits include highly skilled jobs, spinoff companies, and highly qualified innovators.

Project_Title: Queen's CardioPulmonary Unit (Q-CPU) â€“ Centre for Translational Research in Pulmonary Hypertensi
Project_Description: Pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH) is a devastating disease of the lungâ€™s blood vessels that causes shortness of breath on exertion and ultimately leads to fatal right ventricular failure. The Queenâ€™s CardioPulmonary Unit (Q-CPU) will be a leading research group in the development, preclinical testing and commercialization of new therap

Project_Title: Canadian Entangled Photon Source
Project_Description: This project aims at utilizing the unique quantum capabilities of photons to break new grounds in the field of material spectroscopy to benefit sustainable energy, the field of quantum imaging to enable new healthcare imaging modalities, the field of space communications to usher in a new era of fundamentally secure satellite information transfer
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Centre for Cancer Stem Cell Therapeutics
Project_Description: The Centre for Cancer Stem Cell Therapeutics at the University of Toronto Mississauga will bring together top researchers to develop new anti-cancer compounds for the benefit of Ontarians and Canadians. The chemistry, cell biology and computational infrastructure will allow researchers to target destruction of cancer stem cells.

Project_Title: DriverLab: Developing Advanced Driving Simulation Technologies to Support Safe Driving in Older and At-risk Drivers
Project_Description: DriverLab is a state-of-the-art, high-fidelity, driving simulator capable of introducing challenging conditions such as real rain and glare. It will be used to develop sensitive methods of driver assessment/training and provide careful evaluations of the safety of in-car technologies across different populations (eg, older and at-risk drivers).

Project_Title: Advanced Materials: From Designer Molecules to Transformative Devices
Project_Description: We propose to create a Centre for Advanced Materials Research (CAMR) that brings together scientists from the Faculties of Science, Engineering and Medicine. The proposed 16,700 sq. ft. of new space would be equipped for the invention, study and applications of materials with emphasis on optical and biomaterials.

Project_Title: Next generation genome editing and functional evaluation of pre-clinical models of human disease
Project_Description: Abnormal changes in genes, called mutations, cause disease. This project uses the latest technology, genome editing, to make mice with exactly the same mutations as patients. By studying mouse models with the kind of clinical tests used on humans, scientists can learn how mutations cause diseases and companies can develop better treatments.

Project_Title: Centre for Islet Research and Therapeutics (CIRT)
Project_Description: This project will create a Centre for Islet Research with the infrastructure needed to obtain a reliable source of high-quality human pancreatic cells (islets) and the ability with which to analyze them. The centre will serve to increase the research capacity of Ontario's diabetes researchers and accelerate development of new diabetes therapies.

Project_Title: Research Program for Rare Pediatric Diseases (RaPiD)
Project_Description: RaPiD is a collaborative research program uniting world-class clinicians and basic scientists to: 1) Identify the genomic causes of rare diseases (RDs) and develop efficient diagnoses of RD patients; 2) Explore RD pathogenic mechanisms in relevant cell and animal models; and, 3) Develop effective therapeutic avenues for RDs.
Lead_Research_Institution: Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario Research Institute Inc.

Project_Title: A Platform for CMOS-MEMS Integration and Characterization
Project_Description: This proposal will enable research, discovery and technology development in the area of â€œnano- and micro-technologiesâ€. The infrastructure will yield an open-source platform technology that integrates actuators, sensors and electronics on-a-chip.  Application areas include nanotechnology, communication, and chemical and physical sens

Project_Title: Enhanced Tellurium Purification and Double Beta Sensitivity for the SNO+ Experiment
Project_Description: By developing and installing advanced purification equipment for tellurium, water and an amine-based surfactant for the SNO+ detector in the underground lab near Sudbury, this project will enable SNO+ to achieve the world's best sensitivity to detect neutrinoless double beta decay -- a potential landmark discovery in particle and nuclear physics.

Project_Title: Measuring Low Frequency Genetic Markers for Cancer Management
Project_Description: This project includes the study of three priority areas:1. mosaic germline non-hereditary cancer predisposing mutations;2. circulating tumour DNA (ctDNA) and early cancer diagnosis; and3. gene expression profile (GEP) signature and personalized cancer treatment.

Project_Title: ALPHA-g: An Apparatus to Explore Antimatter Gravity With Cold Trapped Antihydrogen
Project_Description: ALPHA-g, a Canadian/Danish-led multinational collaborative experiment at CERN, will pursue the answer to the gravitational question â€œdoes antimatter fall up or down?â€, making the proposed apparatus the 21st Century version of Newtonâ€™s apple tree.  A

Project_Title: Interdisciplinary Research Laboratory and Remote Collaborations Unit in Global Health and Human Rights
Project_Description: This proposalâ€™s objective is to fund a research and training hub on global health and human rights at the Dalla Lana School of Public Health (DLSPH) at the University of Toronto. This hub will train future researchers and carry out the international research collaborations central to global health researc
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Intelligent Home Sensor Networks for the Elderly
Project_Description: This project will build a custom-designed, simulated, single-house-based research platform to develop and evaluate novel sensor technologies and systems, which will be used for continuous monitoring of physical activities and physiological parameters of elderly patients with chronic diseases.

Project_Title: Integrated Platform for High-Throughput Protein/Protein and Drug/Target Interaction Analysis
Project_Description: Dr. Taipaleâ€™s research uses cutting-edge functional genomics tools to characterize how the protein quality control machinery is organized in the cell. The generated knowledge is exploited to characterize how this network is disrupted in rare human diseases and to identify potential drugs for these disease

Project_Title: Advanced Characterization for Production and Applications of Functional Materials Based on Nanoscale Building Blocks
Project_Description: The objective is to support the expansion of the research program based on the established PIâ€™s expertise in the synthesis of novel well-defined size- and shape-controlled nanoscale building blocks (NBBs). The main outcomes are the development and implementation of NBB functional application

Project_Title: Ultra-High Performance Mass Spectrometry Facility for Studies in Analytical Toxicology and Molecular Genetics
Project_Description: The proposed infrastructure is an ultrahigh performance liquid chromatograph triple quadrupole mass spectrometer (UHPLC-TQMS) for extremely sensitive quantitative analysis of complex biological samples in analytical toxicology and molecular genetic studies.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Molecular Imaging of Lipids in Rodent Models Brain Co-Morbidities
Project_Description: The infrastructure requested in this proposal will lead to an innovative molecular imaging research facility that will enable the PI and collaborators to identify the role that membrane lipids play in conferring vulnerability to cell death of brain cells.

Project_Title: Four-Dimensional Structure Elucidation of Cancer-Associated Proteins in Action
Project_Description: This innovative program will establish state-of-the-art NMR and protein crystallization methodologies to study the conformational changes and dynamic motion of key proteins implicated in cancer development and progression leading to novel targets and strategies for therapeutic modulation.

Project_Title: Center for Integrative Laboratory and Field Physiology
Project_Description: The proposed infrastructure will establish a unique center in Ontario where the focus is on the effects of digestion on the physiology of native Ontarian fish as well as those species used in aquaculture from the perspectives of integrative, developmental, and field physiology.

Project_Title: Biomaterial Host Response Analysis and Engineering Laboratory
Project_Description: The proposed research will study biomaterial-induced inflammation to identify novel strategies for improving biological responses to implanted materials and developing inflammation-modulating materials. A rapid in vivo biomaterial-screening platform will also be developed in support of these goals.

Project_Title: Superconducting Magnet Platform for Magnetic Resonance Imaging Systems Development
Project_Description: We believe that through the design and development of smaller, customized MRI systems that can be installed within the emergency room for the diagnosis of stroke, we have the potential to save lives and to reduce the overall economic burden of managing stroke in Ontario.

Project_Title: Elucidating the Structure and Function of Zebrafish Sensorimotor Circuits Using Optogenetic and Behavioural Approaches
Project_Description: Dr. Thiele's research will uncover some of the fundamental principles by which neural circuits combine sensory information with motor output using a unique and multidisciplinary approach that combines the larval zebrafish model system with modern neuroscience technologies.

Project_Title: Structure and Oligomerizing Function of Calcium Signaling Proteins in Health and Disease
Project_Description: This research will link the atomic resolution structures and oligomerizing properties of stromal interaction molecule and mitochondrial uniporter calcium signaling proteins to cellular functions associated with health and disease, information required for the development of new therapeutic and diagnostic tools.

Project_Title: A Laboratory for Autonomous Driving
Project_Description: The end goal of this proposal is to provide the computational resources necessary to develop cost effective solutions to autonomous driving. This can lower the risk of accidents, provide mobility for the elderly and people with disabilities, and decrease the pollution, for a healthier environment.
Keyword: Artificial Intelligence

Project_Title: Non-Invasive Stimulation of the Human Visual Cortex
Project_Description: Non-invasive brain stimulation (NIBS) is an emerging technology that has enormous potential as a tool for rehabilitating the brain. This proposal aims to understand the effects of NIBS on visual brain areas and to use NIBS to treat brain-based visual disorders such as amblyopia.

Project_Title: CryoLab for Arctic, Antarctic and Planetary Studies
Project_Description: Cryolab for Arctic, Antarctic and Planetary Studies will provide the infrastructure necessary for innovative studies on the impacts of climate change and disturbances on permafrost in northern Canada and Antarctica and prepare for future missions to Mars.

Project_Title: Advanced Characterization of Biomaterials
Project_Description: The improvement of orthopaedic and dental implant technologies is one of the central concerns of our aging society. This infrastructure will enable researchers to uncover the nanoscale mechanisms that govern how bone bonds to implant devices and enable improved design of implant materials.

Project_Title: Bats as Models for the Study of Multisensory Integration
Project_Description: The Multisensory Integration Laboratory (MIL) will improve our understanding of visual and auditory information integration in vertebrates, including humans. The labâ€™s primary foci will be visual capture and cross-modal recognition, using an interdisciplinary, multi-level approach. MIL will be unique to Canad
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Computer-Intensive High-Dimensional Models for Option Pricing and Risk-Management
Project_Description: This research program develops innovative modelling methods and fast pricing formulas for financial assets. It provides the tools needed to speed financial innovation, improve market liquidity, and allow financial markets to bear risk more efficiently decreasing the likelihood of future market crashes.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Infrastructure for the Purification and Chemical Biological Investigation of Antibacterial and Antifungal Compounds
Project_Description: The research supported by this infrastructure will lead to new therapeutics for treating antibiotic resistant pathogens. It will also provide unique training opportunities for students and postdoctoral fellows interested in careers in the private sector or academia.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: A Laboratory for the Discovery of Energy-Purpose Functional Metallopolymers
Project_Description: This ORF investment will allow for the acquisition of essential infrastructure for the synthesis and characterization of energy-purpose functional metallopolymers. The metallopolymers will be used to produce next-generation lithium-ion batteries and inverted bulk-heterojunction solar cells.

Project_Title: Quantitative MR Imaging Laboratory for Cell and Tissue Engineering
Project_Description: Our research program strives to bring engineered tissue and organs as a treatment option to Ontarians, through the development of new magnetic resonance imaging technology to accelerate tissue engineering research and to eventually enable non-invasive monitoring in patients.

Project_Title: Pharmaceutical Therapies for Alzheimer's Disease
Project_Description: This proposal aims to acquire a state-of-the-art nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) system that will be used to understand the mechanisms of Alzheimerâ€™s disease (AD) by designing novel therapeutic agents which will provide health, social and economic benefits to Ontarian

Project_Title: Profiling the Metabolic and Immune Exosomal Secretome
Project_Description: The proposed research strives to uncover novel cellular mechanisms and unique aspects of cardiovascular and metabolic diseases by profiling small secreted molecules called exosomes. This research will lead to biomarker discovery and innovative therapies for heart disease and type 2 diabetes.

Project_Title: Reservoir Monitoring Using Time-Lapse Superconducting Gravimetry
Project_Description: Monitoring oil, gas, and water reservoirs and their dynamics is important for Canadaâ€™s economy and environmental sustainability. Superconducting gravimeters enable an innovative approach to monitoring fluid migration in reservoirs by sensing mass change during injection/extraction process
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Establish a Human Cardiovascular Physiology Laboratory
Project_Description: Dr. Millarâ€™s research program will study, in healthy and diseased humans, 1) neural regulation and control of the circulation and 2) novel interventions designed to improve cardiovascular regulation. These findings will be ready for rapid translation to assist with the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular diseas

Project_Title: Womenâ€™s Cardiovascular Health: Sexually Dimorphic Cardiovascular and Autonomic Responses to Stresso
Project_Description: This application is for funds to develop a Women's Cardiovascular Health Lab at York University, Toronto, Ontario. The proposed infrastructure will facilitate improvements in the standard of care and quality of life of women in Ontario and around the world that are suffering from cardiovascular disease.

Project_Title: Exploring the Neurocognitive Bases of Social Behaviour
Project_Description: This research will produce a deeper understanding of the neurocognitive bases of social mimicry, determine whether digital media that recruits the human mirror system promotes superior engagement and memory for information, and assess the effects of power on social perception and behaviour.

Project_Title: Molecular Analysis of Cell Migration Control by Physical Microenvironment and Its Role in a Disease State
Project_Description: This project seeks to reveal the molecular mechanisms utilized by mammalian cells to sense physical properties of their microenvironment and to guide cell migration towards areas of stiffer extracellular matrix. This type of cell migration is known to contribute to cancer metastasis.

Project_Title: Discovery and Investigation into Novel, Emerging and Re-emerging Viral Pathogens in Birds
Project_Description: Wild birds can transmit numerous high-impact viruses, including avian influenza and West Nile viruses. This research will explore the use of digital droplet PCR technology to perform surveillance on novel or emerging virus pathogens in birds, and conduct pathogenesis studies to better understand the ecology of these diseases.

Project_Title: A Novel Role for Histone Variant H2A.Z in Learning and Memory
Project_Description: This project will identify the mechanism by which a novel histone protein regulates memory. We will build on our prior evidence of memory-enhancing effects of histone H2A.Z depletion to identify new regulators of H2A.Z function and explore its contribution to promoting age-related cognitive decline.

Project_Title: Extracellular Vesicles in Vascular and Renal Health and Disease
Project_Description: Extracellular vesicles are important biological markers of damage that also cause injury in cardiovascular and kidney disease. Proposed research will increase knowledge of extracellular vesicles in kidney/cardiovascular disease leading to better detection and development of novel therapies.

Project_Title: Distributed Digital Performance Laboratory
Project_Description: The Distributed Digital Performance Laboratory (D2PL) is dedicated to the application of intelligent digital media to new forms of cultural expression, and to gaining new insights into how we sense, process and interact with the performing arts in the digital age.

Project_Title: New Tools for Applied Wheat Genetics and Breeding
Project_Description: The University of Guelph Wheat Breeding Program will attempt to improve the genetics of wheat for improved yield, disease resistance, adaptation to climate changes and end-use quality, through a better understanding of the genetics of important traits and by developing novel breeding strategies and tools.

Project_Title: Participatory Media Lab
Project_Description: Through fieldwork, computational data, and spatial analysis, this project will offer an in-depth understanding of the relationship between social movements, urban space and digital media. The project will also develop new research tools to clean/parse, analyze and visualize the interactions between social media data and contemporary protest movements around the world.

Project_Title: Design and Synthesis of Novel Organic Conductors
Project_Description: The proposed research seeks to discover and develop novel conductive organic materials with unique electronic, optical, and magnetic properties. New materials with optimal properties can be used in next-generation organic electronic devices as well as biomedical imaging/therapeutic applications.

Project_Title: Development of Improved Ion Channel Drugs and Engineering Ion Channels as Biosensors
Project_Description: Fifteen percent of all drugs target a class of medically relevant proteins called ion channels. Dr. daCosta aims to develop new and improved ion channel pharmaceuticals, and to engineer ion channels for novel diagnostic and therapeutic applications.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Integrative Responses of Fish to Environmental Stressors
Project_Description: Global climate change and increased aquatic contamination have led to environmental stressors that impact fish populations in Ontario and Canada. This research will examine the effects of mixed environmental stressors on fish species by assessing epigenetic, cellular and phenotypic changes.

Project_Title: Dynamic Memory Systems in the Human Brain
Project_Description: The requested funding will be used to establish a cognitive neuroscience lab that uses the converging techniques of brain imaging (fMRI), pharmacological manipulations, and behavioural modeling to understand how changing chemical states in the human brain relate to memory behaviours and disease.

Project_Title: Biophysical and Structural Platform to Advance the Study of B cell Glycoproteins in Vaccine and Disease
Project_Description: The proposed innovative technology and corresponding infrastructure will enable scientists to determine the atomic structure and function of critical molecules on the surface of immune cells, leading to better vaccines and therapeutics.

Project_Title: Understanding Climate Shifts, Foodways, and Societal Resilience through Ancient Plant Residues
Project_Description: This project will use innovative techniques to investigate transformations in past environments, human causes of these shifts, and societal responses to ecological change. Changes in human-environmental relationships will be mapped through patterns of plant residues extracted from sediments and artifacts.

Project_Title: Laboratory for Generative Responsive Realities
Project_Description: The laboratory for Generative Responsive Realities will develop transferable knowledge, technology, creative practice and training in the creation of responsive artificial worlds experienced through rapidly emerging mixed reality technologies, including both Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR).

Project_Title: Laboratory of Ecology and Macroevolution
Project_Description: With the requested infrastructure, I will establish a world-leading research program that links ecology and macroevolution to explain the origins of biodiversity and the factors that shape it in a changing world. My research on Anolis lizards will both advance basic knowledge and inform invasive species management policy.

Project_Title: Scanning Electron Microscope for Life Science Imaging
Project_Description: The principal applicants request a scanning electron microscope and accessory equipment to investigate the architecture of pathogenic bacterial biofilms. Their research programs are targeted at identifying the mechanisms of antibiotic resistance and to develop novel antimicrobial therapies.

Project_Title: A New Bioinformatics Laboratory to Integrate Functional Genomics, Biocuration, and Analytics in Biomedical Research
Project_Description: This is a proposal to establish a new Bioinformatics Laboratory to support an innovative computational research and training program focused on antibiotic resistance in bacterial pathogens, environmental toxicity of industrial and biomedical compounds, and integration of clinical and genomic data.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for 5G Wireless Cellular Networks and Internet of Things
Project_Description: This proposal will investigate new and innovative techniques to enhance spectral efficiency, reliability, range and security of wireless networks. These could be applied in areas such as Backhaul Connectivity for Small Cells, Cloud Radio Access Networks, and the Internet of Things (IoT).

Project_Title: A Human/Mouse Translational Drug Development Program for Major Depression
