Project_Description: By investigating cellular and molecular pathologies and the interaction between age and risk for neuropsychiatric disorders, the proposed research program aims to acquire an in-depth understanding of the molecular bases of depression, and develop therapeutic approaches for depression.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development
Lead_Research_Institution: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health

Project_Title: Platform for Antibiotic Discovery
Project_Description: Antibiotic resistance is the health care challenge that threatens to roll back over a Century of advances in medicine. This research strives to overcome the resistance crisis by exploring the mechanisms of drug resistance and discovering new molecules and strategies that can inform new drug development.

Project_Title: In Vitro Technologies for Plant Propagation and Conservation
Project_Description: Plant tissue culture has revolutionized our ability to propagate plants, conserve endangered species, and improve crops. However, many species remain recalcitrant to these techniques. This project will provide help better understand and overcome this problem in a wider range of plant species.

Project_Title: Development of Antiviral Therapies for Emerging Viruses
Project_Description: The objective of the proposed project is the discovery of cellular host factors essential for viral infection and their use for the development of novel antiviral therapies. To that aim, state-of-the-art platforms will be established to monitor viral infection and develop small molecule inhibitors of infection.

Project_Title: Smart Polymers for Organic Electronics
Project_Description: The focus of the project is to explore the use of smart polymers in the design and fabrication of novel flexible printable electronic sensors. These next generation sensors would represent a significant contribution to industrial economic growth, healthcare, environmental surveying and personal safety.

Project_Title: New Tools for Behaviour and Health Monitoring of Dairy Cattle
Project_Description: Research infrastructure, including automated technologies for behavioural assessment and health monitoring, is required to establish a research program that will provide novel biological insights into factors affecting the expression of feeding behaviour in dairy cattle.

Project_Title: Nipissing University Branch Research Data Centre
Project_Description: The proposed infrastructure will establish a Statistics Canada Branch Research Data Centre at Nipissing University to support the Tier II Canada Research Chair (CRC) appointment of Dr. David Zarifa. This Data Centre will provide Dr. Zarifa and his team secured access to Statistics Canada micro data files.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Developing Biomaterials to Manipulate and Study Cell-Matrix Interactions
Project_Description: This research will develop materials to mimic and control the natural chemical environment surrounding cells. This will make it possible to accurately probe cell-material interactions which, ultimately, will lead to the development of material based therapeutics for cancer and stem cell therapies.

Project_Title: Self-Knowledge and Interpersonal Perception
Project_Description: The main objectives are to identify blind spots and bright spots in self-knowledge and interpersonal perception, identify consequences of self-knowledge and interpersonal accuracy, and identify methods that can improve self-knowledge and interpersonal accuracy. This line of inquiry has the potential to improve decision-making, relationships, and well-being.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: STEAM 3D Lab: Discover, Design, Develop
Project_Description: STEAM-3D: Discover, Design, Develop investigates uses of digital media and interactive tools in education. The program's objectives are to develop, observe and evaluate constructionist pedagogies in the context of a maker-space and to build capacity for affecting change in various education settings.
Lead_Research_Institution: University of Ontario Institute of Technology

Project_Title: Bioinformatics for Regulatory Sequences and Systems
Project_Description: We aim to develop (and apply) techniques from statistics and computer science to understand how molecules create the complex behaviours of the cell.  This will help predict which mutations will lead to cellular malfunctions and disease, and understand how complex organisms can appear during evolution.

Project_Title: Chronic Disease Prevention
Project_Description: The goal of this research program is to inform chronic disease prevention strategies; an evidence informed approach that emphasizes population impact, health care sustainability and equity. This research will create methodological innovations that can be applied to novel population data.

Project_Title: Flow Visualization Platform for Physical Modeling of Fluid Flows in Steelmaking and Casting
Project_Description: This research project will focus on the development of a state-of-the-art flow visualization platform for physical modeling of fluid flows, to design, optimize, enhance, and debottleneck  steelmaking and casting processes, and develop new and innovative technologies, in the field of ferrous metallurgy.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: The Origins of Life Laboratory
Project_Description: The Origins of Life Laboratory will develop and test hypotheses of how first life on Earth emerged and under what conditions Earth-like life on early Mars or habitable, Earth-mass exoplanets could arise.

Project_Title: Advanced Storage Systems and Electric Transportation (ASSET) Lab
Project_Description: The Advanced Storage Systems and Electric Transportation (ASSET) Lab will test and validate leadingedge electric energy storage systems equipment for electric vehicles (EVs), thus accelerating the commercialization and wide-spread adoption of electric transportation in Canada and abroad.
Lead_Research_Institution: University of Ontario Institute of Technology

Project_Title: Ecological Genomics of Plant Adaptation in Novel Environments
Project_Description: The proposed research combines field experiments with â€˜next-generationâ€™ sequencing to examine the ecological and genetic basis of invasion success in novel and changing environments in two of Ontarioâ€™s more notorious weeds: purple loosestrife (Lythrum salicaria) and garlic mustard (Alliaria petio
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Neural Basis of Reaching, Grasping and Object Manipulation
Project_Description: Using a host of neurophysiological, robotic and computational tools, the proposed research aims to explain how the brain and body interact to make reaching and grasping seem so easy, how trauma and disease modify these interactions to impair movement and how best to fix them to optimize recovery.

Project_Title: Data-Intensive Approaches to Digital Curation and Preservation
Project_Description: Digital curation, the active management and preservation of digital resources for future use, is an indispensable element of data-intensive research and sustainable society. This project will develop novel, data-intensive approaches and effective, scalable methods for digital curation and preservation.

Project_Title: Data, Equity and Policy in Education Lab
Project_Description: Data for educational policy-making are currently greatly under-utilized and highly fragmented in Canada. The Data, Equity, and Policy in Education Lab will amass a range of data on a comprehensive set of educational topics and will facilitate knowledge exchange among a variety of educational stakeholders.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Quantitative Tissue Imaging for Physiological and Genetic Analysis
Project_Description: We propose to establish a facility for imaging biological samples, and measuring the detailed differences between them. This facility will enable researchers to construct digital tissue archives suitable for image-based studies in many emerging areas of both the biomedical and environmental sciences.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Developing Novel Cell Therapies and Manufacturing Methods
Project_Description: The goal of this research project is the development of a novel treatment for cancer based on white blood cells.  The outcomes of this project will benefit Ontario through the creation of improved cancer treatments and by enabling economic growth in the Life Sciences and Advanced Manufacturing sectors.

Project_Title: C. elegans as a Model to Study Environment-Genotype Interactions
Project_Description: Two fundamental determinants of human health are genetics and environment. The proposed research seeks to understand how environment, specifically diet and microbiota, influence health, development, and disease susceptibility and progression, using C. elegans as a model system.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Linking Lake Nipissing and its Watershed: High Frequency Monitoring of Hydrology and Nutrient Fluxes
Project_Description: The Lake Nipissing Bays project will use CFI â€“MRI funds to conduct high frequency monitoring of river inflow, water quality and weather conditions to improve understanding of potential sources of phosphorus from upstream watersheds and within-bay sources, and the influence of weather on water conditions in Lake Nipissin

Project_Title: Arts Research Collaboratory
Project_Description: This research into collaborative digital research tools and interfaces innovates in the text technologies that are shaping the production and dissemination of information about textual and cultural artifacts in a digital environment, engages citizen scholars, and enriches the global web with scholarly knowledge.

Project_Title: Advanced Core Logging Laboratory
Project_Description: An advanced portable laboratory will be developed for geotechnical core logging in mining. The novel technology will enable faster and more accurate field data collection and elimination of conventional errors. This will help more efficient planning and design and better management of mining risks.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Targeting the Translatome in Disease
Project_Description: Drs. Alain and Raynerâ€™s research aims to determine the underpinnings of gene regulation by microRNAs and translation control in cancer and cardiovascular disease. Their studies will lead to innovative therapeutics to counter the significant human and economic impact of these diseases in Ontari

Project_Title: Activatable Contrast Agents and Advanced Materials For Molecular Imaging
Project_Description: Personalized medicine through molecular imaging is difficult to implement, but may be achieved with novel tracers for molecular magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). A small animal MRI instrument that can operate at both clinical magnetic field strengths is requested, which would accelerate tracer development and clinical translation.

Project_Title: Nipissingâ€™s Mobile Digitization and Repatriation Lab: A Facility for Global Environmental Histories and Geographi
Project_Description: Nipissingâ€™s Mobile Digitization and Repatriation Lab, will support the Canada Research Chair in Global Environmental Histories and Geographies. Using archival materials and natural history collections Nipissingâ€™s Global Semi-Periphery Institute will provide a humanities-based approach to understanding environmental change over time of semi-peripher
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Data and Laboratory Development to Study Migration and Industrial Change
Project_Description: Ontario has recently ceded its position as Canadaâ€™s economic powerhouse, due largely to declines in its manufacturing sector. My research program will develop and use new big administrative data sources to identify the migratory implications of this profound demographic and economic chang
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Hybrid PVD Coating System
Project_Description: Ontarioâ€™s manufacturing sector relies on advanced technologies to remain globally competitive. Innovative tool designs, materials and coatings can directly enhance productivity, quality and cost competitiveness. Investigations into novel materials are needed to fully attain this potentia
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Practice Changing Research: Improving Diagnosis and Management for Cutaneous T-Cell Lymphomas (CTCL)
Project_Description: Dr. Litvinovâ€™s research program will develop innovative approaches to study and treat Cutaneous T-Cell Lymphomas, the most common lymphoma of the skin. The proposed research aims to develop effective diagnostic/prognostic tests and immunotherapeutic approaches for the treatment of this malignanc

Project_Title: Cryo-electron Microscope for Structural Analysis of Cellular Complexes
Project_Description: This research aims to have an impact on our ability to treat infectious diseases and cancer by elucidating new mechanisms to overcome antibiotic resistance and to develop effective therapies for cancer. Treatment to paliate these diseases costs over $12 billion annually to Ontario.

Project_Title: The Role of Oxygen in Autophagy Regulation and Metabolic Homeostasis
Project_Description: The proposed research seeks to discover novel oxygen-dependent cell signalling that links nutrient/stress sensing to the regulation of the autophagy pathway.  Additionally, the dysregulation of autophagy in disease will be studied under tissue specific physiological oxygen levels.

Project_Title: Platelet Biology to Improve Patient Outcomes â€“ from Bedside to Bench and Ba
Project_Description: The proposed research aims to better understand how blood cells interact with vessel walls to cause heart attacks and strokes. Secondarily the goal is to identify strategies to improve patientâ€™s response to therapy and will lead to optimization of medical treatment for these condition

Project_Title: Environmental Processes and Change in Northern Canadian Ecosystems
Project_Description: The objective of the proposed research program is to understand how northern ecosystems in Ontario and Canada are impacted by environmental change, including long-term climate change, exposure to contaminants, and changes to freshwater ecosystems such as productivity, and snow and ice cover.

Project_Title: High-throughput Sampling of the â€˜Fire of lifeâ€™ in Diverse Organisms, Substrates and Condit
Project_Description: This proposal will develop an assemblage of respirometry equipment to yield the most flexible and productive metabolic sampling ability currently existing, substantially impacting our ability to study how metabolic rate evolves, and prepare students for jobs in biology, health and veterinary sciences.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Laboratory for the Development of Bioresponsive and Interactive Ophthalmic Biomaterials
Project_Description: To develop better treatments for ocular diseases, Dr. Wells will develop bioresponsive polymer biomaterials to deliver drugs and photoswitchable surface treatments to modulate host interactions.  These technologies will personalize biomaterials and improve their integration and function.

Project_Title: Neuroimmune Interactions in Pain
Project_Description: My research team will use an integrated approach spanning genomic, proteomic, molecular, cellular and behavioural neurobiology to dissect the role of the immune response in pain. Using the post-surgical wound and spinal cord injury models, we will identify novel immune targets that control the initiation, development and/or maintenance of inflammatory and neuropathic pain. Understanding the interactions between the nervous and immune systems will be critical to the development of new and efficacious treatments for acute and chronic pain disorders.

Project_Title: Shallow-Water Earth Observation Lab
Project_Description: The proposed research will develop methods to map the depth of shallow waters using satellite data. Algorithms will be developed for optical and radar data. Canadian industry collaborators will commercialize findings. Canadian government and military will benefit from coastal bathymetry data.

Project_Title: High-Speed Skeletal Imaging Laboratory
Project_Description: The objective of this proposal is to establish a High-Speed Skeletal Imaging Research Laboratory in an ambulatory patient care centre. The laboratory will have the capability to precisely measure the motion of musculoskeletal joints during high-demand activities of daily living. These measurements are crucial for Dr. Rainbowâ€™s research program focused on determining mechanical factors associated with the onset and progression of musculoskeletal disease

Project_Title: Learning in the Developing Mind and Brain
Project_Description: The requested funding will be used to establish a new laboratory that uses cutting edge neuroimaging methods and analyses to discover how neural structure and function change across the early life span and how this influences memory function and real world learning outcomes for language and education.

Project_Title: Translating New Models of Cardiac Disease into Therapy
Project_Description: Heart failure is responsible for over one-third of deaths in Canada. We have created tools to personalize heart medication treatment, finding the correct drug for the right patient. Our methods can be used to discover novel heart failure therapies, reducing health care costs and socioeconomic burden.

Project_Title: MRS Spectroscopy for Addiction and Psychiatry
Project_Description: MRS can identify differences in basic brain biochemistry in people with and without disorders, and can rule out conditions such as Alzheimer's disease. However, brain dysfunction in mental disorders almost always involves changes in brain chemical processes that are best determined using advanced MRS methods. The requested infrastructure will take full advantage of recently installed advanced MRS equipment and develop new technologies, hardware and software to uncover abnormalities in neuronal and glia processes at the molecular level in addictions and psychiatric disorders.
Lead_Research_Institution: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health

Project_Title: Conversion Facility for Value-Added Products from Boreal Forest
Project_Description: This proposal aims at developing novel transformative, cost-effective and environmentally-sound technologies and products from renewable resources that can replace imported fossil-based fuels and petrochemicals and create new opportunities for the emerging Bioeconomy.

Project_Title: Real-time Navigated iKnife System for Breast Cancer Surgery
Project_Description: Surgical intervention in breast cancer is common, but a key challenge that undermines this intervention is the inability for the surgeon to remove the entire tumour, which results in repeated surgeries and increased burden to patients and the healthcare system.  In this application, we are combining two technologies that will effectively map the position of the surgical tool relative to the tumour with real-time molecular information generating by mass spectrometry to accurately define the resection margin with minimal disruption to healthy tissue.  This surgical platform will significantly reduce the need for repeat breast cancer surgeries, as well as additional systemic cancer therapies.

Project_Title: Colibri: an Ultra-Fast Telescope Array for Astronomy and Space Science
Project_Description: The project will meld emerging ultra-fast low-light imaging technology with commercial astronomical telescopes.  The resulting sensitive rapid-imaging telescope array will have unprecedented capabilities.  Applications include solar system science, extrasolar planets, and space science.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Workplace Simulation Equipment for Improving Occupational Health and Safety Outcomes in the Mining Industry
Project_Description: This project will integrate a robotic platform (vibration and motion), eye-tracking system and an environmental chamber (temperature; humidity) into the existing CROSH lab. CROSH will become the first lab in Canada with the infrastructure to simulate workplace environment conditions associated with underground mining and equipment operation.

Project_Title: Evidence-based Decision Making Centre
Project_Description: Supported by the proposed Evidence-based Decision Making Centre, this research program will combine traditional and innovative neurophysiological techniques to understand and enhance individual/ group managerial decision-making promising significant productivity gains for Ontario organizations.

Project_Title: Applying Biomarkers of Present Moment Awareness to Promote Mental Health
Project_Description: Depression is the leading cause of disability in Ontario, Canada, and around the world. The goal of the proposed research is to develop new techniques of assessing a person's current state of depression vulnerability. If successful, the project could revolutionize the use of preventative medicine in combatting depression.

Project_Title: Nutrient-Neural Signaling in the Colon: A Role in IBS
Project_Description: Meal induced symptoms in patients with irritable bowel syndrome has been well recognized for many years but the mechanisms producing these symptoms are unknown.  This proposal will examine the mechanisms of how specific nutrients in the gastrointestinal tract can produce symptoms of abdominal discomfort and altered motility (e.g. diarrhea) in irritable bowel syndrome.

Project_Title: Systems biology infrastructure to explore protein misfolding and cellular protein quality control in human diseases
Project_Description: Our research using the model organism yeast with its unparalleled capacity to explore genetic and cellular networks seeks to decipher the role of protein misfolding, cellular protein quality control, and aging in neurodegenerative diseases at a systems biology level.

Project_Title: Understanding and Harnessing Human Memory Retrieval
Project_Description: This project aims to better understand how memory retrieval can weaken our retrieved memories, to investigate how memory retrieval differs across people, and how these effects can be harnessed to enhance practices in mental health, education, interrogation and human resources.

Project_Title: Facility for In Situ Characterization of Next-generation Electrochemical Devices
Project_Description: Work with the requested In Situ Characterization System will lead to improved energy storage technologies by enabling a critical assessment of novel materials and approaches to improve their energy density and stability for use in current and future clean energy technologies.

Project_Title: Exploring Neuroprotective Mechanisms Against Low Oxygen Stress in Hypoxia-tolerant Vertebrate Brain
Project_Description: Our goal is to understand how hypoxia-tolerant brain maintains energetic homeostasis during low O2 stress. This will provide key insights into: (1) natural neuroprotective mechanisms against hypoxia, (2) the evolution of hypoxia-tolerance at the cellular level, and (3) treatments against hypoxic stress in brain.

Project_Title: Dissecting Oncogenic Networks by Functional Genomics Using Multiplexed Genome Editing in Vivo
Project_Description: Dr. Schramek has developed cutting-edge in vivo screening methodologies that integrate human cancer genomics and mouse modeling to enable (1) simultaneous screening of hundreds of putative cancer genes, (2) rapid characterization of cancer driver mutations and (3) screening for specific cancer vulnerabilities.

Project_Title: HIV-1 pathogenesis and viral control
Project_Description: Dr. Arts will establish one of the most advanced molecular virology laboratories in the world to study HIV-1 pathogenesis, treatment, and vaccine development.  His research program has defined the HIV-1 attributes related to transmission between humans and the rate of disease progression.

Project_Title: High Throughput Genetic Sreening Technology for the Identification of Novel Targets for Treating Human Disease
Project_Description: Dr. Screatonâ€™s research will utilize new cutting edge approaches to understand at the cellular level the mechanisms that lead to both Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes.  His research will also allow the identification of specific molecules and genes to target novel therapies for treating Type 1 and 2 diabete

Project_Title: Mechanisms Regulating GPCRs in Disease
Project_Description: Dr. Fergusonâ€™s research program will develop novel avenues of drug treatment for hypertension, Alzheimerâ€™s disease, Huntingtonâ€™s disease, stress, anxiety and depression by repurposing drugs that are in current clinical trials for other disorders and creating unique platforms for novel drug disc

Project_Title: Molecular Mechanisms Underlying Learning and Memory in Health and Disease
Project_Description: We propose to develop and adapt novel tools (light, electrical signals, and molecules) for the purpose of understanding biological processes in brain health and disease.  We aim to find new treatments for debilitating medical disorders.  The work and discoveries will have significant socio-economic impacts.

Project_Title: Molecular Mechanisms Driving Osteoarthritis
Project_Description: Osteoarthritis affects more than 3 million people in Canada and causes annual costs of almost $30 billion, with proportional numbers for Ontario. The objective of this proposal is to identify underlying molecular and cellular mechanisms, with the long-term goal to develop novel therapies for this disease.

Project_Title: Center for Advanced Dynamic Imaging of Tissue Barriers: Cellular Processes and Molecular Interactions.

Applications in the areas of nanoelectronics, storage of clean energy, and quantum information are outcomes of the research.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Simulating Digestion for Food Nanotechnology Assessment
Project_Description: Developing food nanotechnologies presents tremendous opportunities, as well as risks, to alter the â€˜healthinessâ€™ of processed foods. In developing these technologies, we are in dire need of state-of-theart technologies to assess their behaviour in model gastrointestinal tra
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Spatially-resolved Biochemistry
Project_Description: This proposal seeks funding to establish the Centre for Single Cell Analysis at University of Toronto, Scarborough, to resolve, in both time and space, the mechanisms of immune cell activation in individual cells through the application of cutting-edge microscopy techniques.

Project_Title: Precision Physics with Atoms and Molecules
Project_Description: The research program will use atoms and molecules as the building blocks of precision technologies. The objectives are to develop portable high-performance clocks using atoms cooled by lasers, and to develop molecular devices for controlling the quantum properties of light at terahertz frequencies.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Coupled Human and Natural Systems Laboratory (CHANS-lab)
Project_Description: This research will help us to better understand and predict how public sentiment regarding vaccines and climate change spreads through social networks. This will be accomplished by developing a computational laboratory and digital database to analyze data from Twitter and other â€œBig Dataâ€ sour

Project_Title:
Establishment of a Sensory Neuroplasticity Platform at the Faculty of Pharmacy of the
University of Toronto
Project_Description: Intractable pain is the single most common cause of disability world-wide. This project will use advanced experimental approaches to reveal how cellular changes in the spinal cord contribute to pathological pain, and to identify cellular processes that reverse pathological pain or counter its development.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Neural Mechanisms Underlying Cognitive Transformations for Human Goal-Directed Action
Project_Description: Using an integrated, multi-disciplinary neuroscience approach the main objective of this proposal is to develop a better understanding of the perceptual, cognitive and motor-related brain mechanisms in humans that support the selection, planning and control of goal-directed behaviour.

Project_Title: The Sport & Physical Activity Research Collaborative (SPARC) Facility at UOIT
Project_Description: Over 90% of Canadians are physically inactive; and yet many athletes aim for excellence in high performance sport. Drs. Wattie and Lloyd address these challenges at the UOIT Sport & Physical Activity Research Collaborative (SPARC), studying and designing ways to increase physical activity and sport performance.
Lead_Research_Institution: University of Ontario Institute of Technology

Project_Title: Infrastructure for WaterlooBCI Laboratory
Project_Description: This project will establish the WaterlooBCI laboratory, the objective of which is to develop non-invasive brain computer interfaces (BCI) to help the rehabilitation process for stroke patients, as well as those with spinal cord injury, Parkinsonâ€™s disease, and other motor function disabilitie

Project_Title: Reservoir Monitoring Using Superconducting Gravimetry
Project_Description: Monitoring oil, gas, and water reservoirs and their dynamics is important for Canadaâ€™s economy and environmental sustainability. Superconducting gravimeters enable an innovative approach to monitoring fluid migration in reservoirs by sensing mass change during injection/extraction processe

Project_Title: Remuscularization of Injured Hearts Using Stem Cells
Project_Description: Dr. Laflamme's innovative research is aimed at developing methods to generate functional heart tissue from stem cells. He plans to utilize these tissues to develop a safe and efficacious stem cell-based therapy for heart failure.

Project_Title: Facility for Womenâ€™s Reproductive Health Resear
Project_Description: Epithelial ovarian cancer (EOC) is the most deadly womenâ€™s cancer, and preeclampsia (PE) is a serious pregnancy complication. This project aims to investigate the molecular mechanisms contributing to the development of EOC and PE, and to develop diagnostic and therapeutic tools for these disease

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Support the Nipissing University Social Neuroendocrinology Laboratory
Project_Description: By combining theory and methodology from social, experimental, and personality psychology, endocrinology, and pharmacology, the proposed research will examine the psychological, hormonal, and situational factors that give rise to individual differences in human aggressive behaviour.

Project_Title: Fast Two-Photon Resonance Microscope System for Advanced in vivo Imaging of Brain Plasticity in Awake and Behaving Mice
Project_Description: This research will uncover how the dynamics of neural network activity evolve during motor learning, which will inform the development of therapeutic strategies for counteracting neural circuit dysfunctions in stroke, neurodegenerative disease, and traumatic brain injury.

Project_Title: Rehabilitation Aimed at Muscle Performance (RAMP)
Project_Description: The Rehabilitation Aimed at Muscle Performance research lab, led by Dr. Reid, aims to determine the causes of muscle dysfunction resulting from disease, hospitalization and inactivity with the ultimate goal of preventing weakness, improving strength and maintaining independent living in Ontarians.

Project_Title: Germanium Detectors to Understand Neutrinos and Dark Matter
Project_Description: This project supports Ontarioâ€™s continued international leadership in the quest to understand the nature of matter. Germanium-based technologies will be developed for next generation experiments to search for dark matter and to understand neutrinos in deep underground laboratories such as SNOLA

Project_Title: Computational Infrastructure for Simulating Lake, Atmosphere and Ocean Dynamics
Project_Description: Our research will develop mathematical and computational techniques for modelling motions in naturally occurring fluids such as the Great Lakes, the coastal oceans and the overlying atmosphere with implications for science-based management practices (e.g. water quality) and climate change adaptation.

Project_Title: Nanotopography Platform for Stem Cell
Project_Description: Stem cells are crucial to cell therapy, regenerative medicine and disease modeling; however, the growth of undifferentiated stem cells is challenging and expensive.  This project will develop a nano-structured stem cell culture system, providing a cost-efficient and reliable cell culture platform.

Project_Title: Investigating Neuromuscular Control Strategies Using Haptic Robotics
Project_Description: To complete activities of daily living we coordinate limb movements through the neural control of muscles in the upper extremity. This work integrates biomechanics and neurophysiology with haptic robotics to investigate how muscle recruitment and control strategies influence workplace injury risk.

Project_Title: Disentangling the Climatic Mechanisms that Structure Speciesâ€™ Distributions and Interactio
Project_Description: This research program will aim to advance our understanding of how climate structures speciesâ€™ distributions and how species interactions influence how species respond to climate change. This research will improve our knowledge about the overall responses of species to climate chang

Project_Title: Discovery and Synthesis of Nanomaterials for Ubiquitous Electronics
Project_Description: Dr. Musselmanâ€™s research program will develop a new type of thin film deposition system that can rapidly discover new nanoscale materials to accelerate product development cycles. Discovered materials will be used to improve next-generation ubiquitous electronic devices and functional coating

Project_Title: New Discoveries through Activity-Based Protein Profiling
Project_Description: We will develop new biotechnologies to detect and study human pathogens. These tools will be used to identify enzymatic activity in complex proteomes for biomarker and therapeutic discovery, to metabolically label pathogens for manipulation and to track, image and probe host-pathogen interactions.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Proteomics Laboratory to Investigate Alternative Splicing Regulation in Stem Cell Differentiation
Project_Description: The proposed research aims to elucidate the molecular mechanisms of stem cell differentiation using proteomics. It will bring crucial knowledge necessary for development of stem cell therapy, which is promising to treat various human diseases including cardiovascular and neurodegenerative diseases.

Project_Title: Advanced Optical Instrumentation Laboratory For Large Astronomical Telescope Instrument Development
Project_Description: This project seeks to establish an advanced optical and infrared instrumentation research lab in order to develop next-generation astronomical cameras and spectrographs for existing large telescopes and soon-to-be-built extremely large telescopes, such as the Thirty Meter Telescope.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Remodeling of the Cerebral Vasculature in Health and Disease
Project_Description: The brain is particularly vulnerable to vascular failures. Indeed, neurological disorders that comprise vascular dysfunctions are a leading cause of morbidity and mortality. The proposed research will identify novel therapeutic targets to counter cerebrovascular diseases and to promote brain and mind health.

Project_Title: High Content Screening to Identify and Validate Potential Therapeutic Targets
Project_Description: Dr. Andrewsâ€™ research utilizes innovative high-throughput approaches to measure protein interactions in live cells. In particular, his lab will identify and validate new potential therapeutic targets in the context of understanding cell survival programs to translate this essential knowledge to advance health benefit

Project_Title: Laboratory for Ultrafast Thermo-Magnetics
Project_Description: The laboratory for ultrafast thermo-magnetics is needed to study magnetic phenomena at high temperature and extremely short time scales. The research will enable the development of high-density data storage and advance our knowledge of nanoscale interactions between light, magnetism and heat.

Project_Title: Electron Microscopy for the Engineering of Novel Bactericidal Nanomachines Derived from Bacteriophages
Project_Description: We will develop novel bacterial killing agents, called tailocins, that will be used to specifically eliminate any bacterial strain. The pursuit of this project requires a new electron microscope, which will be purchased through this application. Our work will have impact in treating infections by antibiotic-resistant bacteria, and in investigating the role of the microbiome in human health.

Project_Title: Multiscale Functional Material Modelling for Energy Applications
Project_Description: The requested high-performance computer CLUSTER will contribute to the advancement of ecologically-sustainable energy systems by developing new energy materials that can be utilised in cost-competitive photovoltaic devices and also improve the efficiency of light-emitting devices.

Project_Title: Electro-Functional Membranes: Selective Separations and Catalytic Degradations of Environmental Contaminants
Project_Description: Pollutants of human health and environmental concern are continually infiltrating Canadian waters. This project aims to develop novel nano-composite devices that can efficiently clean our drinking water and decontaminate natural environments, while also destroying many of the most recalcitrant environmental pollutants.

Project_Title: Real-time Aquatic Ecosystem Observation Network
Project_Description: "This multi-institutional proposal will develop a freshwater observation network that will be comprehensive in time (continuous, year-round, real-time data), space (linking researchers, projects, networks and agencies), and level of biological organization (characteristics of water, biota, etc.)."
Keyword: freshwater ecosystems, nutrient dynamics, water quality, biogeochemistry, spatial ecology, community ecology, ecosystem management, biodiversity, ecosystem services

Project_Title: Lab-in-Fibre: Smart glass probing and distributed sensing microsystems
Project_Description: The proposed infrastructure will establish critical 3D-laser fabrication and diagnostic tools with which a multidisciplinary team of researchers can drive open a new field of lab-in-fibre sensing and underpin new approaches in non-invasive surgery, environmental sensing and the Internet of Things.

Project_Description: We propose to build advanced research databases for new radio telescopes, which we will use to understand cosmic magnetism, galaxy evolution, and cosmic explosions. This work will also let us prepare for the forthcoming data challenges of the billion-dollar Square Kilometre Array.

OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Description: The requested HPC equipment, RDC-sited equipment, software, and renovations will enable researchers to analyse previously inaccessible individual-level confidential data that are needed to inform the development of future policies in Ontario and to examine the impact of extant policies.

Keyword: oenology, viticulture, consumer behaviour, sensory evaluation, grapevine cold hardiness, tannin, polyphenolics, flavour, clone/rootstock selection

Project_Title: The Canadian Peoples

Project_Title: New Horizons in Human Cognitive Neuroscience Research at the Brain and Mind Institute

Project_Title: The Good Bugs, Bad Bugs Program

Project_Title: Canadian Additive Manufacturing Network (Can-AMN): A Network for Holistic Innovation in Additive Manufacturing

Project_Description: This proposal will support multi-disciplinary research and development of innovative viroceuticals. Project_Title: Quantum Communications Payload Operations Centre
Project_Description: The infrastructure will enable researchers to build and operate quantum photonic payloads capable of long- distance quantum communication and quantum sensing on satellite and airborne platforms, providing network security for global communications.

Project_Description: The proposed research will enhance our understanding of Parkinsonâ€™s disease, major depression and epilepsy, and how different components of the affected brain networks interact in health and disease. The researchers will deliver improved and expanded treatment options for these neurological disorder
Keyword: Movement disorders, major depression, epilepsy, EEG, MRI, rTMS, biomarkers, personalized therapeutics, MRI-compatible EEG system and components, acquisition and stimulus computers

Project_Title: Tracking Trajectories for Vulnerable Children: Using Data to Understand Outcomes
Project_Description: Child maltreatment can contribute to devastating, long-lasting outcomes. The Ontario Child Abuse and Neglect Data Systemâ€™s (OCANDS 2.0) expansion will enable researchers, administrators, and policy-makers to study child welfare trends over time to better understand effective policies and practice
Keyword: child maltreatment, longitudinal research design, research-ready datasets, child welfare indicators,

Project_Title: Genome-Driven Discovery of Next-Generation Natural Biotherapeutics
Project_Description: Microbial small molecules are a resource from which new biotherapeutics can be developed. This research will leverage microbial genome data to guide the discovery of novel natural products, which will help to uncover new treatment strategies to combat human diseases.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies
Keyword: bioactive small molecules, natural products, human microbiome, drug discovery, bioinformatics, genomics, single molecule real time DNA sequencer, automated DNA size selector

Project_Title: A Testbed for Modern Cloud Storage Research
Project_Description: This research aims to solve a key problem in modern data centres: data storage system inefficiency and low performance. This research will explore three radical designs that can leverage recent advances in hardware technology, and employ storage-specific optimizations to build a more efficient system.
Keyword:
Cloud Computing, Storage systems, low latency computing, software-defined
networks, highly-efficient data center.
Specific infrastructure software-defined networks, non-volatile memory, network-attached cards

Project_Title: Functional and Metabolic Assessment of Small Animal Models of Disease with MRI
Project_Description: The objective of this proposal is to develop non-invasive anatomical, metabolic and functional magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) methods and apply them to novel rodent and primate models of human brain disorders. The use of MRI allows our approaches to be directly translated to human patients.

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Develop Solid State Detectors for High Luminosity LHC
Project_Description: The funds requested are for infrastructure to develop and construct a state-of-the-art silicon particle detector. It will be installed to the ATLAS detector at the Large Hadron Collider in CERN, Switzerland and will be used by Canadian physicists to explore the fundamental nature of the universe in 2026-2036.

Project_Title: Building Open and Interoperable User-oriented Internet of Things
Project_Description: The objective of this project is to develop new technologies required to build an open IoT-infrastructure that better connects people with their environments. This includes the development of core functionality needed to create, maintain and run IoT applications without requiring substantial integration upfront.
Lead_Research_Institution: University of Ontario Institute of Technology

Project_Title: Improving Outcomes for Organ Transplantation: A Live Imaging Platform to Target Immunologic and Fibrotic Events
Project_Description: This program will reveal the underlying processes that result in the premature failure of transplanted organs. Leveraging unique access to living human tissues, the researchers will deliver new drug targets, therapeutic strategies and decision-making tools to improve outcomes for organ transplant recipients.
Keyword: ischemia-reperfusion injury, fibrosis, antibody-mediated graft rejection, inflammation, angiotensin signaling, nanoparticles, immunotherapy, graft loss, intravital microscope upgrade, 3D microscope, vibratome, tissue dissociator

Project_Title: Ultrasound Technology for Image-guided Interventions in the Spine
Project_Description: Dr. Oâ€™Reillyâ€™s research innovates ultrasound technologies to permit non-invasive, non-ionizing therapies for the spine. In particular, her lab will investigate how ultrasound interacts with the spinal anatomy and develop new ultrasonic devices for delivering healthcare treatments for a range of spinal patholog
Keyword: ultrasound therapy, non-invasive surgery, spine, ultrasound phased array, multi-channel beamformer, acoustic field measurement apparatus

Project_Title: Development of Reasoning about the Self
Project_Description: This project will investigate early social cognition and its development across the lifespan, focusing specifically on childrenâ€™s developing understanding of the self, the connection of these theories of the self to social and moral judgment, and how they effect decision-making for the self across the lifespa
Keyword: social cognitive development, development of self, moral development, personal identity, intuitive dualism, ownership reasoning, fairness, folk theories, lab space, computing systems, data backup, experiment software

Project_Description: Dr. Faiyaz Notta will elucidate the cellular and molecular mechanisms underpinning the pathogenesis of pancreatic cancer. Project_Description: The Bruin lab investigates the mechanisms underlying pancreatic Î²-cell loss and dysfunction in patients with diabetes, a growing health crisis in Ontario. Project_Title: Novel Mechanisms of Heart Failure: Discovery to Translation
Project_Description: Drs. Fish and Billia will use the requested equipment to identify new blood biomarkers for heart failure that will enable early detection of the disease. Project_Title: Microultrasound for Diagnosis and Image-Guided Intervention
Project_Description: The goal of the proposed research is to develop new miniature ultrasound (US) probes and advance US beamforming technologies to achieve optimal high-resolution imaging that would enhance image guidance and thus diagnosis and intervention of diseases such as esophageal cancer.

Project_Title: Pedestrian Behaviour Lab: Street-crossing Simulator to Study Risk Factors and Training System for Injury Prevention
Project_Description: Unintentional injury is the leading cause of death for Canadian children and motor-vehicle pedestrian injury is the single greatest issue for school children. Using virtual reality technology the PI will study risk factors for injury and test a behavioural intervention program to improve children's crossing skills.

Project_Title: Nanotechnology Enhanced Multifunctional Carbon Fiber Reinforced Polymer Space Structures
Project_Description: This project will develop a new cost-effective manufacturing technology to make multifunctional carbon fiber reinforced polymer composites that posses non-structural properties by adding carbon nanotubes for spacecraft structure. It will be highly adaptive to existing manufacturing processes and infrastructure.

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Investigate How to Make Children Critical Consumers of Information
Project_Description: This research program will deliver critical insights into how children evaluate and acquire knowledge from digital and online information sources. It investigates how and why children integrate reliable and non-reliable sources to make intelligent decisions about online content.

Project_Title: Materials Characterization System for Developing and Testing Self-sensing Cementitious Composites
Project_Description: This research focuses on developing self-sensing cementitious materials used as sensors for monitoring concrete structures. The sensors developed in this research can be embedded in the structure for local sensing or applied as an overlay or "sensing skin" to spatially map strains and defects.

Keyword: Structural Health Monitoring, Sensors, Cementitious Composites, Self-sensing, Damage Detection, Multifunctional Materials, Nanocomposite, Mixing, Loading, Environmental Conditions, Corrosion, Strain, Resistivity

Project_Title: Translational Emotion Science and Youth Well-being
Project_Description: Dr. Thomassin studies youth emotion skills and applies rigorous, multi-method approaches to understanding the emotion-physiology-behaviour dynamics present in family interactions and psychotherapy. She aims to personalize youth psychotherapies to enhance their effectiveness.

Project_Title: Preclinical Investigation of Novel Therapies for Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia
Project_Description: Advanced technologies to measure lung structure (known as â€œunbiased stereologyâ€) are essential to characterize abnormalities of the lung and to quantify effects of therapies. Project_Title: Neural Control of Reward Seeking and Behavioural Control
Project_Description: This project will investigate the neural mechanisms that underlie the detection and encoding of predictive information. This work will improve understanding of both the neural circuits that control normal decision-making and the ways in which these circuits are altered in mental health disorders.

animal behaviour, instrumental learning, Pavlovian learning, decision-making,

Keyword: regenerative therapy, cardiovascular disease, cell manufacturing, complications of diabetes mellitus, sepsis, diabetic nephropathy, clean room technology, good manufacturing practice, cell production facility

Project_Description: Prof. Peng seeks to deconvolute the chemical components of environmental mixtures and their toxic pathways, by developing untargeted chemical analysis and chemical proteomics assays. Project_Title: Microbial Interactions with Food Components and the Gut Microbiota During Digestion
Project_Description: This platform for microbial community modelling in food and the gut will lead to the design of new functional foods and provide evidence-based support for modulation of the gut microbiota through food components, aiming towards improved health and food safety outcomes as well as reduced food waste.

Project_Title: Surface Characterization Laboratory
Project_Description: This proposal aims to create the Surface Characterization Laboratory (SCL) - a core research platform to collaborate and develop novel innovative "smart" materials with advanced performance and reduced cost for environmental sensing, catalysis, energy applications, and molecular electronics.

Project_Description: CardioLink is a research platform in Cardiovascular medicine whose mission is to improve the lives of patients who undergo or are at risk of requiring heart or vascular surgery through rigorous clinical trials. Project_Description: The proposal will investigate the fundamental molecular and cellular mechanisms that control muscle development and differentiation, and changes associated with disease (aging, cancer, heart disease). Project_Description: Our studies will provide new knowledge on mechanisms of obesity-related immunometabolic dysfunction, known to cause diabetes and heart failure. This new knowledge will advance both diagnostic and therapeutic opportunities.

Project_Title: Immersive Storytelling Lab
Project_Description: The Immersive Storytelling Lab at York University supports globally relevant content creation and technology innovation at the intersection of augmented reality and the moving image, enhancing Ontario's global presence in the area of immersive digital storytelling and AR.

Project_Description: The requested infrastructure will create a world-class interdisciplinary Functional Organic Materials Research Center, leading to new innovative materials for use in wearable electronics, "smart" drug-delivery technologies, for the consumer goods market, and biomedicine.

Project_Title: A Molecular Immunology Laboratory to Elucidate the Mechanisms of Immune Regulation Following Exercise
Project_Description: Dr. Abdul Saterâ€™s research program is focused on understanding the mechanisms through which various physical activity patterns shape the inflammatory response, the identification of novel biomarkers of effective training, and the prevention of autoimmune diseases in genetically susceptible individual

Project_Description: Dr. Ramalho-Santos is a world recognized expert in Developmental Epigenetics & will create new means to assess how the environment shapes embryonic development to impact health in later life. Project_Description: The integrated infrastructure will enable innovation support focused on believable computer-generated characters within all types of screen-based entertainment, providing a global competitive advantage for Ontario companies within significant existing and emerging markets.

Project_Description: Fleming College will create an Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) deployment lab, retrofitting two existing spaces to create a clean room and a lab solely dedicated to sensors and IIoT applied research to develop innovative communication technologies and sensors for multiple sectors and industries.

Project_Title: Centre for Innovative Aquaculture Production
Project_Description: Fleming College will create a Centre for Innovative Aquaculture Production on our Frost Campus in Lindsay. Project_Title: Infrastructure for the Study of Microsporidia and the Co-Evolution of Host-Pathogen Interactions
Project_Description:
My research will investigate the molecular basis of host-pathogen interactions. Using the simple
roundworm, we will study how the ubiquitous intracellular pathogen microsporidia is able to infect and
proliferate inside of hosts, which will reveal mechanisms of parasite pathogenesis.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Multimodal Stimulated Raman Microscopy Laboratory
Project_Description: There is a world-wide need for optical microscopies having no added labels or stains. We propose to build a Multimodal Stimulated Raman Microscopy lab to lead the world in next-generation label-free, chemical-specific optical imaging. We strategically target applications in Brain Health and Mineralogy.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Ambient Intelligence and Interaction: Sensing, Analysis, and Actuation
Project_Description: The Ambient Intelligence and Interaction Lab will develop methods for smart homes and smart vehicles to ambiently monitor users via sensing and wearable technologies, understand the physical and mental states of users, and respond through dynamic actuation of elements within the smart environment.

Project_Title: Liquid Metal Engineering of Lightweight High Strength Low Alloy Steels and Aluminum-Zinc Alloys
Project_Description: The casting of engineering metals forms the base of Ontarioâ€™s manufacturing economy. Project_Title: Synaptic, Cellular and Circuit Mechanisms Underlying the Cortical Control of the Optokinetic Reflex
Project_Description: The neocortex of mammals has an amazing capability of adaptively modulating brainstem-mediated innate reflexes. I will combine functional imaging, electrophysiology, circuit manipulation and behavioral assay to uncover synaptic, cellular and circuit mechanisms underlying the cortical control of reflexes.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Noise-Induced Hearing Loss and Brain Plasticity
Project_Description: Using a state-of-the-art brain imaging system coupled with complex behavioural testing in genetically-modified mice, the requested infrastructure will enable us to uncover the cellular mechanisms that cause altered sensory-perception following loud noise exposure and hearing loss.

Project_Title: A Viral Pathogenesis Laboratory for the Study of HIV Disease and Host Immunity
Project_Description: Using a combination of cellular analysis and virus infection assays, Dr. Guzzoâ€™s research will identify novel interactions between immune cell proteins and the outer HIV virus coat, discovering new vulnerabilities on the virus that can lead to the development of novel HIV therapeutic

Project_Title: Terahertz Technologies for the Detection of Microbes, Allergens, and Foreign Objects in Food Products
Project_Description: The requested equipment will enable University of Guelph researchers to introduce key innovations in terahertz spectral imaging that will significantly improve microbe/allergen and foreign object detection in foods compared to available methods, reducing the number of Ontarians affected by foodborne illness.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Linked Culture Lab
Project_Description: The Linked Culture Lab will be a world-class facility for the production of Humanities and Social Science linked data. As the Web grows users need linked data, the connective tissue between digitized resources, in order to readily sort and synthesize vast amounts of authoritative information.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Adaptable Liquid Chromatography System for Online and Offline Analysis of Trace Atmospheric Water-Soluble Compounds
Project_Description: Dr. Youngâ€™s research program uses and develops novel analytical techniques targeting critical issues in environmental chemistry. A unique, state-of-the-science adaptable liquid chromatography will allow diverse innovative approaches to problems in pollutant fate, urban air quality, and climate chang
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: High Dimensional Single Cell Immuno-Analytic Platforms for Deciphering Immune Complexity in Health and Disease
Project_Description: Immune-mediated diseases such as asthma, rheumatoid arthritis and Type 1 diabetes collectively affect 10% of Ontarians. We will use the requested infrastructure to identify new biomarkers to enable early detection and novel individualized treatments for these diseases.

Project_Title: Understanding the Role of Dipeptidyl Peptidase 4 in Type 2 Diabetes and Cardiovascular Disease
Project_Description: The objective of this proposal is to address the clinical problem of type 2 diabetes and the underlying accelerated risk for death and complications from cardiovascular disease. Identification of novel dipeptidyl peptidase 4 substrates will lead to new therapeutic targets or biomarkers for patients at risk.

Project_Title: A Smart Big Data Analytics and Knowledge Management Framework
Project_Description: The BAM lab will build a smart framework to address real-time processing and storage of multi-modal big data.  The framework will learn to create data profiles, select and execute workflows to extract knowledge, and create hierarchical knowledge graphs with indexing for efficient knowledge retrieval.

Project_Title: The Biological Signatures of Clinical Progression in Bipolar Disorder
Project_Description: The aim of this project is to develop a multimodal predictive signature of mood episode relapse using machine learning algorithms coupled with blood biomarkers and clinical data.

Project_Title: Recording and Manipulating Brain Circuits with Light
Project_Description: During a stroke, the ability of brain cells to function normally is impaired by a blockage or a rupture of a blood vessel within the brain. This project will bring together technologies that will allow us to measure the impact of small strokes, called microinfarcts on blood flow and brain function.

Project_Title: Social Interaction, Language and Culture Laboratory (SILC Lab)
Project_Description: The proposed Social Interaction, Language and Culture Laboratory (SILC Lab) supports research on how multilinguals navigate intercultural encounters. High-quality video recording, storage, and analysis of interaction, will further our understanding of the interactional skills migrants need to thrive in advanced economies.

Project_Title: High Resolution Mass Spectrometry for Longitudinal Personalized Metabolomics Profiling
Project_Description: This proposal aims to create a novel method based on mass spectrometry to measure thousands of molecules in human blood plasma within a single experiment. The project will use a next-generation instrument to support research in personalized medicine and will help to devise tailored therapies.

Project_Title: High-Resolution Mapping of Functional Genomic Elements in Spinal Motor Neurons
Project_Description: This project aims to understand how genes in embryonic stem cells are regulated during neuronal development associated with human health and disease. This research will benefit Ontarians by leading to more efficient stem cell programming strategies for regenerative medicine and disease modelling.

Project_Title: The Tissue Engineering for Advanced Medicine (TEAM) Lab: A Platform for Precision Prevention, Diagnosis, and Medicine
Project_Description: We propose to create the Tissue Engineering for Advanced Medicine (TEAM) Lab to push forward a precision prevention, diagnosis, and medicine approach that could directly impact the lives of 3 million Canadians with respiratory disease by optimizing therapeutic management.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Facility for Assessing the Fire Resiliency of Building Materials
Project_Description: This proposal outlines the equipment necessary to establish a novel, and unique to Ontario, laboratory at York University that will focus on developing fire safe, innovative and sustainable materials for use in our built infrastructure.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Knowledge Syntheses and Clinical Trials of Important Food Sources of Sugars and Cardiometabolic Health
Project_Description: There is an urgent need to develop prevention strategies for obesity and diabetes in Ontario. We propose to conduct a series of high quality systematic reviews and meta-analyses of the role of food sources of sugars and randomized controlled trials of sugar reduction strategies targeting sugar-sweetened beverages in the prevention of obesity, diabetes, and their complications.

Project_Title: Metabolic Vulnerabilities in Cancer
Project_Description: Cancer cells generate energy differently than normal cells. Dr. St-Pierreâ€™s research is focused on identifying metabolic networks that drive the progression of poor outcome cancers, particularly breast cancers, to develop novel metabolic therapies to be used either alone or in combination with other anti-cancer drug

Project_Title: Developing Integrative Simulation-Based Research on Social Work Education & Practice
Project_Description: This project will be the first in Ontario to explore the effectiveness of both face-to-face and technology-enhanced (e.g., AI) simulation for social work education while also using simulation as a research methodology to explore complex elements of social work practice.

Project_Title: Digital Participatory Research and Physical Cultures Lab
Project_Description: This application is for funds to obtain equipment for a Digital Participatory Research and Physical Cultures Lab (DPRPCL) at York University, and presents an opportunity to engage and coordinate stakeholders in DPR around physical cultural studies, sport for social justice, health and human rights.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Biofilm Engineering and Resource Recovery Laboratory
Project_Description: The objectives of this research are to develop new processes and technologies to: (1) make wastewater treatment plants energy efficient; (2) enhance energy recovery from wastewater; and (3) develop dynamic process and energy models of such systems.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: The Centre for Multimodal Sensorimotor and Pain Research
Project_Description: The Centre for Multimodal Sensorimotor and Pain Research will bring together basic scientists and clinicians to investigate how pain is represented in the brains of healthy individuals and those with chronic pain to develop new targeted treatment strategies for chronic pain.

Project_Title: Oxygen is Poison â€“ How Incorrect Modelling of the Human Microenvironment Has Impeded Paediatric Resear
Project_Description:
By obtaining the latest infrastructure for hypoxic cell culture, and cell and tumour imaging, researchers
throughout Ontario will be able to generate innovative research models, make important disease
discoveries, and develop novel therapies that provide better outcomes for Ontarians and their families.

Project_Title: Neural and Physiological Correlates of Bilingual Development Across the Life-Span
Project_Description: The overarching goal of the proposed research program is to understand the typical brain and physiological patterns of monolingual and bilingual acquisition and to understand which patterns are associated with atypical language acquisition in infants, children, and adults.

Project_Title:
Integration of Long-Term Data and Experimental Manipulation to Study Lifehistory
Evolution under Rapid Climate Warming
Project_Description: Climate change has resulted in warmer environments and longer growing seasons. The effects of warming on cold-blooded vertebrates must be understood by integrating long-term monitoring with experiments. Understanding these impacts will help conserve and manage imperiled species in Ontario.

Project_Title: Expanding the Chemistry of DNA
Project_Description: The proposed project will develop high-throughput screening technologies based on DNA encoding, which will facilitate the rapid discovery of novel therapeutics and diagnostic for biomedical research. The technologies will also enable cleaner methods for screening of small-molecule catalysts for synthesis.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Advanced Structure and Spectroscopic Studies of G-Protein- Coupled Receptors
Project_Description: 40% of drugs target a class of membrane protein receptors called GPCRs. The requested infrastructure will allow the Prosser lab to develop an integrated initiative using NMR and other biophysical methods to study the molecular underpinnings of drug action on the adenosine and dopamine GPCRs.

Project_Title:
Facilitating the Resilience of Sexual and Gender Minority Youth: An Infrastructure to Leverage Research and Technology
Infrastructure to Leverage Research and Technology

This proposed Digital Resilience Multi-Media Laboratory will develop cutting-edge digital technology
tools for research and will innovate technologically-enhanced interventions designed to improve the
resilience of Gender and Sexual Minority Youth (GSMY) in Ontario and across Canada.

Project_Title: Improving Sustainability of Urban Infrastructure Systems
Project_Description: In order to guide urban infrastructure decisions, the PIs will use a systems approach to provide a detailed assessment of Torontoâ€™s transport infrastructure and analyze the greenhouse gas emissions of the entire region. These models will investigate and incorporate uncertainty and indirect emission

Project_Title: Imaging and Electrophysiology Equipment for Multi-Neuron Stimulation and Recording
Project_Description: Dr. Prescott studies how pain signals are normally processed by the nervous system and how disrupted processing leads to chronic pain. The requested infrastructure will transform his research by enabling multi-neuron stimulation and recording. This research is crucial for the 1 in 10 Ontarians living with chronic pain.

Project_Title: Collaborative Mobile Interaction Workshop
Project_Description: The goal of this proposal is to create the Collaborative Mobile Interaction Workshop, an innovative space in which new mobile device technologies will be utilized to develop interactive collaborative experiences to support both marginalized communities and first-world tech-enabled environments.
