Project_Title: From Circuits to Behaviour in Health and Disease
Project_Description: The aim of this research is to improve treatments and outcomes for Ontarians with neurodegenerative and neuropsychiatric disease by using state-of-the-art tools to improve our understanding of how specific brain cells and circuits relate to specific aspects of cognition including memory, attention and motivation.

Project_Title: Skin Immune Cells and Pathogens Facility (SPF)
Project_Description: Our project will lead to novel insights on the roles of key immune cells present in the skin and mucosal surfaces called dendritic cells (DC). We will determine the role of DC in infections such as HIV-1 and skin diseases such as eczema and psoriasis, which will lead to novel therapeutic approaches.

Project_Title: Bacteriophages & the Gut Microbiome
Project_Description: The bacterial population in your gut keeps you healthy but, if disrupted, can lead to diseases such as colitis, obesity and depression. In the gut there are many viruses that infect bacteria, to unknown effect. This research aims to identify the roles these viruses play shaping microbial populations within humans.

Project_Title: A Real-Time Digital Simulator to Develop Resilience-Oriented Protection Systems for Power Grids
Project_Description: The frequency and diversity of large disturbances that can disrupt normal operation of power systems have increased. Protection systems of the grid play a major role in preventing disruptions. The proposed research will develop next-generation protection systems to improve the resilience to disruptive events.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Computational Neuroimaging
Project_Description: Major challenges in neurosurgery are precisely localizing the region of the brain to target and determining who will benefit from surgery.  Dr. Khanâ€™s research program in computational neuroimaging is investigating new ways to analyze brain images to aid planning and guidance of surgical intervention

Project_Title: Elucidating the Role of Effector Proteins in Promoting Arbuscular Mycorrhizal Symbiosis
Project_Description: The objective of this project is to identify novel fungal proteins that play important roles in regulating the colonization of roots during the beneficial symbiosis that occurs between plants and mycorrhizal fungi. This project seeks to enhance the productivity of crops while reducing fertilizer and pesticide use.

Project_Title: Chemical Strategies to Modulate Ternary Complex Protein Assembly
Project_Description: The objective of this proposal is to develop synthetic small molecule approaches to cancer immunotherapy. It specifically describes the development of new chemically reactive small molecules that link antibodies and immune effector cells to cancer cells through irreversible covalent bonds.

Project_Title: Advanced Flow Management System for Development of Smart Sensor Systems and E-nose Mapping
Project_Description: The requested infrastructure will create a world-class multi-disciplinary research program that facilitates the move toward early stage detection of biomarkers by developing next-gen smart sensor systems that revolutionize clinical routine practices, environmental monitoring and greenhouse product protections.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Nanophotonic Neuromorphic Computing
Project_Description: The proposed brain-inspired processors will fundamentally leverage the strengths of nanophotonic devices with neuromorphic architectures, to outperform current microelectronics in energy efficiency and computational speeds, which currently limit hardware scaling in digital electronics.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Study of DNA Repair: Biology, Target Validation and Drug Development
Project_Description: The primary objective of this proposal is to perform synthetic lethality screens in human cell lines to identify cancer vulnerabilities that can be pursued in target validation and in early stage drug discovery studies.

Project_Title: Interdisciplinary Research Centre for Sexual and Gender Minority Health
Project_Description: The objective is to develop a research and training Centre at the Dalla Lana School of Public Health, UofT, to conduct community-based research with sexual minority and gender diverse populations (SMGDP). The Centreâ€™s research will address sexual and mental health inequities among SMGD
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Canada Research Chair in Creative Innovation and Leadership
Project_Description: Creativity is vital for individuals, business and economic success, and innovation. This research will explore how creativity can be fostered through work across three core themes: (1) Platforms for creativity; (2) Creative identities and leadership; and (3) Public understanding of creative practice.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: TI-STAR: A Tracking Detector for Experiments with Exotic Nuclei at TRIUMF
Project_Description: Dr. Dennis Muecher requires the requested infrastructure to assemble a state-of-the-art silicon detector, which will be merged with equipment at Canadaâ€™s premier physics lab. It will enable him to answer long-standing questions in nuclear physics, including: how elements on Earth heavier than iron are forme

Project_Title: Catalyst Nanomaterial Synthesis, Characterization and Device Integration Suite for Sustainable Energy Technologies
Project_Description: This research develops nanomaterial catalysts and electrochemical devices that use renewable electricity (wind, solar, hydro) to convert CO2 into fuels and chemicals (artificial photosynthesis), or use hydrogen for zero-emission vehicles (fuel cells) to achieve sustainability of our energy economy.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Mass Spectrometry for Dissecting Phosphonate Tailoring of Bacterial Cell Surfaces
Project_Description: Mass spectrometry sensitively detects molecules and measures their mass. This will allow us to understand how bacteria make phosphonates (molecules with a carbon-phosphorus bond), which will enable discovery of new biocatalysts for green chemistry as well as new antivirulence strategies.

Project_Title: Impact Earth Laboratory
Project_Description: This project aims to use portable instrumentation to gather chemical and mineralogical data to help us understand how rocks are melted during impact cratering events, how impact generated hydrothermal systems form, and how ore deposits form at impact craters.

Project_Title: Laboratory for Epithelial Ecophysiology and Molecular Biology
Project_Description: The goal of the Laboratory for Epithelial Ecophysiology and Molecular Biology is to build a clear and detailed understanding of the molecular causes of cold injury in insects, and to understand the ability of insects to drastically alter their thermal tolerance and survive extreme temperatures.

Project_Title: Synthetic Medicinal Chemistry Platform for Antimicrobial Drug Discovery
Project_Description: This research aims to develop new antibiotics to treat life-threatening drug-resistant microbial infections by conducting medicinal chemistry projects consisting of the design, synthesis, and evaluation of new antimicrobial drug-candidate compounds based on leads identified by McMasterâ€™s microbiologist

Project_Title: Laboratory for the Study of Neuronal Development and Plasticity in Health and Disease
Project_Description: Brain disorders pose a heavy burden on society. Current therapies largely target symptoms and not the underlying disease mechanisms. This project will elucidate the fundamental pathways regulating neuronal growth and plasticity in order to identify novel targets for the development of better therapies.

Project_Title: Laboratory for Experimental X-ray Imaging (LEXI)
Project_Description: Dr. Tanguayâ€™s objective is to develop innovative X-ray imaging techniques for visualizing respiratory and cardiovascular disease. The results of his research will increase the sensitivity of X-ray imaging, reducing its negative effects and extending its application to new diagnostic application

Project_Title: Canada Research Chair in Health Design
Project_Description: This research program addresses designing effective information tools, particularly in the representation of information in specific medical contexts, how users interact with data for complex tasks, and how to present information for dynamic situations.
Lead_Research_Institution: Ontario College of Art and Design University

Project_Title: Deciphering Metabolic Plasticity and Remodelling in the Normal and Diseased Heart
Project_Description: This project will enable the understanding of how the heart regulates its metabolic function and utilizes energy substrates in normal and diseased conditions. This finding will be further tested using a lifestyle and dietary metabolic intervention in order to prevent or treat heart diseases.

Project_Title: Predictive Immune Monitoring Approaches for Precision Cancer Chemo-Immunotherapy
Project_Description: We aim to improve cancer immunotherapy outcomes by examining genetic features of tumours that dictate anti-tumour immune response, for the optimal design of patient specific treatment combinations and biomarkers for clinical monitoring of response to chemo-immunotherapy.

Project_Title: Personalized Genomics of Neurodegeneration
Project_Description: Neurodegenerative disorders pose a devastating medical, emotional and economic burden to Ontarians. The Rousseaux lab strives to overcome such hurdles by using new genome editing and genome-wide screening technologies to develop new therapeutic avenues.

Project_Title: Establishment Of The Memory, Action, & Cognition Laboratory for the Study of Human Sensorimotor Neuroscience
Project_Description: The goal of the proposed research program, which combines behavioural, neurophysiological, and computational approaches, is to develop a better understanding of how information about motor errors shape our decisions during human sensorimotor learning.

Project_Title: Centre for the Study of Brain, Performance, & Music Creation (Centre BPMC)
Project_Description: Thaut, Huang, and Britton propose a collaborative research-creation program that will examine the motor, cognitive, and creative mechanisms underlying performance practice in music. This project will integrate performance data with data on underlying brain mechanisms in performance and creation.

Project_Title: Early Rehabilitation to Improve Patient-Centered Outcomes in Critical Care
Project_Description: The proposed research focuses on effective and creative methods of physiotherapy to help patients in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) stay as strong as possible.  Infrastructure from this application will enable study of the impact of early physiotherapy in the ICU on function and quality of life in ICU survivors.

Project_Title: Towards Personalizing Arthritis Medicine
Project_Description: The University Health Network is requesting two new pieces of equipment to enable the proposed research programs of Drs. Nigil Haroon and Joan Wither. Both researchers will lead innovative research programs to improve the care and clinical management of two debilitating forms of arthritis.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: The Role and Fate of Inorganics in the Industrial Processing of Woody Biomass
Project_Description: The requested infrastructure is needed to help the current and future pulping industry use energy and recover pulping chemicals more efficiently. It will be used to generate new knowledge on the chemistry of heat transfer fouling, including the impact of new technologies in the pulping industry.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Multimodal Assessment of Human Cognition in Laboratory and Naturalistic Settings (Maclan)
Project_Description: The goal of the MACLaN lab will be to explore mechanisms supporting successful learning and achievement of expertise. The facilities will be used to study linguistic expertise and deficits (Jouravlev), learning in STEM (Muldner), and effects of workload on performance (Herdman).

Project_Title: NMR Project
Project_Description: For the faculty and HQP at Lakehead University, a Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR) spectrometer is a valuable resource that facilitates a number of high-quality research projects, many of which have direct economic, environmental and/or health benefits to Ontario and Canada. With access to this infrastructure, Dr. Pedram Fatehi will study the fundamentals associated with lignin reactions and characterizations that are essential in developing processes for producing lignin-based dispersants and flocculants. Additionally, an NMR spectrometer will enable Dr. Stephen Kinrade to progress his studies into the fundamental chemistry and biochemistry of aqueous silicon, which has widespread applications in the fields of material science, health, agriculture, and the environment.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Detecting Interstellar Meteoroids with Radar
Project_Description: The proposed infrastructure is a modern, high power solid state radar transmitter for the Canadian Meteor Orbit Radar (CMOR). This will facilitate detection of interstellar meteoroids in addition to increasing CMORâ€™s sensitivity to weaker meteor showers and slower meteoroid
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Super-Resolution Live-Cell Imaging System for Membrane Contact Site Dynamics
Project_Description: Disrupted communication between organelles leads to diseases. The overall goal of this research is to understand the molecular mechanisms used by organelles to communicate with each other, using the requested highly sensitive super-resolution microscopy system for live-cell imaging.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: G-Protein Coupled Receptor Signalling in Health and Disease
Project_Description: A suite of equipment that will enable us to monitor G-protein coupled receptor (GPCR) signaling in cells, tissue and live animals is requested here. This work will have an impact on developing novel drugs for cardiovascular diseases, colitis, arthritis and cancer to benefit patients in Ontario and beyond.

Project_Title: Spectroelectrochemical Analysis of Heterogeneous Electrocatalysts
Project_Description: The direct use of electricity to drive chemical transformations can offset the intermittency issues inherent in renewable energy sources, maximizing the value of renewable infrastructure. This project will study catalysts for such reactions in an effort to expand the scope of electrochemical synthesis.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Neurocognitive Development of Sensory Processing in Autism
Project_Description: This project aims to (1) understand the neurocognitive mechanisms underlying the development of sensory perception, (2) explore how these processes differ in children with autism, and (3) leverage the plasticity of these underlying neural systems to improve cognition and clinical outcomes in autism.

Project_Title: Using Systems Biology to Investigate Leukemic and Normal Stem Cells
Project_Description: This work will investigate intra and extracellular signalling pathways within the bone marrow that control normal and cancer stem cell maintenance. Our work will both investigate normal healthy stem cells as they age, and how malfunctions in cell signalling events eventually contribute to leukaemogenesis.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Characterize Capillarity and Wetting for Under-Liquid Systems
Project_Description: This project will advance methods to characterize the wetting properties of any material, in any environment. New understanding of under-liquid dynamics will drive materials development for myriad applications, from water repellant surfaces (e.g., for windshields) to anti-fouling coatings (e.g., for ships).

Project_Title: Legal Text Mining
Project_Description: This interdisciplinary project creates an infrastructure for collaborative research at the intersection of law and computer science. It sets up a lab, data hub and server system tailored to the automated analysis of legal texts. It thus facilitates research to make law more accessible and to develop new legal technology.

Project_Title: Single-Cell Characterization of Drug Response in Human Cancer Stem Cell Populations
Project_Description: Acquisition of the proposed state-of-the-art Spectral Flow Cytometer is essential for multi-parametric biomarker analysis. This instrument will provide unique solutions to gain fundamental understanding of drug response, at the single-cell level, in human cancer stem cells and other rare cell populations.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Dark Stars and New Physics from Neutrinos
Project_Description: Beyond the Standard Model: employing high precision simulation and statistical searches in astroparticle physics. The Queenâ€™s Astroparticle Theory group will expand the search for dark matter in stars and at colliders, and uncover new physics from the neutrino secto

Project_Title: 3D Network for Immersive Simulation in Healthcare (3DNISH)
Project_Description: The 3D Network for Immersive Simulation in Healthcare (3DNISH) lab will combine 3D printing and virtual reality to achieve a cost-effective, portable, highly realistic, multi-sensory learning environment for healthcare practitioners and trainees, resulting in fewer treatment and workplace errors.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots
Lead_Research_Institution: University of Ontario Institute of Technology

Project_Title: Tandem Mass Spectrometry Unit for Examining Xenobiotic Changes to the Lipid Metabolome
Project_Description: This proposal requests purchase of a liquid chromatograph tandem mass spectrometer (LC-MS/MS) that will be used to develop a state-of-the-art lipid metabolomics platform to assess the biochemical impact on cellular processes after exposure to environmental factors.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Nanocatalyst Characterization and Performance Studies Platform
Project_Description: Nanoelectrocatalysis can convert excess atmospheric carbon dioxide into useful chemicals such as feedstocks and pharmaceuticals using surpluses of green electrical energy. This research aims to create a framework for nanocatalyst design to obtain high performing, commercially viable systems.

Project_Title: Mitigating Endocrine Metabolic Disease Risk After Spinal Cord Injury
Project_Description: This research aims to improve how spinal cord survivors at increased risk of developing endocrine metabolic diseasesâ€”such as fractures, diabetes and heart diseaseâ€”are diagnosed, monitored and treated in the cli

Project_Title: Understanding the Genomic Architecture of Livestock using Precision Data
Project_Description: By associating natural patterns in the genome with observable traits in livestock, Dr. Baes and her team will gain fundamental knowledge about how DNA regulates measurable phenotypes in animals. The goal is to understand how genetics influences health, activity, and metabolic efficiency of farm animals.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Sub-diffraction Limit Imaging of Matrix Degradation Machines
Project_Description: Using the requested sub-diffraction limit microscope, the applicants will examine how specific components of the molecular machine cooperate to control connective tissue degradation and how their dysregulation contribute to periodontal diseases, fibrosis, and arthritis.

Project_Title: Investigating the Genetic and Biochemical Pathways that Regulate Hemostasis
Project_Description: This research project will discover new genetic risk factors and biochemical mechanisms for cardiovascular disease. This information will be used to predict disease severity before symptoms occur. New targets will be identified for drug development.

Project_Title: Model-Based Acquisitions for Quantitative Magnetic Resonance Imaging
Project_Description: A magnetic field camera will be integrated with an ultra high field Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) system to measure field imperfections in real-time during scanning. This will improve accuracy, enabling completely new measurements that will improve the diagnosis and treatment of neurological disorders.

Project_Title: Experimental Facility for Advanced Robotics and Mechatronics Research
Project_Description: This research aims to develop robust and capable methods for designing and managing the next-generation of industrial robotics - innovations that will help to perform tasks faster, more accurately, and with greater adaptability to changing work assignments and conditions.

Project_Title: Bioinformatics Computing Work Station Suite
Project_Description: The objective of this research program is to identify unique biomolecules in fish which will be used to non-lethally monitor environmental pollution and other types of stress in Ontario freshwater ecosystems. An online database will be created to share our results with scientists, policy makers, and the public.
Lead_Research_Institution: University of Ontario Institute of Technology

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Targeted Isolation of Microbes from the Human Gut Microbiota
Project_Description: Modern lifestyles have dramatically reduced the biodiversity of our gut microbial ecosystem.  This project will utilize a high resolution cell sorter to isolate and characterize important microbes that are â€œmissingâ€ from the western microbiome to determine their biological function and guide the development of novel therapeut
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Immersive and Psychophysiological Testing Suite
Project_Description: The requested funds will be used to set up an immersive and psychophysiological testing suite for the investigation of embodied and embedded cognition. This equipment will enable basic research investigating the decisional processes governing cognitive offloading and its cognitive consequences.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Lung Imaging to Transform Patient Outcomes
Project_Description: The overarching goal of this research program is to develop and validate techniques needed to provide a detailed in vivo understanding of COPD and asthma using pulmonary 129Xe MRI intermediate endpoints that can be used to test new treatments, as well as phenotype patients and personalize their care.

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Elucidate the Roles and Regulation of Membraneless Organelles in Health and Disease
Project_Description: Over a quarter million Ontario residents suffer from neurodegeneration. This proposal aims to develop new treatments by uncovering how membraneless organelles transform into toxic structures and drive neuron death with age. We will achieve this using quantitative microscopy on patient-derived neurons.

Project_Title: Maritime Archaeology Research Infrastructure
Project_Description: This research infrastructure provides Ontario university faculty and students world-class remote sensing instrumentation for underwater survey. This will assist in the mapping, characterization and protection of marine landscapes and underwater heritage in the Great Lakes and surrounding regions of Ontario.

Project_Title: Investigating Mineralizing Processes in Layered Mafic Intrusions Using SEM-based Microtextural and Chemical Analysis
Project_Description: The aim of this proposal is to acquire state-of-the-art micro-imaging equipment that will allow us to advance our understanding and improve targeting of exploration for mineralized layers in layered mafic intrusions, such as the chromite and nickel deposits of the Ring of Fire in Ontario.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Triple Quadrupole Mass Spectrometer
Project_Description: The innovations developed will provide a cost-effective alternative to currently used techniques for medical tests, reducing clinical analysis turnaround times, streamlining processing of biological samples analyses, and providing healthcare professionals with critical test results faster and more accurately.

Project_Title: Mechanobiology-Inspired Regenerative Medicine
Project_Description: This project aims to develop novel biomaterials to combat the pernicious effects of inflammation in arthritis. A Cell and Tissue Mechanobiology Facility will be established to discover inflammation-resolving molecules that can be incorporated in implants to stimulate cartilage repair.

Project_Title: Functional Near-Infrared Spectroscopy for the Study of the Neural Mechanisms that Support Speech
Project_Description: Functional near-infrared spectroscopy (fNIRS) will be used to evaluate brain activity while people speak. fNIRS is a cutting-edge brain imaging technology that will allow us to understand the neural mechanisms that control speech and devise new methods to earlier diagnose and treat speech disorders.

Project_Title: INCUBATOR Lab: Advanced Bioart Laboratory and Multimedia Theatre.
Project_Description: INCUBATOR Lab, in the School of Creative Arts at the University of Windsor, is a unique research/creation facility that functions as both a biotech laboratory and a multimedia theatre and public art venue where audiences can view living biological artworks through a glass wall.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Unpacking the Transition from Suicide Ideation to Attempts in Adolescents
Project_Description: Suicide is a devastating global health problem and is the 2nd leading cause of death among Ontarian youth. Determining why adolescents transition from suicidal thoughts to attempts is critical for suicide prevention. The proposed projects will identify novel cognitive and behavioral processes responsible for this in transition youth

Project_Title: Infrastructure for a Neuroscience Laboratory Studying Co-occurring Addiction and Mental Illness
Project_Description: Substance use occurs commonly in patients with schizophrenia and significantly worsens the disease. Dr. Khokharâ€™s research at University of Guelph aims to elucidate the neurobiological mechanisms underlying such substance use using rodent models, with an eye toward developing new treatment

Project_Title: Bioarchaeology and Forensics Portable 3D Osteology Scanning
Project_Description: The infrastructure consists of 3D scanners and supporting facilities that will be used to create digital models of individual bones, graves, tombs and crime scenes. The infrastructure will be used to study past populations, and to develop best practices for forensic contexts.

Project_Title: Astroparticle Theory Laboratory
Project_Description: The Queenâ€™s University Astroparticle Theory Laboratory will advance Ontarioâ€™s leadership in astroparticle theory and the search for dark matter by facilitating rapid exploration, computation, and international collaboration, as new physics models and search techniques are developed and refi

Project_Title: Driving Innovation: Establishing a Mobile Inclusive Music Theatre Makerspace
Project_Description: The Mobile Music Theatre Makerspace will examine ways to bridge the access barrier evident in the arts, providing opportunity for music theatre creation and production in underserved communities. We will examine ways participation enhances artistic skills and well-being for participants and facilitators.
OIA_AREA: Digital media and information and communications technologies

Project_Title: Eye Movements and Electrophysiological Activity as Markers of Age-related Cognitive Change
Project_Description: My research aims to further our understanding of the cognitive and neural changes that accompany normal human aging. I am requesting an electroencephalography system and eye-tracker that will allow my team to investigate age differences in attention and memory with very precise timing.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Agricultural Soil Health Laboratory
Project_Description:
This project will:
Characterize relationships between soil microbiomes and C and N cycling using innovative techniques.
Train HQP in advanced technical analysis, interdisciplinary methods, and critical thinking. 
Characterize impacts of East Central Ontario agri-food production systems on soil health indicators.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Human Energy Balance and Metabolic Phenotyping Laboratory
Project_Description: The acquisition of the requested infrastructure will enable us to move toward our fundamental goal to improve health by interrogating pathways leading to energy imbalance, evaluating their influence on health in adults and children, and developing interventions that lead to energy balance.

Project_Title: Development of a Scintillating Bubble Chamber
Project_Description: This project supports the ongoing, world-leading research at SNOLAB searching for the nature of dark matter in the universe.  The addition of the new method of detection increases the ability to distinguish signal from background and therefore increases the reach of the dark matter program.

Project_Title: Genomic Portal for Polygenic Molecular Maps of the Brain
Project_Description: The objective of this project is to build an online tool to show where and when certain genes are used in the brain. This will help us understand brain disease by highlighting specific parts of the brain and developmental times. This information can then be used to target experiments and treatments
Lead_Research_Institution: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health

Project_Title: Elucidating Ion Channel Function for Improved Drug Discovery
Project_Description: Errors in protein function cause an array of human disorders. To correct such errors, one must understand protein function in detail. Supercomputers can predict protein motion and illustrate their precise function. The proposed research will use supercomputers to study protein function, leading to improved drug design.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Decoding the Heterogeneity of Reactive Astrocytes
Project_Description: Reactive astrocytes are a diverse group of cells found in all neurological diseases. This proposal aims to understand the heterogeneity of reactive astrocytes after injury. It will address how they are established, their function and how their diversity influences their response to novel strategies for brain repair.

Project_Title: Fault Management Power Electronics Laboratory
Project_Description: Ontarioâ€™s growing demand for electrical energy leads us to develop advanced technologies to integrate more renewable energy resources and improve system efficiencies. This research program focuses on development of novel reliable and fault-tolerant power converters for high-power application

Project_Title: Mitochondrial Dynamics and Function in Stem Cells
Project_Description: Muscle wasting during aging and in muscular diseases is a major cause of disability in Canada, with no effective treatment. Dr. Khacho aims to uncover the mechanisms regulating muscle stem cell function in order to identify pharmacological agents that enhance muscle stem cell function in aging and disease.

Project_Title: Transport Phenomena in Multiphase Reacting Flows for Performance Improvement of Sustainable Energy Systems
Project_Description: The proposed research provides insight into transport mechanisms in multiphase reactive flows due to diffusion, convection and conduction at both macroscopic and microscopic scales. Using the 2nd Law of Thermodynamics it identifies losses in systems which, when minimized improve their efficiency.

Project_Title: Histological and Functional Photoacoustic Remote Sensing (HF-PARS) Microscopy
Project_Description: The proposed program will address the essential needs for a non-contact, non-invasive, safe and accurate technique for imaging oxygen metabolic activity and multi-layered histology-like information for several clinical and pre-clinical applications in the field of oncology and ophthalmology.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Visualizing Epigenomics in Real Time
Project_Description: Uncovering how the epigenome regulates neural stem cells will be of critical importance for developing cell replacement therapies for neurological disease. This proposal will develop cutting edge technologies for tracking changes in the epigenome, as neural stem cells generate neurons and glia.

Project_Title: Metabolic Phenotyping Using in Vivo Indirect Calorimetry
Project_Description: My research program examines energy expenditure as it relates to obesity and associated diseases, in mammals, across their lifetime. I use in vivo (live) models and advanced technology to measure changes as they are happening in real time, allowing for non-invasive continuous quantification.

Project_Title: New Genomic Technologies to Tackle Fungal Pathogens
Project_Description: Pathogenic fungi are a growing health concern and the treatment infections is notoriously challenging. This project will develop CRISPR systems to create genetic mutants in order to explore the mechanisms by which Candida are able to tolerate treatment with antifungal drugs and cause disease.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Measurements of Clouds, Aerosols, Forest Fire Smoke, and Volcanic Ash from a Network of Ceilometers
Project_Description: The 3 primary objectives of this proposal for a network of 5 ceilometers (laser radars) are: 1) to improve our ability to track forest fire smoke and pollutants, 2) to better understand ozone trends by including profiling information, and 3) to improve our understanding of the formation of clouds and fog.

Project_Title: Infrastructure to Elucidate the roles of Mitochondria in Germline and Stem Cell Biology
Project_Description: My research uses both fruit flies and human systems to dissect the molecular mechanisms by which mitochondria, the powerhouse of the cell, function within living organisms. This research will help elucidate the role mitochondria play in key biological and disease-relevant processes
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Platform for Smart Biomaterials
Project_Description: The proposed research focuses on developing smart, interactive biomaterials designed specifically to interact with desired biomolecules or cells in their environment, and simultaneously thwart attachment of non-desired entities. Applications include those in wearable devices, biosensing, and biomedical devices.

Project_Title: Selective Laser Melting of Reactive/Sensitive Metals for Aerospace, Automotive and Medical Applications
Project_Description: The metal 3D printing technology and processing know-how of reactive metals will be enhanced for higher thermal stability and less reactivity in the process. A robust SLM system will be designed and built for this program incorporating innovative laser/laser optics assemblies and build enclosure design.

Project_Title: Primate Behavioral Endocrinology Lab
Project_Description: This application is to fund the development of the Primate Behavioral Endocrinology at York Universityâ€™s Glendon College to contribute to the pressing need to understand how individuals respond to changing physical environments, and how these responses interact with the social environmen

Project_Title: Research Innovation Laboratory for Integrated, Secure and Efficient Wireless Communications
Project_Description: The proposed facility will provide an exceptional research innovation environment for the integrated design and orchestrated operation of 5th generation (5G) and Internet-of-Things (IoT) wireless networks. New technologies developed will support diverse IoT applications of connected industry and society.

Project_Title: Multiscale Mechanics and Additive Manufacturing of New Metallic Materials for Aerospace and Biomedical Applications
Project_Description: The proposed research program aims to use novel manufacturing and mechanical testing methods to create and evaluate new metallic materials with desired mechanical propertiesâ€”especially for aerospace and biomedical applicationsâ€”that cannot be obtained using conventional techniq
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Laser Source for Label-Free Nonlinear Biomaterial Imaging
Project_Description: Funding is sought to purchase a dual-output ultrafast laser system that will be used as the primary light source for the development of a new multimodal label-free nonlinear microscopy system. This platform will incorporate new vibrational imaging and multi-harmonic generation microscopy techniques.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Ancient and Contemporary Environmental Bioindicators Laboratory (ACEBioLab)
Project_Description: Establishment of the â€œAncient and Contemporary Environmental Bioindicators Laboratory (ACEBioLab)â€ at the University of Waterloo (Anthropology) will facilitate innovative research using human teeth to retrospectively and prospectively study how environments impact hea
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Scalable Systems Software for Next Generation Architectures
Project_Description:
The Scalable Systems Software for Next Generation Architectures program will explore systems
software including operating systems, compiler, runtime and application support for future data centers.
This encompasses both scalability and diversity of future computing environments.

Project_Title: Study of Disease-Causing Mutations in NMDA Receptor Genes
Project_Description: The infrastructure will enable the functional evaluation of mutations that cause neurodevelopmental disorders. This requires equipment to characterize neuron physiology, gene expression, and cognition and will improve treatment by determining the best pharmacotherapy among currently available drugs.

Project_Title: Exploration of Pathophysiological Mechanisms Underlying Diabetes and its Related Complications
Project_Description: Diabetic complication, including kidney and heart disease, remain extremely comment despite our ability to manage blood sugars through insulin, resulting in death and morbidity. We will explore the mechanism underlying diabetes and it complication to identify novel therapeutic targets.

Project_Title: Gas-fluid-mineral Interactions: Implications for Element Cycles and CO2 Storage
Project_Description: We will examine the impact of changes in CO2 content in air and the availability of water on reactions that release and take-up nutrients and contaminants. Results of the research will help to develop strategies to reduce greenhouse gas emissions using natural rock and waste products of mining operations.

Project_Title: Investigating the Role of Intracellular Calcium Dynamics on Skeletal Muscle Function in Aged Muscle
Project_Description: The proposal aims to identify novel mechanisms of aging-related muscle weakness and fatigue. Cellular and translational research approaches will be directed toward improving muscle function in the elderly by focusing on the role of altered intramuscular calcium handling on muscle strength and fatigability.

Project_Title: Characterizing a Neural Basis for Crossmodal Plasticity Following Sensory Loss
Project_Description: The requested infrastructure will establish a mechanistic understanding of how the brain is structurally and functionally reorganized following hearing loss. This will provide critical insights into the barriers to successful hearing restoration, and inform interventions that will translate innovation to clinical practice.

Project_Title: Uncovering the Function of Glycans: Examining Interactions with their Biological Binding Partners at the Cellular Level
Project_Description: Cell-surface carbohydrates (glycans) play a pivotal role in health and disease but understanding how they function is challenging. We will use novel techniques to examine how glycans interact with proteins in cells, providing crucial knowledge needed to uncover the specific biology of these vital biomolecules.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Multiphase Processes for Sustainable Energy and Chemicals
Project_Description: The project will optimize reaction pathways for converting renewable materials, advance the understanding of transport phenomena via a combined experimental and modeling approach, and design innovative sustainable technologies to convert existing waste streams to value-added products.

Project_Title: Laboratory to Study and Combat Antibiotic Resistant Pathogenic Bacteria
Project_Description: Antibiotic resistance is a major global health threat. By examining mechanisms of antibiotic efflux in bacteria, as well as the adhesion of bacteria to host cells during infection, Dr. Coxâ€™s research program is exploring two important avenues to develop innovative approaches to combat this growing health crisi

Project_Title: Neuromuscular Genomics and Health Research

Project_Description: Ontario has an active mining industry that provides important economic benefits but also poses some risks to groundwater. Project_Description: The requested infrastructure will enable studies focused on better understanding the biomechanics of ligaments in intact, injured, reconstructed and replacement knee joints. Project_Title: Investigation of Organelle Dynamics and Remodeling Using Lattice Light-sheet Microscopy
Project_Description: This application requests support for a novel imaging technology, called lattice light-sheet microscopy (LLSM). Project_Description: This program will develop novel processes for metabolic engineering of microalgae (composed of renewable chemicals made from carbon dioxide and sunlight) for product overproduction and develop comprehensive biorefining strategies for generating multiple chemical products from a single feedstock.

OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

OIA_AREA: Research and study of the functioning of the human body

Project_Description: We seek to address the growing problem of antibiotic resistance by discovering new antibacterial and anti-fungal drug leads and carrying out cutting-edge experiments to understand how they work.

Project_Description: By measuring the gases produced by boreal forest fires, this project will improve our ability to model the impact of these emissions on air quality. Project_Title: Exercise Oncology and Cognition Lab (EOCL)
Project_Description: The Exercise Oncology and Cognition Lab (EOCL) will identify effective and modifiable management strategies to enhance cognitive health and slow functional decline in cancer survivors in Ontario. Project_Description: Software is needed to operate critical economic, security & safety systems. This research program will develop methods for automated and effective testing.

Project_Title: Facility for Research on Sustainable Energy and Battery Management Systems
Project_Description: The requested equipment will be employed to allow for seamless, efficient and high integration of renewable energy sources and electric vehicles into electricity grids through (i) developing/testing power-electronic converters and protection relays, and (ii) managing/testing batteries and battery packs.

Project_Title: The Centre for Health Behaviours and Well-being in Daily Life
Project_Description: The objective of the Centre for Health Behaviour and Well-Being in Daily Life is to understand the psychological and biological links between health behaviours and mental health. Project_Description: Machine Learning has made massive progress in recent years thanks in large part to advances in computing resources. driving behiour in a standardised, affordable, time-efficient, and safe manner, while maintaining a good level of correspondence with on-road driving.
