Results will inform the design of efficient videoconferencing systems that mediate real face-to-face experience.

Project_Title: A Therapeutic Device for Otitis Media
Project_Description: Otitis media is a prevalent disease in children. In this project, an innovative device for treating otitis media will be developed to replace the current clinical approach of using tympanostomy tubes. The innovative solution will overcome drawbacks of tympanostomy tubes.

Project_Title: Haptic Computing Lab
Project_Description: Haptic technology produces touch feedback like force and tactile cues or vibrations in wearables. The Haptic Computing Lab builds tools to create haptic hardware and software for research and industry applications. The proposed project will provide essential equipment to the Haptic Computing Lab.

Project_Title: Multimaterial Characterization System for Developing and Testing Micro-/Nano-layered Composites and Foams
Project_Description: This research focuses on developing multimaterial nano-structured composites and foams with tailored properties. The resulting engineered structures will be useful as ultra-high barrier packaging films and high-performance foams with ultra-low density and superior insulation properties.

Project_Title: Engaging Technology and People to Achieve Advanced Building Performance
Project_Description: Canadaâ€™s first Zero Carbon certified office building serves as a â€˜living labâ€™ to overcome the failings of many high performance buildings. The study uses advanced building sensors to enable people to make sustainable decisions, add value, and achieve the buildingâ€™s po

Project_Title: GIS-based Virtual and Augmented Reality Tools
Project_Description: This research will develop web and mobile tools for citizens and decision makers to visualize proposed developments and historic sites in urban and rural municipalities in Ontario. The effectiveness of these advanced techniques for engaging public feedback will be assessed.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: MFARR-Asia Computer-assisted Survey Interview and Participatory Video Production Lab
Project_Description: This international partnership will leverage Canadian social science expertise and global human rights commitments to address huge gaps in data and knowledge on sexual and gender minority populations. The project will advance human rights protections for LGBTIQ people in Ontario, Canada and globally.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Live-cell Imaging of Inter-chromosomal Contacts by Confocal Super-resolution Microscopy
Project_Description: Contacts between different chromosomes regulate genes and are important for development. By looking at chromosomal contacts in living cells using an ultra-sensitive microscope, we can better understand gene regulation and genome organization in development and in disease.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Sweptfield Confocal Microscopy for Fast and Low-damage Live-cell Imaging
Project_Description: Purchase of a microscope that uses novel technology enabling low light exposure and rapid imaging, resulting in high-resolution 4D imaging of live cells. The capability will lead to new understanding of cell dynamics, cellular communication, and immune response for the study of cancer and infection resolution.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Enhancing CAR Cell Immunotherapy of Brain Tumours with MRI-guided Focused Ultrasound
Project_Description: Brain tumours are among the most lethal of all cancers. There is hope that genetically engineered immune cells may greatly improve survival. This project will study the effects of combining focused ultrasound with engineered immune cells in animal models of cancer with the aim to improve survival.

Project_Title: Iethiâ€™nihstÃ©nha Ohwentsiaâ€™kÃ©kha (Land), Resurgence, Reconciliation and the Politics of Edu
Project_Description: This Land-centered project focuses on significantly improving education for Indigenous people in Ontario by reframing teacher education programs through critically engaging Indigenous and settler communities around decolonizing and Indigenizing research and teacher education.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Centre for Biomedical Research and Biosensing
Project_Description: About Â½ million of Canadians are affected by neurodegeneration, the healthcare costs are at ~$15 billion each year, and they are greatest for Ontarians. Dr. Marticâ€™s research program aims to develop innovative diagnostic platforms, and identify viable and effective therapies to combat degenerative diseases, improve overall health and reduce healthcare cos

Project_Title: Social Neuroendocrinology Lab
Project_Description: The effects of gendered social experiences on testosterone will be examined with the â€œQ-HuBBSSâ€; Queenâ€™s new Biobehavioural Spectrometry System, providing new insights into a â€œgender-testosterone pathwayâ€ and the interconnections between social experiences and hormonal aspects of o

Project_Title: Extrinsic Control of Neural Precursor Cells: Molecular mechanisms of brain development and repair
Project_Description: Our focus is on neural stem cells (NSCs) in the adult brain and how these cells are established as the brain is built. This proposal will study how the NSC environment tells these cells to become dormant, thereby enabling potential strategies to â€˜wake-upâ€™ these cells for brain repair after brain injury or dise

Project_Title: Resource Management in Heterogeneous Clusters: Maximizing efficiency and guaranteeing security, privacy, and fairness
Project_Description: The long-term objective of this proposal is to design the next generation of mechanisms, methods, and tools that enable intelligent controllers to maximize efficiency and performance of shared computing systems, while guaranteeing security, privacy, and fairness assurances.

Project_Title: DNA Damage and Cellular Physiology: Rewiring for a cure
Project_Description: The proposed research project aims to investigate how cells sense and repair DNA damage and to apply this knowledge to improve cancer therapies. By selectively preventing DNA repair in cancer cells, current treatments can be made more effective with reduced side effects.

Project_Title: Generation of Stem Cell-derived Pacemaker Cells for Biological Pacemaker Applications
Project_Description: This proposal will leverage Dr. Stephanie Protzeâ€™s unique expertise in electrophysiology, heart development and stem cell differentiation to deliver a novel biological pacemaker that can be used to treat patients with abnormal heart rhythm

Project_Title: High Resolution NMR Facility for Structure Elucidation
Project_Description: The requested infrastructure is required to facilitate basic research in chemistry and biochemistry. The three primary investigators work in key areas in which Ontario can be a world leader, including bioanalytical instrumentation, drug development, and materials science.

Project_Title: Rational Design of Multiphase and Multifunctional Renewable-resourced Polymers
Project_Description: The project aims to develop robust multiphase and multifunctional polymeric materials and processing technologies based on sustainable feedstock for a range of material applications. Target applications include coatings, antimicrobial films, structural components, and adhesives.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Spinning Disk Confocal Microscope to Probe Molecular Networks of Cell and Tissue Morphogenesis
Project_Description: The lab of Professor Tony Harris at the University of Toronto is a world leader in defining how molecular complexes organize cell and tissue structure for the multicellular development of animals. The requested spinning disk confocal microscope is essential for probing fundamental mechanisms involved.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: A Protein Engineering Laboratory to Probe and Rewire Cell Signaling
Project_Description: Using newly developed approaches in protein engineering, this project will identify synthetic molecules that can be used to elucidate and reprogram important cell signaling events involved in DNA repair. This work will establish a pipeline for the production and optimization of novel therapeutics for cancer.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Image-guided Magnetic Micromanipulation of Cells and Tissues
Project_Description: This project will use the powerful technique of magnetic micromanipulation to investigate previously unstudied biomechanical properties of organelles, cells and tissues and to explore new frontiers of cancer treatment. This work has a strong potential to improve Ontariansâ€™ health over the longer ter
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Autonomous Docking and Active Perception for Unmanned Aerial Vehicles
Project_Description: Todayâ€™s unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) excel in open space operations but are unable to fly precisely at high speeds or in wind. Prof. Waslander will advance UAV modeling and learning-based control to improve flight accuracy and enable autonomous UAV landing operations on moving vehicles at spee
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Indigenous Life Promotion and Social Action Labs
Project_Description: The Indigenous Life Promotion and Social Action Labs will be a hub for community-engaged research on Indigenous suicide prevention. Integrating cultural knowledge with advanced research technologies, the labs will lead to a better understanding of Indigenous suicide and promote knowledge sharing.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Haven: The Asylum Lab
Project_Description: Haven will be a hub for the storage and comparative analysis of data on global migration. It will provide data access to researchers and students who will use technology to develop innovative methods and new knowledge. It will enhance Ontarioâ€™s leading role in research and policymaking on migration issue
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Defining cancer and immune landscapes in multiple myeloma using single cell transcriptomics and ultradeep DNA sequencing
Project_Description: The researchers will use advanced genomic technologies to study multiple myeloma, a type of blood cancer. They will reveal how individual cancer cells can contribute to disease, and identify the properties of cells that enable them to resist drugs such that new, more effective therapies can be developed.

Project_Title: System for Flame Synthesis, Collection and Characterization of Customized Nanoparticles
Project_Description: This project focuses onÂ scalable synthesis of nanoparticles for use in energy storage, material synthesis, emission sensing and quantification of their impact on the environment to bridge the gap between nanoparticle development in labs and their use in valuable commercial products

Project_Title: Mechanics of Active Fluids and Bacterial Physics Laboratory
Project_Description: An innovative experimental platform is requested to establish the Western Mechanics of Active Fluids Laboratory. It is comprised of two suites: a microorganism culture, selection and growth analysis facility, and a novel microfluidic test facility comprised of two parallel micro-active-fluidic platforms.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Mobile LiDAR System for Geologic Applications
Project_Description: We seek to acquire a mobile LiDAR scanner to determine the fine-scale roughness of geologic surfaces. We will compare these data to radar remote sensing data of the same region, and use our interpretations to determine what geologic processes are occurring on other planets in the solar system.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Evolutionary genetics of plant reproductive strategies
Project_Description: Understanding how organisms interact with their environment is key to protecting biodiversity, and requires knowledge at the gene, species, population, and ecosystem level. Our research integrates across these levels to understand how plants adapt to ecological conditions and climate change.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Attosecond Nanoscopy
Project_Description: Nanotechnology can make static measurements at the atomic scale. Attosecond science is a branch of ultrafast physics that uses intense lasers to study electronic motion. We aim to combine these two research areas, the ultrasmall and the ultrafast, to understand and develop novel materials.

Project_Title: Development and application of isotope tracers for geolocation and surface hydrology
Project_Description: Organic and inorganic materials inherit geographically specific chemical signatures from their environments. This project seeks to use these chemical fingerprints (isotopes) to trace the movement of individuals in ecology and forensic studies, and to investigate ancient and modern river hydrology.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Confocal Imaging Infrastructure for Cell Biology and Biochemistry
Project_Description: We request confocal infrastructure needed for studying animal cells. This will enable researchers to visualize structures within cells, and intricate shape and composition of cells in animal tissues. It will enable discoveries and applications in a wide range of biomedical sciences, aquaculture sciences, and environmental conservation.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Autonomous Mobile Manipulation in Human Environments: Learning Algorithms and Robot Systems
Project_Description: We will enable mobile manipulation robots to (a) learn to manipulate objects based on visual neural program induction and to (b) seamlessly and safely interact with humans in dynamic environments, by predicting their intent and their objectives on tasks of shared control and collaborative manipulation.

Project_Title: Flexible automated chamber system for quantifying the effect of disturbance and restoration on peatland GHG exchange
Project_Description: An automated chamber system will be used to measure peatland greenhouse gas fluxes to understand the effect of climate change, human disturbance and restoration on the ecosystem. This knowledge can be used to manage peatlands as natural climate solutions.

Project_Title: Performance Evaluation of Networking/Computing Resource Management for Wireless Internet of Things
Project_Description: To support research leading to robust, efficient, and intelligent resource management solutions for Internet of Things (IoT) networks, this project will establish a configurable and integrated IoT-edge-cloud infrastructure, develop proof-of-principle implementations and conduct performance evaluations.

Project_Title: Optical and wearable motion capture system for precision medicine solutions in osteoarthritis.
Project_Description: Osteoarthritis (OA) is a degenerative joint disease that results in pain, disability, and reduced quality of life for over 2 million Ontarians. This research will use smart wearable technology to provide clinicians with actionable solutions to improve our standard of care for those affected by this devastating disease.

Project_Title: Computational phenotypes of cancer
Project_Description: My goal is to transform how clinicians treat patients with cancer using a data-driven approach to help move the field from the â€œtreat everyone to help a fewâ€ paradigm towards precision medicine, defining relevant biomarkers to guide targeted treatments and improve human hea

Project_Title: Neural circuit changes in decision-making across the lifespan - relevance to mental health disorders
Project_Description: This project will characterize the neural circuit basis and dynamics of decision-making from adolescence to adulthood and establish how neural circuit function is altered in rodent models of addiction and schizophrenia. This research will reveal new therapeutic targets for early intervention in mental illness.

Project_Title: 600 MHz NMR Spectrometer
Project_Description: Advanced technologies in manufacturing require advanced materials. The state-of-the-art 600 MHz NMR spectrometer will support the development of innovative functional materials containing main group elements for the advanced materials and manufacturing sector of the Ontarian economy.

Project_Title: Minimal Residual Disease (MRD) Research Laboratory to Target Acute Myeloid Leukemia
Project_Description:
The objective of this research is to understand determinants of treatment response in acute myeloid
leukemia based on understanding processes that happen at the level of minimal residual disease after
treatment and facilitate the translation of these findings into novel treatments and biomarkers.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Large-scale Integration and Processing of Structured and Graph Data
Project_Description: This proposal deals with the development of technologies that enable the full exploitation of big data. It focuses both on making data reliable and trustable for analysis and on supporting advanced analysis techniques based on machine learning and graph processing.

Project_Title: Monitoring of emerging water pollutants and development of next-generation sensors
Project_Description: The requested infrastructure will be used to investigate the sources, fate, and transport of emerging pollutants in water and wastewater and to develop new and novel sensors for their monitoring.

Project_Title: Infrastructure for Canadian National Caries Network
Project_Description: Dental caries is the world's leading chronic disease. Our goal is to discover new and novel anti-caries products for better oral preventive dental care and treatment. Our discoveries will contribute significantly to improving the oral health disparity of, and healthcare delivery to, all Canadians.

Project_Title: Zebrafish as a preclinical platform for modeling childhood cancers and rare genetic disorders
Project_Description: Genetic defects lead to many childhood cancers and other rare diseases. The Berman lab has pioneered the use of zebrafish to model how genetic defects cause these diseases. With these zebrafish models, Dr. Berman will uncover mechanisms of disease and identify effective therapies.

Project_Title: Versatile Platform for Measuring Molecular Structure and Conformation of Linear and Branched Biopolymers
Project_Description: The requested equipment will characterize nanoscale materials, providing new insights into their physical properties and function. These new insights will inform the development of new, improved, safer products for food, health and personal care.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Elucidating the basis of photosynthetic adaptations to extreme conditions.
Project_Description: The objective of the proposed research is to understand how extremophilic algae and land plants adapt to permanently cold Arctic and Antarctic environments, with a focus on how low temperatures affect protein function. Ultimately, we seek to improve low temperature productivity of crop plants in Ontario.

Project_Title: Extracellular Vesicle and Patient Avatar Technology Cores for Translational and Clinical Research
Project_Description: Dr. Leongâ€™s mandate is to advance the most effective drug treatment of metastases: by using chicken embryos that grow the patientâ€™s tumour for drug testing and to deliver next-generation blood tests that are highly accurate in identifying patients who have lethal tumours that require immediate treatm

Project_Title: DNA nanotechnology for spatially-programmed immune receptor activation
Project_Description: This proposal will develop DNA nanostructures for vaccine applications. The key unique element is to exploit the programmable nature of DNA self-assembly to control antigen presentation parameters â€“ e.g. spacing, density, valency â€“ as means of shaping the strength and quality of the immune respo

Project_Title: Advanced scanning electron microscope for in situ and liquid-phase electron microscopy study
Project_Description: The requested scanning electron microscope will be used to develop in situ and liquid-phase electron microscopy, which will provide dynamic structural information in key areas, including advanced materials and manufacturing, clean environment and water, renewable energy productions and many more.

Project_Title: Sleep and Human Evolution Lab (SHEL): testing evolutionary hypotheses in a clinical, controlled space
Project_Description: The major goal of this research program is to test hypotheses relating to the evolution of human sleep, physiology, and cognition. In order to accomplish this, Professor David Samson will create a one-of-a-kind sleep laboratory at the University of Toronto Mississauga.

Project_Title: Computer systems support for machine learning and artificial intelligence
Project_Description: This proposal is aimed at bridging a critical gap in Ontarioâ€™s burgeoning machine learning and artificial intelligence landscape through research on advances in computer systems to support running these data-intensive applications at scale on emerging heterogeneous hardwar

Project_Title: Recovery and Recuperation: mobilizing the next generation of GRASAC
Project_Description: The research engages with digitized cultural heritage to: 1) recuperate Great Lakesâ€™ Indigenous knowledge practices, artistic practices and languages, 2) model Indigenous data sovereignty, and 3) support community-directed digital strategies including VR, AR, 3D digitization and mesh networkin
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Ottawa Pre-clinical PET/CT Imaging Core
Project_Description: The infrastructure request is for a state-of-the-art, small animal hybrid PET-CT scanner. This critical infrastructure will accelerate biologic and therapeutic research in heart failure, arrhythmias, inflammation and its link to chronic disease, regenerative medicine, and brain-heart interplay.

Project_Title: Chemspeed Automated Chemical Synthesis System
Project_Description: This project will build an Automated Chemical Synthesis System (ACSS), which will combine automated robotics platforms with artificial intelligence (AI) to create a self-driving laboratory. The resulting rapid feedback will reduce discovery time, changing the pace of research and development in chemistry.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Water and Ice Research Lab, the sequel: A whole new WIRL.
Project_Description: This project focuses on the use of state-of-the-art autonomous aircraft and underwater vehicles to explore remote and inaccessible environments that are rapidly changing due to cumulative impacts of climate and land-use change, and to improve land-use management, conservation and protection in Ontario.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Infrastructure to study the movement ecology of declining avian taxa.
Project_Description: Birds are defined by movement. The proposed research will use biotelemetry to study the movement of declining bird species in southern Ontario and the Canadian Arctic. Understanding factors that influence movement is critical to predicting how these species will respond to environmental change.

Project_Title: Charting Diversity in Brain Maturation.
Project_Description: Holland Bloorview is developing appropriate research infrastructure suitable for high-throughput MRIs of children and youth with disabilities. This work is essential for informing personalized approaches to removing boundaries faced by individuals in Ontario and Canada-wide growing up with disabilities.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Advancing detection limits and in situ isotopic chemical chromatography for astroparticle and geochemical research.
Project_Description: We will develop new methods for determining metals and their isotopes at ultra-trace concentrations. These advances are needed in areas such as mineral exploration, toxic metals in the environment, and in the development of ultra-pure materials for space science research.

Project_Title: The Northern Environmental Geoscience Laboratory.
Project_Description: The proposed Northern Environmental Geoscience Laboratory at Queenâ€™s University will support climate change adaptation and vulnerability assessment initiatives in the north to improve our ability to predict the terrestrial impacts of climate change on ecosystems and people in northeast Canad

Project_Title: Molecular and Biochemical studies of Giardia intestinalis.
Project_Description: The proposal is for instruments that support and expand our research on the gene expression and biochemistry of the freshwater parasitic protist, Giardia intestinalis. Our research will lead to a more complete understanding of this enigmatic parasite, and may lead to improved treatments for giardiasis.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Neural substrates of cognitive influence over sensory-motor control: Implications for learning and stroke rehabilitation.
Project_Description: The proposed research will use a new, innovative, non-invasive method to study the brain to enhance our knowledge of how the brain learns new skills. This will allow for the development of new approaches to recovery of behavior following acquired brain injury, such as stroke.
OIA_AREA: Research and study of the functioning of the human body

Project_Title: Stress-mediated trophoblast proliferation: adaptation or pathology?
Project_Description: This proposal will investigate the ability of the placenta to respond to stress in order to gain insight into complications of pregnancy, including preeclampsia and intrauterine growth restriction; so that new treatments may be identified and developed to result in the healthiest moms and babies possible.
OIA_AREA: Research and study of the functioning of the human body

Project_Title: Transmission Electron Microscope.
Project_Description: Materials innovations are essential to realizing useful quantum technologies and next generation batteries. This CFI supports the development of a transmission electron microscopy centre, which will provide insight into new paths to materials and device fabrication.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Neuroscience & Learning Disorders.
Project_Description: The objective of this research is to examine how social deficits impact learning difficulties in infants and children with autism. Infants who are at risk for autism will undergo assessments for stress and brain imaging. Models will be developed to identify risk factors for learning problems and inform interventions.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Investigating the effect of physical activity during classroom instruction on student attention and learning.
Project_Description: Dr. Fenesiâ€™s research will inform how physical activity impacts the brain and mind, and the corresponding effect on studentsâ€™ ability to focus their attention and learn. Her research will also identify the optimal duration, types, and frequency of physical activity that best support classroom learn

Project_Title: Engineering materials: advancing in-situ electron diffraction and imaging techniques (Engine-Tec).
Project_Description: Electron imaging and diffraction techniques will be used to develop novel approaches to characterize the performance of metals and alloys used in the core of CANDU nuclear reactors. This research will focus on measuring localized stress fields that controls the nucleation and propagation of cracks in metals.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Readout The Answers.
Project_Description: The objective of this research is to answer the remaining questions about the Standard Modelâ€™s most elusive particle, the neutrino. This will be achieved by developing and building the data acquisition infrastructure for the DUNE experiment and using it to search for sterile and non-standard neutrino
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Dector Prototype Units for Long-Lived Particle Searches.
Project_Description: The identification of dark matter is among the foremost unresolved questions in modern physics. This research program aims to construct sub-unit prototypes for a new detector called MATHUSULA to find dark matter particles and study cosmic rays. Its performance will provide critical guidance for the construction of the full-size detector.

Project_Title: Source to Sink Transport Dynamics: Exploring Evolution of Deltaic and Deepwater Systems Through Physical Modelling.
Project_Description: An experimental facility will be built to physically model deltas, coastlines, and deep-water environments to explore fundamental controls on the delivery of sediments from river networks and enhance predictions of environmental change and interpretations of the geologic record.

Project_Title: Graphite Furnace for Catalytic Prolysis of Biocarbon from Waste Biomass: Engineering Biographite for Biocomposite Uses.
Project_Description: The graphitization of plant material hasÂ huge potential to generateÂ highly desired graphitic materials for industrial scale applications in materials, electronics, energy storage devices, etc. The requested high temperature pyrolysis furnace (reaching 3,000Â°C) will be used for graphitization of biomass wastes

Project_Title: Next Generation Polymeric Microparticles for the Treatment of Osteoarthritis.
Project_Description: This proposal aims to develop novel therapeutics for osteoarthritis, which will be achieved by designing microparticles that can be injected into the joint of an affected patient, allowing for the long-term release of the drug. Since the drug is localized to the diseased site, it will minimize any off-target drug effects.

Project_Title: Advanced graphene oxide-based porous materials for water treatment.
Project_Description: The goal of Dr. Yousefiâ€™s research is to develop advanced and efficient Point of Use (POU) water treatment devices as economic alternatives to centralized water treatment for remote areas and disaster zones. He will use advanced nanomaterials to improve the efficiency and reusability of POU device

Project_Title: Design and Development of Diagnostic and Therapeutic Drug Candidates.
Project_Description: The proposed research aims to design and prepare novel therapeutic tools and diagnostic tools that have potential to improve prevention, early diagnosis and management of diseases and help paving the way for personalized medicine.

Project_Title: Nanostructured membrane fabrication and characterization facility
Project_Description: We will engineer new membrane technologies that dramatically improve the efficiency of separation processes used in the water, oil and gas, and chemical industries. Membranes patterned on the nanometer-scale will surpass current limits of membrane performance for cleaner industrial processes.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Characterising sound and vibration-based communication systems
Project_Description: The requested equipment will enable an understanding of how animals use their bodyâ€™s biomechanics to appropriately filter sensory information. Such body-based filtering provides a mechanism for intelligent behaviour at low computational cost, and can inform the design of autonomous robots and sensor

Project_Title: Enabling toughening and damage tolerance in adhesive bonding of multi-material lightweight structures
Project_Description: The aim of the project is to enable the fabrication of damage tolerant, lightweight, adhesive bonded structures used in the automotive and aerospace industries. The long-term goal is to encourage these industries to use adhesives more broadly, thereby maximizing benefits such as reduced CO2 emissions.

Project_Title: Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence for Smarter IoT
Project_Description: This research program will develop technologies and algorithms for communication-aware distributed machine learning and artificial intelligence in smart cities, smart health monitoring, augmented reality, as well as other areas where distributed sensing, localization, authentication, and deep learning is required.

Project_Title: Advanced Design and Measurement Facility for Adaptive Metamaterials
Project_Description: This proposal will create a modern design and measurement facility to conduct research in support of universal wireless high-speed internet. The research targets 5G and satellite technology, using electromagnetic metasurfaces to develop better antennas, thus increasing data transmission rates.

Project_Title: Protein crystallization and molecular characterization platform
Project_Description: In response to the antibiotic resistance crisis, Dr. Little's lab will identify key determinants contributing to bacterial pathogenesis for the development of vaccines or new antimicrobial disruption agents that will benefit Ontarioâ€™s healthcare system and agriculture industr

Project_Title: In vivo neurochemistry laboratory
Project_Description: Our proposed research will visualize changes in neurotransmitters and neuromodulators during cognitive tests to uncover the neurochemical basis of brain diseases. This research will contribute to understanding how changes in neuronal activity contribute to behavior in health and disease.

Project_Title: Integrative sociobiology and pollinator health: wild bee ecology, evolution and genomics
Project_Description: Dr. Rehanâ€™s research focuses on sustaining native bee populations through a combination of landscape ecology, comparative genomic and sociodemographic approaches. Her research combines the interplay of nutritional ecology, pathogen susceptibility, and social environment on bee healt

Project_Title: A Non-Invaisive Approach to Visualizing Tumour Growth in Vivo Through Space and Time
Project_Description: With access to leading optical technology, researchers throughout Ontario will be able to monitor and evaluate brain tumour initiation, growth, progression and response to treatment in living models, accelerating the translation of basic and preclinical studies into therapies for patients across Ontario.

Project_Title: Equipment for Advanced UAV-based Hyperspectral Remote Sensing
Project_Description: The objective for this project is to develop methodologies and framework for the use of Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV)-based hyperspectral remote sensing in precision agriculture, including sub-field scale nitrogen estimation, crop biomass estimation, crop disease detection and weed and crop discrimination

Project_Title: Plant phenomics: Understanding trait covariation across scales
Project_Description: This research asks why plant traits covary across biological scales (from individuals to species) and how this affects plant performance. It will examine the coordination among carbon- and water-use traits in leaves, stems and roots of model and crop species, and in temperate tree species of commercial value.

Project_Title: Climatic Human Factors & Performance Laboratory
Project_Description: The Climatic Human Factors Performance Laboratory will assess acute and chronic responses to extreme environments during exercise and occupational challenges and evaluate the effects on performance along with the genetic and molecular characteristics of positive response.
Lead_Research_Institution: University of Ontario Institute of Technology

Project_Title: Cardiac Regeneration and In Vitro Disease Modelling
Project_Description: The proposed research will help us better understand the mechanisms of heart disease and how it is affected by diabetes. It will also test new regenerative medicine techniques to try to repair damaged hearts using stem cells and engineered blood vessels.

Project_Title: Elucidating the Evolutionary Enhancement of Enzymatic Efficiency
Project_Description: We aim to determine how enzymes evolve to efficiently accelerate reactions. Our studies of enzymes over evolutionary time will show the specific mechanisms by which these catalysts develop. This will facilitate efforts to engineer novel industrial biocatalysts of useful and challenging chemical reactions.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: kinadas: walking about on the land
Project_Description: The proposed project will create a mobile working environment that privileges land-based research-creation and Indigenous knowledges, connected to experiences from Black, Indigenous and People of Colour communities to create work crucial to an understanding of relational demographics.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development
Lead_Research_Institution: Ontario College of Art and Design University

Project_Title: Cerebrovascular Hemodynamics in Health and Disease
Project_Description: The requested infrastructure will establish a laboratory at McMaster University that studies important connections between the cardiovascular and cerebrovascular systems, how exercise paradigms impacts risk of diseases related to brain blood vessels, and how to improve utility of imaging tools.

Project_Title: Environmentally controlled growth system and molecular phenotyping platform for plant immunity research
Project_Description: My research will identify and characterize important genes regulating the plant salicylic acid pathway at elevated temperature through mutational, gene expression, and inter-species analyses at different temperatures. This would unravel the significant impact of temperature on plant immunity and disease.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: LC-TOF MC for Enhanced Chemical Containment Risk Characterization
Project_Description: A standalone liquid chromatography time-of-flight mass spectrometry (LC-TOF-MS) system is requested for the development of a state-of-the-art metabolomics platform to study pollution in Ontario water.
OIA_AREA: Chemical and biological experimentation for the future

Project_Title: Sensory-Cognitive Listening Assessment to Transform Hearing Loss Outcomes
Project_Description: Older people with hearing loss often disengage from listening, which puts them at risk for social withdrawal. We will integrate different levels of inquiry â€“ from neural function to listening experiences in social situations â€“ to create metrics that capture disengagement before it manifests as social withdra

Project_Title: Optical Imaging in the Pre-Clinical Setting
Project_Description: This proposal examines how bacterial pathogens resist host defenses, which we use as an entry point to drug discovery where the goal of therapy is to re-sensitize bacteria to the action of host immunity. Drug-resistant infections and Crohnâ€™s disease are the focus, which are both urgent problems in Ontari

Project_Title: Decision Making Laboratory.
Project_Description: The Decision Making Laboratory at the Ivey Business School will facilitate studies of the decision-making experience in multiple contexts using triangulated quantitative and qualitative measures.
OIA_AREA: Social and cultural investigation and development

Project_Title: Membrane Remodelling by Positive-Sense RNA Viruses: Molecular Mechanisms and Cellular Responses.
Project_Description: Emerging viral infections are a major public health threat and are currently untreatable. Our objective is to identify novel antiviral strategies against emerging viruses in the positive-sense RNA virus group. We characterize how these viruses exploit cellular factors to replicate within their target cells.

Project_Title: The Trent Social Relations, Attitudes and Diversity Lab.
Project_Description: Researchers will harness cutting-edge technology to study complex human behaviours and interactions, including love, affection, prejudice and violence. Specifically, research on persistent violence directed at the LGBTQ community as well as predictors of well-being in same-sex relationships will be conducted.

Project_Title: Immersive Interaction and Morphological Control for Continuum Robot Systems.
Project_Description: This project investigates continuum robots, operated or monitored by a human through an immersive interface. These worm-like robots will reach the unreachable in a non-destructive, minimally invasive manner, and perform operations and manipulate objects with unprecedented accuracy and dexterity.
OIA_AREA: Development and creation of investigation spots

Project_Title: Psychosis Research Lab: Assessment of Biological, Psychological, and Behavioural Factors Associated with Psychosis.
Project_Description: The Psychosis Research Lab will use multi-method assessment to develop novel therapeutic approaches to treat schizophrenia-spectrum disorders. Based on cognitive-behavioural and cognitive remediation therapies, these approaches will improve recovery from psychosis.

Project_Title: Dynamic Nanoimaging of DNA Damage and Repair in Neurodegenerative Diseases.

Project_Title: Greenhouse Gas Emission Free and Energy Efficient Power Technology for Information Systems
Project_Description: Information processing centres (IPCs) consume large amounts of energy to run and maintain computer systems, servers and associated components. How much power is available, and how it can be reliably and continuously supplied, is of intense interest to IPC owners and their engineers, suppliers, investors and ultilities. Researchers at Queenâ€™s University propose to significantly reduce energy consumption while increasing the energy generation capability of green technologies tailored to IPCs. Their goal is to increase increase efficiency by 15-20% within the next five years and develop new commercially viable IT-specific renewable energy power systems, including wind and solar-based systems. In the process they intend to reduce green house gas emissions by millions of tonnes a yea
